skill_description: Referencing the original word lists from the original Speak and Spell hardware, this interactive game will test your spelling for a number of commonly misspelled words.  The original four levels are available.

Star Wars: Choose Your Destiny – A Han and Chewie Adventure takes place pre-Episode 4, when Han and Chewie were running smuggling missions. In this adventure, they’re working for Jabba the Hutt. They run into trouble with the Empire as well as some shady characters on a jungle planet. Along the way, you’ll help them make choices. Will they rescue the hostages? Dump the cargo? Or do whatever it takes to save their skins? You can unlock more adventures by purchasing the Pack of 3 Star Wars: Choose Your Destiny adventures. All the adventures are available through Freetime Unlimited subscriptions. The Pack of 3 Star Wars: Choose Your Destiny adventures includes, “A Luke and Leia Adventure,” “A Smuggler Mission,” and “A Podracer Mission.” Copyright © & TM Lucasfilm Ltd. The Amazon Math skill offers an easy and fun way for kids to practice math. Kids choose their current grade level from Kindergarten through 5th grade and can choose from a variety of topics, including addition, multiplication, comparing, rounding, and more! Kids complete sets of 5 math problems and can choose to focus on a specific topic or do a mix of topics. Alexa keeps track of scores and progress and can increase or decrease the difficulty of a topic as needed. Alexa can even take turns counting with you, by any number, and will celebrate when you reach counting goals.   Once you're in the skill, you can use the following commands to help you navigate: Repeat/Say it again - Hear the question again Change Topic - Alexa will switch to a different, grade-appropriate topic Harder/Easier- Alexa will move you up or down in difficulty List all Topics - Find out all the different topics you can choose from What's my score? - Get the total score for the session Change Grade - If another user from a different grade wants to play

Welcome to Short Bedtime Stories by Al Summers Media. This skills offers a selection of short bedtime sleep stories. Want to launch the skill? Just say: "Alexa, open bedtime stories and list all stories" or "Alexa, open bedtime stories and play all stories". At the moment the skill offers the following bedtime stories:  1) Tyler meets Santa 2) Joy teaches kindness 3) Danny's ocean adventure 4) Jessica bakes cake 5) Dental heroes 6) Alfi blows bubbles 7) Goldilocks and three bears 8) Little Pirate Joe 9) Cinderella  10) My Travelling Adventures  (kids decide how the story develops) 11) Halloween Treasure Hunt  ✶✶✶✶✶✶✶✶BRAND NEW✶✶✶✶✶✶✶✶ Play a personalised children's story - ask for example "play personalised story" or "play my personal story". Please be aware that only English names can processed... NEW FEATURES: ► say "spin the wheel" to play a random bedtime story ► say "Alexa Next" to skip a story ► say"Alexa Repeat" to repeat a story ► say "Alexa Previous" to go back to the previous story Please leave a rating if you love this skill. Please report bugs via our website. We welcome your feedback!

Did you know that a blue whale's heart weighs 400 pounds? Test your knowledge of wild and weird facts about animals, people, places and more in Nickelodeon’s No Way That’s True skill on Alexa! Go head-to-head with up to 4 players in this crazy trivia game that zips you around the globe. Along the way you’ll encounter SpongeBob, Lincoln Loud, and more of your favorite Nickelodeon characters, visit some of the world's most amazing places, and learn crazy facts about the planet we all call home. It's the game that will have you saying, "No way that's true!" To enable the skill, simply say "Alexa, open No Way That’s True.” To quit, just say "Alexa, quit" anytime during the game. The No Way That’s True skill is for kids and fans aged 6+.  No Way That's True is also part of a FreeTime Unlimited Subscription.  For more information on FreeTime Unlimted, go to https://www.amazon.com/freetimeunlimited.” For issues, questions, or comments please email us at amazonalexa@nick.com. Bamboo Learning is the 1st comprehensive learning program for children in grades K–5 on Alexa. With up to 6 users per family, Bamboo Learning brings together all of the great exercises and content from our award-winning Alexa skills—Bamboo Math, Bamboo Books & Bamboo English—in a fun game-like experience. Bamboo Learning reflects standard US K–5 curriculum. Bamboo Learning includes math, phonics, spelling, grammar, vocabulary, listening comprehension with 20 free and 30 subscription-based audiobooks (with more added each month). Bamboo Learning now includes a human-narrated Panda to welcome kids to Bamboo Learning each day, praise them for correct answers, and gently nudge them to try again, if they're incorrect. Panda also celebrates their accomplishments; children earn Bamboo tokens (complete with sound effects), which keeps kids interested in returning to learn more using Bamboo Learning’s self-paced activities. Images and text are available for Echo Show & Fire TV products. BOOKS & LISTENING COMPREHENSION Bamboo Learning offers 20 free and 30 subscription-based books for kids to listen to and follow along with words and pictures on screen-based Alexa devices like Echo Show and Fire TV. New books will be added each month as part of the Bamboo Learning Plus subscription. Please see "What's New" section or our website for a full list of books. Bamboo Learning listening comprehension exercises incorporate questions into 50 narrated books (as of May 2021) for grades K–5. These exercises help children improve their ability to understand elements of the books, including characters, plot, and details. Listening skills are key to improving reading and writing. On screen-based Alexa devices, text and pictures enhance the experience.  LANGUAGE ARTS Bamboo Learning Language Arts program follows the curriculum used in the majority of elementary schools throughout the US, including thousands of phonics, spelling, grammar, and vocabulary exercises in the form of word games. Examples include: Phonics: Which word rhymes with BOUNCE – ANNOUNCE or BEHIND? (Grade 2) Spelling: In the word CAT, is the last letter T? (Grade 1) Grammar: This movie is exciting. Which word is an adjective? (Grade 3) Vocabulary: If you add the letters -ER at the end of the word PAINT, what word do you get? (Grade 2) MATH Bamboo Learning Math offers tens of millions of math problems for kids in grades K–5, with 3 learning modules – Numbers (e.g., counting), Operations (+, -, x, ÷), and Measurement, Time, & Money. Problems feature a fun mix of animals (e.g., tarantulas, octopuses, penguins) & objects (e.g., flashlights, alarm clocks, umbrellas). Children with screen-based Alexa devices see images that enhance the experience. Examples include: Numbers: What number goes between 6 and 8? (Kindergarten) Operations: 4 penguins are watching a sunset. 3 zebras joined them. How many animals are watching the sunset? (Grade 1) Measurement/Money/Time: How many days are in March and April combined? (Grade 4) - MULTI-USER: Up to 6 users, so each child can learn at their own pace. Free version includes most of the basic and many of the grade-level activities for each subject, and 20 free books for kids in K–5. Bamboo Learning Plus subscription (which starts with a 14-day free trial) includes full access to all basic, grade-level, and advanced activities in all subjects, and 50 books (as of May 2021), with more added each month. - IS BAMBOO LEARNING FREE? Yes! Anyone can use Bamboo Learning to use basic and some grade level activities at no cost. Bamboo Learning Plus (an optional subscription) provides the complete Bamboo Learning curriculum including all basic, grade level, and advanced activities. - REVIEWS If you love this skill, give us a customer review in the Alexa skills store! - CHECK OUT OUR USER GUIDE AT guide.bamboolearning.com. - ACCOUNT LINKING Parents can sign up for a Bamboo Grove (“dashboard”) account at grove.bamboolearning.com to follow kids' progress

Give your kids the excitement of a bedtime story that changes every time they hear it. Not only that, the kids themselves decide how the story will turn out. Just start the skill, listen to the story and choose at the appropriate time how it shall continue.

From the creators of Question of the Day, Kids Quiz poses fun new questions everyday for children ages 5-12, from animals and science to brainteasers and fun facts. Kids Quiz is a great way for children to reinforce their learning and discover new things about the world.  Parents: visit our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/AlexaKidsQuiz to read FAQs, interact with other users, and provide feedback.

Abre la skill y Alexa te dirá automáticamente cuántos días faltan para todos tus eventos próximos. Alexa también puede recordarte la fecha exacta de eventos específicos. Esta skill se creó usando un Skill Blueprint. Tus solicitudes para esta skill no se comparten con el desarrollador de la skill.

Turn any time into story time with Amazon Storytime, a free Alexa skill for kids ages 5-12. Explore a collection of more than a hundred short stories featuring lively full-cast recordings. Kids can choose from story categories including bedtime, silly, family, friends, and more. Or spin the magic story wheel for a surprise set of stories. Check out super fun original stories from LEGO®, or go on an interactive story adventure with Ripley’s Believe It or Not. Try Saying Things Like: “Alexa, ask Amazon Storytime to tell me a Ripley’s story.” “Alexa, ask Amazon Storytime to tell me silly stories.” “Alexa, next,” to skip a story. “Alexa, start over,” to go back to the beginning of a story. “Alexa, pause,” to take a break, and “Alexa, resume” to continue listening.

This skill is for all ages. It is sure to keep even the brightest young minds entertained and challenged. Make tooth time easy with this morning and night tooth brushing show for kids. When it’s time for your family to brush teeth, say “Alexa, start Chompers.”  Kids will hear jokes, riddles, stories, fun facts, silly songs and more, that’ll keep them giggling — and brushing — for the full two minutes that dentists recommend.  To help your family build good brushing habits, Chompers counts the times you brush and celebrates your streaks. Chompers will have kids reminding parents that it's time to brush, not the other way around! Recommended for tooth brushers ages 3 - 7.  Chompers is presented by Gimlet Media.

Additional rounds are also available through Freetime Unlimited subscriptions. Let’s teach our kids (and ourselves) to be thankful for every drop of water. Let them know how much water is wasted every day, and how to conserve it. Let them know how millions of people around the world have to walk miles, to just get a bucket of water. With an interesting , kid-friendly quiz format, WW teaches our kids and us, about how precious water is, and the ways we could adopt, to conserve this priceless resource. Look forward to your feedback – chatandsharefeedback@gmail.com You can say: "Alexa, open Water Wise" "Alexa, start Water Wise" "Alexa, launch Water Wise"

Get ready to dance to these fun, kid-friendly beats as you and your child explore imaginary worlds together. When the music stops, practice freezing like statues. Then, get moving again when the music starts. Your child can dance their way through the alphabet or the Amazon Rainforest, learning a little about each subject along the way. This is a great game to play after school, during playdates, at parties, on rainy days, or when your child has some extra energy and needs to move. If you enjoy Freeze Dance, please leave us a review. Thank you! Music: DLSounds and Ben Sound

skill_name: Red Riding Hood - Interactive story for kids
skill_description: *** UPDATE*** We have added support for Māori language - now you can learn and entertain at the same time! From the Twisted Tales library, Red Riding Hood is an immersive interactive story for kids that lets you – the listener – play the part of Red Riding Hood OR the Big Bad Wolf, living the stories from their point of view! Red Riding Hood is walking through the woods, taking a lovely meal to her ailing grandmother. She has been warned about the big bad wolf, but when she meets a shaggy stranger, he insists he is the big good wolf. Should she trust him? You decide. Will she survive the meeting? It’s all up to you. Currently there are two stories available. To play them, just say: “Alexa, open Red Riding Hood” or “Alexa, open Hansel & Gretel” Twisted Tales include: * Multiple choices and alternative endings * Possibility to play story from Red Riding Hood AND Big Bad Wold point of view * Professional voice acting * Immersive music * Flawless sound effects Māori version of the story was funded by Perpetual Guardian Trust New Zealand. FEEDBACK: Please leave us a review if you like our skill, or send us an email with your suggestions and what new stories would you like us to make at contact@sonnar.nz.  For more stories please visit www.sonnar.nz/twisted-tales or search for sonnar interactive in your Alexa app.

skill_name: Sleep Superpower: Sleep Missions for Kids
skill_description: Sleep Superpower by Stop, Breathe & Think features sleep missions to help kids slow down, get cozy and ease into sleep. Designed for the Echo Show, the missions include fun, animated videos. It also works with audio only Echo devices. Email us at support@stopbreathethink.com with feedback! To get started, say "Alexa, open Sleep Superpower". You will then be prompted to say “Play Mission” to begin a mission chosen by us. Alternatively, you can say the name of the mission you would like to play or say "List Missions" to list available missions. Available Missions include:  - Bulldog Finds His Quiet Place  - Butterfly Bodyscan  - Rock-a-bye  - Night Crickets Finally, you can always say “Alexa, ask Sleep Superpower for Mission” to jump to another mission. And to exit say, "Alexa, exit". So go on a sleep mission and strengthen your sleep superpower! If Sleep Superpower helps you fall asleep, please give us a 5-star rating. And if you don't think it's worthy of 5-stars, please let us know how we can make it better by emailing us at support@stopbreathethink.com. WHO WE ARE: At Stop, Breathe & Think, we believe that taking a few minutes each day to feel the calm is as important as regular exercise. If we can help more of you regularly find peace of mind, we’re doing our part to help make the world a better place.  - Winner of the 2017 Webby People’s Voice Award for Health & Fitness  - Over 3,000,000 downloads and counting on iOS and Android! OUR OTHER SKILLS:  - "Meditation Timer" for timed soundscapes  - “Guided Meditation” for over 60 daily guided meditations  - “Sweet Dreams” for sleep sounds and meditations SUPPORT: We'd love to hear from you! If you have questions, comments, or feedback, please email us at support@stopbreathethink.com.

Math Machine is a simple game that challenges both your concentration and math skills. Once you launch the skill, you can choose from two activities. Math Facts can be used to drill basic math operations, such as "5 plus 6" or "4 times 8". Just say, "Play math facts," or "Test addition facts up to five." Operations Challenge will test your concentration and math speed. You will start with a simple problem, such as "5 minus 3," but each successive problem will add another operation. How far can your skills take you? Just say, "Play the operations challenge," or "Try the operations challenge with five operations" to get started. If you didn't hear a problem, just ask Alexa to repeat it. NOTE: For the Operations Challenge, all operations should be performed in the order in which they are spoken, so 5 - 2 * 3 should be calculated as 5 - 2 = 3, then 3 * 3 = 9.
The fun stories told by Story Time are full of questions that will test the listener's skills in various areas such as math, currency, time, and listening comprehension.

The Muffin Man skill is an Interactive Song for Children of all ages! Children's singer Megan Schoenbohm sings one verse of the original Muffin Man song, and then four verses of a new version of it (written by Megan and Chatty Creations), the fun part is that you can choose who you're going to meet in the song!! You can always ask for your favorite character out of the 9 characters, for example, say "Alexa a cat". We hope you have lots of fun! MusicTimeWithMegan.com ChattyCreations.com Be sure to leave a review! Please send us an email, if you have any comments or questions for us: chattycreations@gmail.com

Let your Smart Speaker help you potty train! The Pull-Ups® Voice Skill for Smart Speakers has potty reminders, positive reinforcement, and Disney character interactions to help make potty training a fun bonding experience. Pull-Ups® Voice Assistant Makes Potty Training Fun, Fast & Easy for Everyone!   - Big Kid Fun: Motivate your toddler to potty train by calling Disney characters and and playing songs to celebrate milestones   - Mom's Must-Have Potty Training Assistant: Get Daily Tips, answers to potty training questions, and potty break reminders right on your Smart Speaker. You can even use the App on the go.   - Encouragement and Bonding: This is a unique experience for you & your Big Kid. Create a partnership that will celebrate all the milestones of growing up!   Things You Can Ask the Pull-Ups® Voice Skill “Call a Disney® Character” so your toddler can hear encouragement from their favorite characters   “Set a potty break reminder” so you don’t have to stop and ask your toddler   “Give me a tip of the day” so you can get the support you need to guide your child through potty training   “Celebrate” or “Play the handwashing song” to play music that reinforces your Big Kid’s actions

Buzz in with Echo Buttons in this fun trivia game show. This game requires at least 2 Echo Buttons. Echo Buttons offer a new way to play game skills through your compatible Echo device. To learn more just ask "Alexa, what are Echo Buttons?"    Get two to four contestants together to star in this game show! In each round, Alexa will ask a question. Players will buzz in with their Echo Buttons to answer. As you play, Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The contestant with the most correct answers wins!   While playing, you can say "Alexa, repeat that" to hear Alexa read the question again. You can also say, "Alexa, what are the scores?" to hear a score report. You can say, "Alexa, help!" to hear about what you can do next. You can say, "Alexa, start over" if you want to abandon the current game and pick up from the beginning. At any time you can say, "Alexa, stop" to halt the current game. If you had already started a game, Alexa will remember where you stopped and pick back up from the last question asked, when you next launch the skill. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

Play an interactive adventure-themed story with sound effects and prompts. Get ready for laughs and giggles as players fill in the blanks. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

This holiday season, Alexa has a special surprise to delight the little ones - the chance to call Santa Claus himself. Kids can say, "Alexa, open Call Santa Claus," and Alexa will connect them to Old St. Nick and all his friends at the North Pole.   Callers can sing carols to help Santa’s musical sleigh fly, laugh along with squabbling elves, and even build a snowman with Blitzen the reindeer. Created with Christmas cheer at the heart of every story, these festive adventures aim to have your family ho-ho-ho-ing along with Santa and his friends.   Households with Echo Show devices can also view Santa and company on video, where magical animation brings the winter wonderland to life.   Troubleshooting: Some customers have reported Alexa calling a contact which includes "Santa" in the name, or reaching a different Santa voicemail skill instead of Amazon's Call Santa skill. If you experience either of these issues, try saying, “Alexa, Open Call Santa Claus” instead.

Would You Rather for Kids is a simple but addicting game where you make a choice between two lighthearted and silly situations. Will the rest of the world agree with your decision? You have to try the skill to find out! Enjoy hundreds of fun, family-friendly questions to keep all ages entertained for hours. With multiplayer mode, you can enjoy the game with your entire family or play by yourself. Play Would You Rather at a sleepover, at a party, on family game night or simply to pass time. Questions are continually added so check back often for updates. Editions include: -Standard  -Magic -Hogwarts -Animals -Superhero -Christmas Points and Leaderboard:  Earn two points for each question you play. It doesn't matter if your response matches the majority. There is one account for the family, so points for your parents, siblings count towards your account and help you climb the leaderboard faster. More reason to play with family. Remember Tuesday and Thursday are double point days. Earn 4 points for each question you play.  While playing you can access the leaderboard by saying "Alexa, show my leaderboard"  Badges: You can earn the Explorer and Expert badges for each edition. You can get an "Explorer" badge on completing the first round of an edition. You earn the "Expert" status once you play 5 rounds of the same editions. While playing you can access the badges by saying "Alexa, my badges"

You decide what happens next in these classic Choose Your Own Adventure® stories brought to you by Audible. In each professionally narrated story, you are the adventurer who makes the choices that decide your fate. To help you on your journey: Say “go back” to go back one scene if you don't like the choice you made. Say “start over” to start your current story over from the beginning. Say “change story” if you are ready to switch to another story. Say "skip" if you want to skip part of the story. If you need help, just ask. Stories available from the original series: *Newly added* Mystery of the Maya by R. A. Montgomery Space and Beyond by R.A. Montgomery The Abominable Snowman by R. A. Montgomery Journey Under the Sea by R. A. Montgomery Adapted to audiobook by Audible based on original titles © Chooseco LLC. Features: 40 total endings in Mystery of the Maya 27 total endings in The Magic of the Unicorn 43 total endings in Space and Beyond 28 total endings in The Abominable Snowman 37 total endings in Journey Under the Sea Progress tracking and automatic bookmarking for resuming later Choose Your Own Adventure® is compatible with FreeTime devices if you grant permissions to the skill at parents.amazon.com or visit the FreeTime section of the Alexa app. Issues? Feedback? We want to hear from you. Send us a note: audible-cyoa@audible.com

The Unofficial PJ Masks Facts skill gives you random facts about your favorite PJ Masks characters and villains. This skill is not endorsed or created by Disney or its affiliates. It is an unofficial fan created facts skill about the PJ Masks.

Daily Math helps you to sharpen your math skills in a simple playful way that the kids would love. It works even better on display devices. Typical usage Just say "Alexa Open Daily Math" to get started

Kids: Take your naughty friends, siblings or parents to Kids Court and get a ruling!  When someone's being unfair or nasty, bring them to court and let Lexy judge!  Judge Lexy's verdicts are final and everyone has to obey!  You can now play the judge in other kids fights! Just say "Alexa, Be a judge" to take the judge's oath and hear those little villains. Will you be merciful or send them off to jail? Come back for a new trial every day! **NEW** Now supporting echo show, echo spot, and fire TV! Play on these devices for an enhanced experience. --------------------------------------------------------------------------- Parents: No more "she pushed me/he started it". Send the kids to Kids Court and let Judge Lexy decide. While you rest, they will learn some basic facts about the US judicial system. They will learn to present their cases coherently and speak up for themselves. And when they don't listen to YOU, take them to court and watch THEM execute crazy verdicts!  Thanks for playing! If you enjoyed Kids Court, please a moment to leave a 5 star review and tell your friends <3 for more fun: www.playkidscourt.com email: Pretzel.Voice@gmail.com music by: https://www.bensound.com, zaplast

skill_name: Math Facts - Math Practice for Kids
skill_description: Math Facts gives you practice for addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Just open Math Facts, choose your operation, and you'll get a set of five questions. If you get all five right, expect a silly surprise. This skill makes math practice fun for the whole family! The skill has been refined through extensive kid testing for accuracy and precision in listening to responses. It's perfect for math practice while you're staying home. Try it out and see the results!

Zebra Facts is a skill that teaches toddlers and kids wide range of interesting facts about Zebras. By default, the skill will play until you stop it. To stop the skill, say "Alexa, stop.” To resume it again, say "Alexa, resume." Please leave a 5-star review if you love this Skill. Your 5-star reviews will encourage us to keep making more great skills for kids.

No need to be sad or feel lonely ever again. This obedient dog will lighten up your mood. Make him do whatever you feel like! Unlike the real dogs, it listens to you and it won't require any food (just electricity) nor make your house messy. It helps to keep intruders away! - Try saying "Bark at him" or "Scare him away". Actions supported currently: Howling  Growling Woofing Whining  Barking Licking Scaring Biting You can say: "Alexa, launch Virtual Dog" "Alexa, Ask my dog to bark at him" "Come on, whine for me" "Bite him " "Lick her"

skill_name: Yes or No Response Decision Helper
skill_description: Gives a Random Yes or No answer

You start by selecting your cute and funny Fluffy Friend. Your goal is to take care of it and level it up. It's simple - your Fluffy Friend needs knowledge and fun to grow. Interact with it, find out what it needs, what it likes, and play along! As you explore the rich content of this kids skill with your Fluffy Friend, you gain experience points and level up your Fluffy Friend. You can do a lot already from the start: play number games, practice times tables, listen to interactive stories, play quiz games or sing nursery rhymes together, and much more! At first your Fluffy Friend can only do a few simple things, but as it levels up it becomes able to do much more and the challenges become harder and more diverse. You will want to keep coming back to play with your Fluffy Friend to keep discovering and learning new things. Don't worry if you have to leave and come back later - your Fluffy Friend will be waiting for you, ready to pick up where you left it. Take good care of your Fluffy Friend! Here are a few things to try once you open the skill and choose your Fluffy Friend: - Play a story - Play animal quiz - Play music quiz - Play some music - Practice times tables - Tell a joke - What is my score? - What can I do? This skill's content is suitable for all ages.

Bamboo Books offers narrated stories and exercises to help children improve listening comprehension. For children using Alexa screen-based devices like Fire tablets and Fire TV, Bamboo Books offers text and images to permit reading along with Alexa. (NOTE: If you are using Fire tablets, make sure to say “Alexa switch to Show Mode.” before saying “Alexa, open Bamboo Books.” so that you can experience all of the text and images.) Bamboo Books includes selections from classic children’s books & stories such as: Level 1 • The Little Red Hen by Florence Williams • Little Red Riding Hood by Unknown Author • Rumpelstiltzkin by Unknown Author • The Story of the Three Little Pigs by Unknown Author • The Story of the Three Bears by Robert Southey Level 2 • The Story of Doctor Dolittle by Hugh Lofting • The Elephant's Child by Rudyard Kipling • The Jungle Book by Rudyard Kipling • Peter Pan by J. M. Barrie • The Tale of Peter Rabbit by Beatrix Potter Level 3 • Alice's Adventures in Wonderland by Lewis Carroll • Adventures of Huckleberry Finn by Mark Twain • The Railway Children by Edith Nesbit • Treasure Island by Robert Louis Stevenson • The Wonderful Wizard of Oz by L. Frank Baum Exercises and questions help children practice listening for characters, plot, setting, details, and more. There are 3 different levels to offer an engaging experience for pre-readers, early, intermediate, and advanced readers. Even adults will enjoy practicing their ability to remember details using only their listening skills. WE ALSO OFFER A GUIDE TO USING BAMBOO BOOKS AT guide.bamboolearning.com. Keep checking back periodically for more books! BENEFITS OF OPTIONAL ACCOUNT LINKING AND BAMBOO GROVE ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Parents can sign up for an optional Bamboo Learning account by going to Bamboo Grove at grove.bamboolearning.com. Bamboo Grove is where parents can go to follow their children’s progress, including correct and incorrect answers for each book, and badges awarded. After signing up for a Bamboo Learning account, parents will need to link that account with the Bamboo Books Alexa skill. Parents can do this by opening the Alexa App (or going to alexa.amazon.com) and then searching for Bamboo Books within the skills section of the Alexa App. After finding Bamboo Books in the Alexa App, select “Settings”, and then “Link Account”. A screen with a Bamboo logo will show up. Sign in to the previously created Bamboo Learning account and Bamboo Books will be linked. After that, visit Bamboo Grove at grove.bamboolearning.com to view progress.

"Ahoy, me hearties!" Whether you're getting ready for "Talk Like a Pirate Day," or you're just in the mood for some swashbuckling fun, Alexa is ready to help you learn "pirate speak."  When you open this skill, Alexa will tell you the meaning of a pirate word or phrase, and then she will give you the chance to use the pirate saying the way a real "buccaneer" would. If you're tired of being an ordinary "landlubber," let Alexa teach you to talk like a pirate--you'll be ready to take to the high seas in no time!  You can say: "Alexa, open Talk Like a Pirate" "Alexa, start Talk Like a Pirate" "Alexa, play Talk Like a Pirate" Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, to encourage us to keep making more great skills.  Thanks!

Specifically for kids aged 5-9 and has no need for an account.  We will play a nursery rhyme, kids movie or show tune, or a song they've likely learned in PreK through 2nd grade and they have to finish the next logical phrase or stanza.   If they get it right, the song continues and they win that round.  After 6 songs, they can earn badges and are ranked with all other users that day but only if they do well.   I've had a load of fun playing it myself while building it and I bet your kids will too! Also built to tolerate the chatter that often accompanies the excitement of the song played or the screeching that comes with getting it right or wrong.

As someone who has a child with sensory processing disorder, we often need to utilize different strategies to help calm down during a meltdown or in crowds. These are similar strategies Occupational Therapists use to help people with anxiety and sensory processing disorders. When helping our child with these strategies, we found that it also really helped adults as well.  These strategies help with anger episodes, anxiety, meltdowns, tension. Even if you do not have any of  diagnoses, this information can still be very helpful. Anytime any of these situations begin, just say "Alexa, open sensory seeker," and a helpful strategy will be provided to help calm down. Between our echo devices and echo auto, it makes using this skill helpful in many areas. Bedtime Story for Kids where we perform a new story for your children every week. Oh no! A mean old wizard has stolen all the fairy tales and taken them to a secret island far away! Can you help them remember who they are to break the spell that holds them captive? So you've memorized how many tiles and cracks you have in your ceiling and you're laying there in bed trying to fall asleep. Nothing is working though?  Enter "Counting Sheep" - a simple, sleek little sheep counting skill that helps anyone young or old, from toddler to senior or in between to fall asleep by using their amazon echo device to count some sheep! One by one, the sheep gracefully float over the wooden fence. It sure beats staring at the ceiling.  Be sure to leave a 5-star review!

Features: • Have your parents connect their Beanstack account to Alexa for easy logging • Quickly log finished titles by voice • Log for One Reader or All Readers in an account at the same time • Log books you’ve read before, or new books

Hello, it’s Elmo! When children ask to “Open Sesame Street,” they’ll be able to speak directly to their furry red friend. Elmo's so excited! He can’t wait to share all the fun things he knows about the letter of the day. And Elmo's always up for a good game of Hide & Seek, with silly sounds as clues to where he’s hiding. Sesame Street encourages kids to engage in imaginative play, learn new words, and just be giggly together with the voice of a familiar, fun-loving friend. We hope your preschoolers have fun playing and learning with Elmo. We’re learning all the time, too, and really welcome the input of families like yours. Try Saying Things like: “Alexa, open Sesame Street” “Alexa, ask Sesame Street to call Elmo” “Alexa, ask Sesame Street to play Hide & Seek” "Alexa, ask Sesame Street to find Elmo"

skill_name: Kid-do Multiplication - Times Table Learning Skill
skill_description: Kid-do Multiplication is a fun based multiplication learning skill for children of all ages, particularly those from 3 to 12 years. Skill provides features for learning, practicing and testing the time table or multiplication skills. Skill will start by using any of the following phrases.   'Alexa, start Table Robo' 'Alexa, open Table Robo'  'Alexa, launch Table Robo' Skill will ask user to select the mode i.e. Learn / Practice / Test. In learning mode, Alexa shall recite the times table for any chosen number from amongst 1 to 20.   In Practice mode, Alexa shall ask times table for any chosen number from amongst 1 to 20. Alexa shall offer help when asked. Also Alexa shall automatically provide the correct response when repeated mistakes are made. In testing mode, Alexa shall ask user to select a difficulty level from 1 till 5. Lower difficulty levels are suitable for relatively junior students and higher levels for senior students. Test shall comprise of 10 questions being asked one after the other. Best of Luck Kid! Good fun and great learning to you!

Simply choose your grade level (1-8) to get started. The words are taken from the Scripps spelling bee word lists.  You can ask to repeat the word, definition, etymology, and example sentence. Speak each letter loudly and clearly as there’s only one chance to spell it correctly just like the Scripps National Spelling Bee! Like you, I am a parent of a child who loves to learn words and compete in his school spelling bee. I would spend hours giving him words to spell and realized there should be an Alexa skill for this. After several sessions with Beewhiz on Alexa, my child can now beat me at this skill!

skill_name: Hangman Game - with display for Echo Show
skill_description: The classic hangman game with display. You may pick a category upon start or simply say "Start" to pick a random category. Guess the word by saying letters (e.g. "A"). If your Alexa device doesn't have a screen, you may still check your hangman progress by saying "Progress". When the game ends, you may check the definition of the word by saying "Dictionary".

Bamboo Math is designed to reflect elementary school curriculum covering grades K through 5. Bamboo Math is divided into three learning modules – Number Sense (counting, place values, number patterns), Operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division; word & number problems), and Measurement, Time, & Money (linear, volume, money, calendar, time). Learning modules are divided into units. Each round of math exercises includes problems from more than one module. Problems feature a fun mix of animals (e.g., tarantulas, octopuses, penguins, & more) and objects (flashlights, alarm clocks, umbrellas, & more). Children with a screen-based Alexa device (i.e., Echo Show, Fire TV, Fire tablet) see images that enhance the learning experience. --- MULTI-USER SUPPORT: Families can set up accounts for up to 6 users, so each child can learn at their own pace. The free version includes most of the basic and many of the grade level problems for each math learning module, for children in Kindergarten through 5th grade. The paid subscription (which starts with a 14-day free trial) includes full access to all basic, all grade level, and all advanced math exercises in all K–5 Bamboo Math learning modules. Content includes math exercises and problems from leading content providers. --- IS BAMBOO MATH FREE? Yes! Anyone can use Bamboo Math exercises at no cost. --- REVIEWS If you love this skill, please let us know by giving us a customer review in the Alexa skills store! --- MORE INFO ON BAMBOO MATH Examples of exercises & problems include: Number Sense - What number goes between 6 and 8? (Kindergarten) - Is 785 odd or even? (4th Grade) Operations - 4 penguins are watching a sunset. 3 zebras joined them. How many animals are watching the sunset? (1st Grade) - What is 325 - 456? (5th Grade) Measurement/Money/Time:  - Which object is bigger -- a mountain or a flower? (Kindergarten) - How many days are in March and April combined? (4th Grade) Note: To make things easier for children to understand, we refer to each grade level as climbing one of the following trees (K – Banana Tree, 1 – Coconut Tree, 2 – Apple Tree, 3 – Oak Tree, 4 – Pine Tree, 5 – Lemon Tree). As children progress through the units in Numbers, Operations, and Measurement, Time, & Money, they advance from lower to higher levels on each tree. --- WE ALSO OFFER A GUIDE TO USING BAMBOO MATH AT guide.bamboolearning.com. --- BENEFITS OF OPTIONAL ACCOUNT LINKING AND BAMBOO GROVE Parents can sign up for an optional Bamboo Learning account by going to Bamboo Grove at grove.bamboolearning.com. Bamboo Grove is the dashboard where parents can follow their children’s progress in Bamboo Math. After signing up for a Bamboo Learning account, parents must link that account with the Bamboo Math Alexa skill using the Alexa App (or going to alexa.amazon.com), and then searching for Bamboo Math within the skills section of the Alexa App.

Welcome to Scientist Escape the room 7 by Dr. Song.  <This is Pandemic edition!> You wake up and find yourself turned into Santa. You have to escape the room with Rudolph. You have use clues and think scientifically to handle this situation! Look around to collect clues (information), check objects that you find and Use the clues together with a simple scientific knowledge. Once you understand the clues, you carry out your brilliant way for this situation! To start, just say "Alexa, open scientist escape the room 7" <Contact info: If you have any question or suggestion, please leave comments.> <About this version> This game is free to play now. <How to play> If you want to look around to collect clues, Say "Look forward" or "Look right". (Forward, up, down, right, and left) If you find something and get more information(clue) from an object found, Say, for example, "Check the door". If you want to use an object you found on the other object, Say, for example, "Use the red key on the bathtub".  If you want to listen to the instruction again, Say, "Help me". If you need a hint, Say, "Give me a hint". If you need more time, Say "More time". You can leave, stop, quit the game anytime by saying "Stop" or "Quit".

Green Stuff takes you on adventure to solve environmental problems and help our dear planet Earth and its inhabitants. skill_name: Spelling Game for Kids by Magoosh
skill_description: Magoosh Spelling Game is a fun, turn-based spelling game, where you can learn definitions and practice spelling 200+ words at the fifth-grade level. It's created by Magoosh test prep, an online company dedicated to providing students with fun and helpful educational materials. Just ask, "Alexa, play Spell the Word ", and she'll ask if you want to start the game. She'll give you a word and you will then spell the word together, alternating letters. For example, she might say something like this: "The word is momentum. It means 'the force from moving'. The first letter is 'm'. What is the next letter?" You would then respond with 'o', and she would continue with 'm', and you would continue with 'e', and so on. Don't worry if you get a letter wrong! She'll ask you to repeat your answer in case she misheard you. If you get it wrong 3 times, Alexa will give you the correct letter and ask if you want to either start the word over or move on to a new word. That's it! Have fun! Please leave any feedback in a review, constructive or positive, and we'll do our best to make this skill better for you! You can also find us in the iTunes and Android app stores, and you can tweet the developer @albwhoo or tweet the whole team @magoosh.

Musical Chairs, Freeze Dancers, Musical Bumps and More! Bored? This compendium of active and super fun family games will keep everyone entertained for hours. If you love Musical Games, please let us know! Feedback is always welcome at hello@topvoiceapps.com

Mornings are hard, but mornings with kids are harder. Parents have enough to deal with on their own when they start the day, but with a little help from Ready Freddy, they will have time to address their own needs (like sleep) and be able to teach their kids independence. Ready Freddy is an Amazon Alexa skill created to make mornings less hectic. Ready Freddy feels like a game to kids and an extra set of hands to parents. When launched, Ready Freddy guides children through morning tasks like brushing their teeth and getting dressed. Designed for kids in kindergarten to third grade, the skill is easy to start and exciting to use. Kids will love their new morning sidekick, and parents will love having time to swallow their coffee. Ready Freddy helps parents take the mornings back and gets kids out the door faster than ever before.

Come back each week to listen to the new message. 4C Kids is the children's ministry of Four Corners Church. We create safe, fun, and engaging environments to partner with parents in raising kids who love Jesus. We offer classes for infants through 4th graders that meets during each service at Four Corners Church. Our services are at 9:15 & 11:00 am at 7740 Service Center Drive, West Chester, OH 45069.  You can pause and play by saying "Alexa, pause" and "Alexa, resume." Just say "Alexa, stop" when you're done for the day. When listening to podcasts you can say "Alexa, shuffle" to shuffle the playing order, or "Alexa, loop" to loop the current episode. You can also ask for previous and next episodes by saying "Alexa, previous" and "Alexa, next".

NEW - Dinosaur Buddies episodes available alongside Magical Places and Animal Magic. NEW - Reminders feature to help get your little ones off to bed. Say “Alexa, ask Bedtime Explorers to set a bedtime reminder for 7pm”. Hello little explorer. Did you go an adventure today? Did you explore anything new? Did you have a lot of fun? Exploring takes lots of energy doesn’t it? So when its time to slow down, settle down and snuggle down, it’s time to become a Bedtime Explorer.  Bedtime Explorers are imaginative meditative journeys for children guided by mindfulness coach, Amy Taylor-Kabbaz, and calming sound design by Max Gosford. Each Bedtime Explorer episode invites children on an imaginative journey, teaching them easy-to-learn meditation techniques that they can use to fall asleep, or to just relax when the big things in life pile up on the little people we love. We hope your little ones love listening to Bedtime Explorers. We hope you grown-ups love them too!

Without the pack there's a one game per day limit. ****** I'll ask you five multiple choice questions. If you think the answer to a question is option two, then wake Alexa and say "two". When you answer you must say "Alexa" first, otherwise I won't hear you ! **** Commands to use when playing **** • "I don't know"/"Next"/"Skip"  - If you don't know the answer, some of the questions are quite tricky! • "Repeat" - If you want to hear the question again, only one repeat per question though. We hope you enjoy playing the quiz as much as we enjoyed making it.

Color Together is a skill where kids can color a picture with Alexa. Simply... 1) Choose a picture. Examples: -  house -  boat -  shapes -  teacher ~~More pictures are on the way. 2) Tell her what section to color. Examples: -  roof -  door -  sail -  square -  circle -  hair -  necklace 3) Tell her what color to make it Examples: -  blue -  fuchsia -  violet -  emerald and see how the picture turns out. It's a fun skill filled with quirky poems, interesting jokes, and feel-good music that will make coloring even more enjoyable for your child. Some of the commands your child can use are: -  Let's color the house -  Color the door brown -  What pictures can we color -  I want to color another picture -  I'm done Coloring activities provide young children with an opportunity to develop fine motor skills, eye-hand coordination, and better focus. The back and forth verbal exchange with Alexa gives kids a sense of companionship while they color. Color Together is available to color any day, at any time.

Welcome to Trivial Pursuit Family Edition by Hasbro, the game where kids and grown-ups get to test their trivia knowledge together. Compete with friends to answer questions from one of six different categories. A correct answer allows you to try to answer an additional bonus question. Win the game by correctly answering one question each from all six categories and a final challenge question! Say 'Alexa, help' if you ever get lost. If you'd like to start over, you can say 'Alexa, start over.' If you didn't catch something, you can say 'Alexa, repeat.'

ES: Bienvenidos a Super3. La skill ofrece más de 30 cuentos infantiles en catalán, que forman parte del programa "Una mà de contes", del canal de televisión Super3. Están dirigidos a niñas y niños de 3 a 7 años y combinan música y narración. Algunos cuentos son tradicionales y otros pertenecen a diferentes culturas del mundo. Todos despertarán la imaginación de los más pequeños y son ideales para escuchar antes de ir a dormir. La skill permite escoger un cuento diferente cada vez, hacer girar la rueda mágica para escoger una historia al azar o pedir un cuento por el título. Podéis decir: - "Alexa, abre contes del Super3": para abrir la skill y escoger un cuento. - "Alexa, gira el Super3": para escuchar un cuento al azar cuando la skill ya está abierta. - "Alexa, vull un conte": para pedir un cuento concreto. Por ejemplo, "El Patufet", "Hansel i Gretel" o "La caputxeta vermella" cuando la skill ya está abierta.. Los contenidos de esta skill están en catalán. Disponible para dispositivos con Alexa: Echo, Echo Dot, Echo Input, Echo Spot, Echo Plus, Echo Show y Echo Show 5. Con dispositivos con FireTV, para utilizar la skill tenéis que decir: "Alexa, obre contes del Super3’". CAT: Us donem la benvinguda a Super3. La skill ofereix més de 30 contes infantils en català, que formen part del programa del Super3 "Una mà de contes". Estan adreçats a nenes i nens d'entre 3 i 7 anys i combinen música i narració. Alguns contes són tradicionals i d’altres pertanyen a altres cultures del món. Tots despertaran la imaginació del més petits i són ideals per escoltar abans d'anar a dormir. La skill permet triar un conte diferent cada vegada o fer girar la roda màgica per escollir una història a l'atzar. Proveu de dir: - "Alexa, abre contes del Super3": per obrir la skill i triar un conte. - "Alexa, gira el Super3": per escoltar un conte a l'atzar quan la skill ja està oberta. - "Alexa, vull un conte": per demanar un conte concret. Per exemple, "El Patufet", "Hansel i Gretel" o "La caputxeta vermella" quan la skill ja està oberta. Els continguts d'aquesta skill són en català. Disponible per a dispositius amb Alexa: Echo, Echo Dot, Echo Input, Echo Spot, Echo Plus, Echo Show i Echo Show 5. Amb dispositius amb FireTV, per utilitzar la skill heu de dir: "Alexa, abre contes del Super3’".
Wake up with your friends Josh, Blue, and Tickety Tock!

skill_name: Hansel and Gretel - Interactive Story for kids
skill_description: From the Twisted Tales library, Hansel & Gretel is an immersive interactive story for kids that lets you – the listener – play the part of Hansel & Gretel OR the Evil Witch, living the stories from their point of view! Hansel and Gretel have a problem. The narrator of their story is really boring. So they tell him to get on with it! He is rather perturbed by this, characters aren’t supposed to talk back. Will they resolve their differences? Who really controls the story? What are the possible effects of eating too much gingerbread? And should they visit the incredibly big, ugly, evil ogre who eats children? It’s all up to you. Did you know there is another story called Red Riding Hood? To find out more check your Alexa app and look for Sonnar. Twisted Tales include: * Multiple choices and alternative endings * Possibility to play story from Hansel & Gretel and Evil Witch point of view * Professional voice acting * Immersive music * Flawless sound effects FEEDBACK: Please leave us a review if you like our skill. For more stories please visit search for sonnar interactive in your Alexa app.

This Numbers Wizard skill challenges yours Numbering skill on four areas, Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication and Division.  You will be scoring points for each correct answer and zero points for a wrong answer. Based on your points you will be ranked across the globe and also achieve the badges starting from Newbie, Novice,Graduate,Expert,Master and Guru.

A fun game to teach different words like names of fruits, vegetables, animals, colors, days, months, planets etc to toddlers during the early development stage. Helps with memory and kills boredom. Just start the skill, listen to the category and reply with a name. You can skip by saying 'Next' or repeat the old one by saying 'Previous' or repeat the existing one by saying 'Repeat'. To terminate and exit the game, say 'Stop'.

DOGOnews connects kids to the world around them through current events and news. The DOGOnews skill for Alexa is fun and interactive way where news comes to life with narration, music and comments to help kids concentrate and develop listening skills. For parents who are subscribers of DOGOnews Homeschool, the skill offers quizzes to test reading comprehension. Homeschoolers can discover articles on their own or with their learning pod, while minimizing screen-time. In order to access quizzes, parents must set up account-linking between their Amazon account and a DOGOnews parent account. Once you enable the skill, just say, "Alexa, open DOGOnews" to get started!  Things you can say “Current Events” – to hear the latest articles “Browse Topics” – to hear science, social studies or articles about the world “Search” – to search by topic or keyword (i.e. search for “SpaceX” articles) “Take a Quiz” – to take a quiz after listening to an article Listening to articles Alexa will begin each reading by saying how long it is in minutes, and how many sections it will be read in.  At the end of each section you can say "continue", "repeat this section", or "start over". At the end of the reading you can say "take a quiz", "listen to the next story", or "start over". About DOGOnews DOGOnews is the leading source of current events and non-fiction content to help students improve reading comprehension, critical thinking, vocabulary and writing.  DOGOnews features award-winning, originally produced content with photos, videos and assessments for all ages. License by leading education companies and empowering over 8 million young learners, DOGOnews is a favorite destination for ELA, science & social studies content. Copyright ©2020 DOGO Media, Inc.

"The floor is lava", the game for young and old. Now Alexa challenges you. Can you save yourself from the lava? One two three four five! Did you win against the lava! Fun for the whole family.

The skill can also help with sleep and meditation.  It's also a great teaching tool for our children to create awareness of these beautiful beasts. Whale Song recording and master engineering for The Oceania Project by Mark Franklin. Used with permission and in full accordance with Creative Commons of Australia.

skill_name: Yoga Nidra For Sleep | Powerful Guided Meditation
skill_description: Yoga Nidra (“Yogic Sleep”), a refreshing form of relaxation and an alternative to the 20-minute power nap. Yoga Nidra ... is a practice that everyone, from children to seniors, can do. Yoga Nidra is a state of consciousness between waking and sleeping, like the "going-to-sleep" stage. It is a state in which the body is completely relaxed, and the practitioner becomes systematically and increasingly aware of the inner world by following a set of verbal instructions. Yoga Nidra is an accessible meditation practice that focuses on cultivating multiple levels of well-being. Practiced with consistency and awareness, you may likely discover that you can find a good amount of peace in a short period of time. It offers a space to explore what you need in the moment, as well as an opportunity to work on releasing long-held emotions. You can use commands like Pause, Stop, Resume to control this skill.

This is Alexa's premiere Hide and Seek experience, where you get to hide, and Alexa tries to find you. Hey! It’s me, Arthur! It’s a wonderful kind of day to learn something new! When you open Hey Arthur, you’ll be transported to Elwood City to chat with some familiar friends. skill_name: Animal Game for Kids - Play and Learn
skill_description: Probably the best animal sounds game on Amazon Alexa! Play alone, or with friends and family.  The game is quick. Just five sounds to guess.  Animal sounds game was created to help children of all ages learn animal sounds while having fun at the same time. Skill includes most loved animals like dog, cat, sheep, elephant, lion, owl, wolf and even fox. Older girls, boys, and even small toddlers will have a great time! Learn the noises, of pets, farm, and wild animals and birds. Only real sounds effects, voices, calls and cries of animals. Do you know animal’s sounds? Do you know what does the fox say? Take this fun challenge now! Let's Take This Animal Sounds Quiz. Play and Learn.  UPDATE: The new updated version of the free Animal Game. Now you can ask Alexa for a hint! Anytime during the animal game, you can say: "give me a hint", or "I don't know" and Alexa will help you. When it comes to your child, teaching them all of the exciting, funny, and interesting sounds that animals make is one of the most important children’s games to play for their development! Animal sounds help children begin to relate to the world around them and understand the differences between the whole animal kingdom!  Now for Amazon Alexa, let your child play alone or with friends! Developed for kids of all ages, your child can learn animal sounds and have fun all at the same time. Teach your child how to identify animal sounds from dogs, cats, sheep, elephants, lions, owls, wolves, and even foxes! And trust us, in no time at all, they’ll have every last animal sound down without a hint.

Use this skill to keep track of chores that are assigned to each member of your household. You can ask Alexa to read the list of chores that are assigned to you each day, and you can log your chores as you complete them. Alexa automatically keeps score so you can complete with family members to see who finishes their chores first. Or last! The chore tracker automatically resets on Sunday each week. skill_name: Ella the Jellyfish: For LGS Families
skill_description: Ella the Jellyfish is a friend to all—especially to families affected by Lennox-Gastaut syndrome (LGS). By saying “Alexa, open Ella the Jellyfish,” you and your family will be able to start interacting with Ella, who can’t wait to play! Join Ella and her underwater friends for several different games and listening activities, each designed specifically with LGS families in mind. If you and your child would like to play along with Ella and her friends, you can play Ella Says, Freeze Dance, or Color Hunt. These games may involve some physical activity. If you’d like to listen, Ella can tell stories, guide you through meditations, or sing you songs! Below are some examples of the phrases you and your family can use to start playing with Ella the Jellyfish: OPEN ELLA “Alexa, open Ella the Jellyfish” “Alexa, start Ella the Jellyfish” “Alexa, play Ella the Jellyfish” Once you have opened Ella, below are the different ways you can interact with her: PLAY WITH ELLA “Alexa, play Ella Says” “Alexa, play Freeze Dance” “Alexa, play Color Hunt” LISTEN TO ELLA “Alexa, listen to a story” “Alexa, listen to a long story” “Alexa, listen to a short story” “Alexa, listen to a meditation” “Alexa, listen to a short meditation” “Alexa, listen to a long meditation” “Alexa, listen to a song” “Alexa, listen to The Alphabet Song” “Alexa, listen to Pat-a-Cake” “Alexa, listen to Skip to My Lou” The content in this skill is provided for informational and educational purposes only.

If you’re tired of hearing the cries of “it’s not my turn” every time you ask your kid to do something, it might just be time to forfeit this most basic of parental duties to your infallible voice assistant. Let’s face it, getting a child to do their chores can be … well … a chore.  If you’ve made the (some might say) questionable decision to go from the biologically understandable world of raising a single child to the borderline insane universe of raising children, you’ll no doubt know that these little bundles are acutely aware of the equitable distribution of household tasks.  As a caring parent carefully in tune with the feelings of each child you’ve undoubtedly established your own internal mechanism for ensuring nobody lifts more than their fair share of fingers - but the odds are stacked against you.  Kids of today are raised in a world where search engines and voice assistants prove parents wrong a couple dozen times a day - so them being the critical thinkers you’ve raised them to be - why on earth would they believe YOU when you tell them it’s their turn to take out the trash.  The flip side of a tech savvy youth is that they inevitably believe just about anything it tells them - so while you and your tyke might “verbally spar” for hours over who swept the kitchen last time - they’re all too prepared and willing to dutifully adhere to the commands of the disembodied voice echoing from the corner of the living room. Now, if you’ve made the grave mistake of raising your lot to be openly defiant of technology telling them what to do in some sort of misguided attempt to prepare them for the inevitable robot revolution, well then that is your poor decision making catching up with you and you’re going to have to resort to being a competent and respected parent.

skill_name: Blue's Clues & You! Listen and Play
skill_description: With the “Blue’s Clues & You! Listen and Play” Alexa skill from Nickelodeon, your preschooler can play with Josh and Blue in a whole new way! Listen along and help Josh figure out Blue’s clues! As kids play, they’ll use their imagination and practice skills like listening and critical thinking. With ten different storylines, there’s a new adventure every time you play, featuring friends like Magenta, Tickety Tock, Shovel and Pail, and more.    To enable the skill, simply say "Alexa, open Blue’s Clues”.*   To quit, just say "Alexa, quit" anytime during the game.   The “Blue’s Clues and You! Listen and Play” skill is for kids aged 4+ and their families. You can watch episodes of “Blue’s Clues & You!” on Nickelodeon. For issues, questions, or comments please email us at amazonalexa@nick.com.  We want to hear directly from you! *If you set up a child profile through FreeTime please enable the skill first on your account by clicking enable on the store page. Then please go to the parent dashboard and add the Blue’s Clues skill to your child’s content. You can find the dashboard by going to https://parents.amazon.com/ click your kids’ profile and then the settings cog on the right, click add content, click Alexa skills, and slide the toggle to on for Blue’s Clues and You! Listen and Play. If you never gave parental consent you will hear Alexa say “To use Blue's Clues and You Listen and Play a parent needs to give permission. I sent some information to the home screen of your Alexa app." Please open your Alexa app and make sure you are logged into the account that’s on your assistant device. On the home screen of the app you will see a notification that you can tap. It will open the store page of the skill. Tap launch, which will bring you to the parental consent form. Click through the prompts and once you allow parental consent you can access the skill. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The Blue's Cues & You! Listen and Play Alexa Skill collects personal user data as well as non-personal user data (including aggregated data). User data collection is in accordance with applicable law, such as COPPA. User data may be used, for example, to respond to user requests; enable users to take advantage of certain features and services; customize the user experience and content; and manage and improve Nickelodeon's services. Listen and Play Alexa Skill may include the use of anonymous persistent identifiers for skill management purposes and enabling this skill constitutes your permission to such usage of anonymous persistent identifiers for all users on your device. Few things are as an important a part of a child's education as fostering creativity. However, a child cannot be "taught" to be creative. It is a talent they must discover for themselves. My Fairy Tale helps lead them on that path to discovery. Rather than read a story out to your child, My Fairy Tale lets the child create their own adventure, filled with whatever fantasies they come up with. The skill helps them create their story line-by-line, with words of encouragement after each addition to the story. Once the child says, "The End", the skill stitches together everything they've said so far, and reads the story back to them.

Drac’s Pack will read you a monster story or sing you a nursery rhyme with a monster twist. You can also meet members of Drac's Pack. It’s as easy as, “Alexa, tell Hotel Transylvania to sing a nursery rhyme”. Look online for secret phrases that unlock hidden monster surprises such as, “Alexa, ask Hotel Transylvania for a joke”.

I can help you getting your child potty trained. Tell me their first name, and I will remind them every 30 minutes during the day. I will play fun potty songs for them, and keep track of their achievement by collecting stars for them. they should get a surprise when they collect 5 stars. You can interact with me by enabling the skill first, then open it - "Alexa, open potty training": this will open the skill. It will ask for the child name the first time you invoke it and ask you if you want to set reminders. You can later open the skill and it will tell you the start count - "Alexa, ask potty training to add one star": will add one star to your child's progress and tell you how many stars they have -"Alexa, ask potty training to add reminders": will add the reminders if you have not done so already. Alexa will then remind you of potty time every 30 minutes -"Alexa, ask potty training to delete reminders": will delete the reminders and you will no longer be reminded (you can add them back anytime) -"Alexa, ask potty training to play a song": plays a fun potty song  -"Alexa, ask potty training to reset skill": resets the skill, clear all data and delete reminders. You can chose to start over whenever you want. You can invoke the 'Help' command for more detailed commands "Alexa, ask Potty Training for help". You can add the reminders or delete them anytime after your child no longer needs them or just reset the skill to delete all information.

The Tale of Peter Rabbit, written by Beatrix Potter,  is an ageless children's story.  It's told by Alexa as only she can.  Suitable for children of all ages with some 'yes' or 'no' interactions so the listener can feel part of the tale. NOTE TO PARENTS:  There may be some words unfamiliar to children such as currants (like raisins but smaller), gooseberry net (gooseberries are red berries found on bushes, the net protects the berries from rabbits), sieve (a fine mesh used, in this case, as a bucket to get the rocks out of soil) . If you think this story would be more engaging if Alexa asked the listener questions or explained the meaning of the words in the story, please be sure to  comment in the review section of your Alexa app on your phone. If you would like other classic stories read by Alexa, please also leave your thoughts in the comments of your review. Story time is about six minutes. Thank you and we hope you enjoy The Tale of Peter Rabbit.

JumpStart is the leader in creating interactive family experiences that enrich, entertain, and educate for both home and school. Jumpstart's resource library includes a collection of fun, free and printable worksheets to learn and practice math, science, reading, grammar, social studies, geography, and more. JumpStart's worksheets cover every topic you can think of, with fun characters and themes built around JumpStart characters, holidays and more. It's a great resource to help kids of different grades, from preschool to 6th grade, develop fundamental skills that they need to get a JumpStart in school. To use this skill say "Alexa, open Jumpstart Academy" Followed by - Print me a math worksheet - Print me a coloring sheet PRINTER DISCOVERY To print with Alexa, your printer must be connected to the same wireless network as your Alexa device. To get started, first you’ll need to connect your printer to Alexa. Simply say “Alexa, discover my printer”, or navigate to the Devices screen in the Alexa App, select “+”, select “Add Device”, and choose “Printer” as the device type. Learn more at https://www.amazon.com/alexaprint

The news is read by Alexa, so it will be a friendly voice for kids.

Bamboo English offers thousands of English Language Arts (ELA) exercises in the form of word games for children age 5 to 11, covering five core ELA modules (Vocabulary, Grammar, Spelling, Phonics, & Listening/Reading).  --- MULTI-USER SUPPORT: Families can set up accounts for up to 6 different users, so each child can learn at their own pace. Content available includes free access to Unit 1 of 6 for each ELA module, for each grade from Kindergarten through 5th Grade. The paid subscription (which starts with a 14-day free trial) includes all six units (Unit 1 through Unit 6) for each ELA module, for each grade from K–5. Modules include basic, grade level, and "reach" exercises so children can move at their own pace through the ELA curriculum. Content includes lessons and exercises from leading content providers. --- IS BAMBOO ENGLISH FREE? Yes! Anyone can use Bamboo English exercises at no cost. We offer a subscription to gain access to all 6 of 6 Units for each of 5 ELA modules, for each grade – K–5. --- CONNECTING WITH BAMBOO LEARNING To learn more about Bamboo Learning, connect with us on Instagram: @learnwithbamboo; Facebook: @bamboolearning; Twitter: @learnwithbamboo; Email: info@bamboolearning.com --- MORE INFO ON BAMBOO ENGLISH •Phonics exercise examples: “Which word rhymes with BOUNCE – ANNOUNCE or BEHIND?”; “She took the crown into town. Which words rhyme?” •Spelling exercise examples: “In the word CAT, is the last letter T?”; “In the word FISH, take out F and put in D. What word do you get?”  •Grammar exercise examples: “We hiked up the mountain. Which word is a verb?”; “What is the antonym of TOGETHER – UNIFIED or DIVIDED?”  •Vocabulary exercise examples: “What does the word ANTICIPATION mean? A) Looking forward to something, or B) Ability to move objects with the mind.”; “If you add the letters -ER at the end of the word PAINT, what word do you get?” Bamboo English includes dozens of books leveled for each grade, both for fun, and for children to practice listening and reading comprehension. Examples include: •Fairy Tales such as: The Hare and the Tortoise and The Emperor's New Clothes •Short Stories such as: Little Red Riding Hood, Cinderella, and The Elephant’s Child •Selections from longer works such as: Aladdin, Peter Pan, and Wonderful Wizard of Oz •Highlights Readers such as: The Lucky Penny, The Skeleton Crew, and Balto The Sled Dog For children using Alexa screen-based devices like Fire tablets and Fire TV, Bamboo Books offers text and images to permit reading and following along with Alexa. Note: To make things easier for children to understand, we refer to each grade level as climbing one of the following trees (K – Banana Tree, 1 – Coconut Tree, 2 – Apple Tree, 3 – Oak Tree, 4 – Pine Tree, 5 – Lemon Tree). Additionally, we refer to each “Unit” as climbing a ladder. So, a child working on the 3rd Unit of 2nd grade for Spelling, would be on “Ladder 3 on the Apple Tree in Spelling”. Similarly, a child working on the 6th Unit of 4th grade for Vocabulary, would be on “Ladder 6 on the Pine Tree in Vocabulary.” If they complete this ladder, they would move to “Ladder 1 on the Lemon Tree in Vocabulary” (i.e. 5th Grade, Unit 1). --- WE ALSO OFFER A GUIDE TO USING BAMBOO ENGLISH AT guide.bamboolearning.com. --- BENEFITS OF OPTIONAL ACCOUNT LINKING AND BAMBOO GROVE Parents can sign up for an optional Bamboo Learning account by going to Bamboo Grove at grove.bamboolearning.com. Bamboo Grove is the "dashboard" where parents can go to follow their children’s progress for each unit and level (for example 2nd Grade Vocabulary Unit 3 would be the 3rd Unit of the school year for 2nd Grade Vocabulary). After signing up for a Bamboo Learning account, parents need to link that account with the Bamboo English Alexa skill using the Alexa App (or going to alexa.amazon.com) and then searching for Bamboo English within the skills section of the Alexa App.

It’s time to celebrate not just with your family flock, but now with The Chickens created by Sawyer Ique! What if someone's there for parents, to suggest a game idea to try and play with kids during travel or while with a bunch of friends?? Of Course, There's is one!! Just say,  Alexa, Play "Craze On the Go" Give it a try and break the boring road trips or kid's play-dates! The main objective behind Craze On the Go is to help parents and make journeys with less screen time, more listening, playing and enhancing kids brain time!  Encourages Communication, Interaction, Creativity, Memory, Gross and Fine motor skills, Actions, Team Work and Fun Learning! Do you love traveling?? It's Yes for most!  But how about, Travel with Kids??  For some parents, travel can be overwhelming while managing kids all way long; Same way kids too lose their patience when they have to sit for a longer time and in turn the travel become boring!  Kids are part of our life; so are the long trips!  The Best Thing about Parenting is to find the best possible solution that works for your family!! One of such solution coined by a Mom of Two with an intention towards making long road trips fun as well as educational. In other words, Long trips offers us Longer together time means Longer yet Creative ways to develop and ignite Kids Brain! Finally started working on a solution and creating a curated list of games that works with kids in real time, and let Alexa suggest you a game idea to try via Craze on the Go! Proudly presenting, "Craze On the go!", a curated collection of ideas, the real game ideas to try, play and have fun!  Each and every idea has been individually coined keeping kid's growing mindset in top priority and focusing on both fun as well as educational games. Though the ideas were curated as if it's fun while traveling. But you will soon realize not only in travel, most of the ideas like silly ideas, creative or instead of games would be apt and start working for your family when you are with kids or friends or party time or play-dates or after school and looking for some fun and educational games to try and play.  So many game ideas can also used by teachers or caretakers for making a random pick for organizing some indoor activities or games time. Just try Craze On the Go by,  # Enabling the Skill, "Craze On the Go!" in your Echo Devices. # Just Say... Alexa, Play Craze On The Go! # Listen to ideas, try, play and have fun!! # Once skill is enabled you could able to listen ideas in all of your Echo Devices. # If you missed hearing a part of game idea or have some doubts in game rules, any of the passengers can just check Amazon Alexa app and toggle to Activity for a simple card with description! # While traveling, if you are don't have your Alexa device in car, Open the Alexa App from your mobile, then tap the Alexa Icon and Say "Craze On the Go". That's it, Start Listening to all the ideas from your already purchased or available catalog! Right Now, Craze On the Go is a blend of game ideas in 3 categories such as  Family - game ideas helping families work together, have fun and spending quality time. Silly - silly game ideas; If kids go silly and have fun then of course its fun for all. Creative - game ideas which enhances your creativity! Kindly leave your ratings and reviews which would be helpful in shaping "Craze On the Go!" Would love to hear which games worked for your family or any suggestions or ideas you would like Craze On the Go can add to it's growing catalog of game ideas!

Buzz in with Echo Buttons in this fun trivia game show. This game requires at least 2 Echo Buttons. Echo Buttons offer a new way to play game skills through your compatible Echo device. To learn more just ask "Alexa, what are Echo Buttons?"    Get two to four contestants together to star in this game show! In each round, Alexa will ask a question. Players will buzz in with their Echo Buttons to answer. As you play, Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The contestant with the most correct answers wins!   While playing, you can say "Alexa, repeat that" to hear Alexa read the question again. You can also say, "Alexa, what are the scores?" to hear a score report. You can say, "Alexa, help!" to hear about what you can do next. You can say, "Alexa, start over" if you want to abandon the current game and pick up from the beginning. At any time you can say, "Alexa, stop" to halt the current game. If you had already started a game, Alexa will remember where you stopped and pick back up from the last question asked, when you next launch the skill. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.
