skill_name: Quirky Count with variable interval upto 3 seconds
skill_description: How Many Times you wanted alexa to count upto ten with a certain interval in mind? By default alexa counts without any breaks! Let's say you wanted to practice deep breaths for count of 10 with pause of 1 second. With Quirky count you can do exactly this and much more. In this skill one can ask Alexa to count from one number to another number. For example you can say count number from 3 to 30. Or count upto ten. We currently support 4 modes 1. No delay --- Can be invoked by simply asking quirky count to count upto a certain number 2. 1 second --- Can be invoked by asking quirky count to count upto certain number with an interval of 1 or 1 second 3. 2 second  --- Can be invoked by asking quirky count to count upto certain number with an interval of 2 or 2 second 4. 3 second  --- Can be invoked by asking quirky count to count upto certain number with an interval of 3 or 3 second Sample Utterances: 1. Count from 2 to 10 with interval of 1 second 2. Count to 5 with interval of 1 second 3. Count number from 2 to 10 You can reach out to me on tathagata [at] tathagatamitra [dot] com for any feedback

From the team that helped a three year old go from phonics to reading at a second grade level comes "Letter H. "   Letter H. assesses and the concept of phonics and allows early English readers to practice identifying words that start with "H." to improve phonic fluency.

Take development and roleplay to a whole new level of fun with the free LEGO® DUPLO® Stories on Alexa! Whether your toddler is the captain of a fishing boat or a bird travelling far and wide, they will experience the joy of learning with LEGO® DUPLO® through short, interactive stories involving animal play and vehicle play - using their very own DUPLO® bricks! And don’t worry if your child does not have all of the pieces – they can use whatever they have on hand to act the story. The only limits are their creativity and imagination!  LEGO® DUPLO® Stories encourage children to learn via creative play in a fun, safe atmosphere. Learning numbers and colors and developing language skills have never been more enjoyable!  Interaction is easy!  Go to the settings in your Alexa app and turn on Child Directed Skills  To start, say "Alexa, open LEGO DUPLO Stories”.  To select animal stories, say “Animal story”  To select vehicle stories, say “Vehicle story”.  To play the animal or vehicle story again, say “Yes” at the end of the story.  To quit the animal or vehicle story, say "Alexa, exit" anytime during the story.  To learn more about LEGO® DUPLO® learning games and story starters, visit LEGO.com/DUPLO – and experience the joy of creative learning through development and roleplay!  The animals featured in this Skill include:  Bird  Cat  Cow  Dog  Rabbit  The vehicles featured in this Skill include:  Boat  Car  Plane  Train  Truck

Mathcaster is an exciting combination of education and entertainment, suitable for ages between 8-12. This Alexa Skill is a perfect resource to help children improve and develop their math skills in a fun, exciting and challenging way.  The adventure begins with helping villagers in a small town, visiting four different areas; Addition Village, the Subtraction Lake, the Multiplication Forest and Division Mountain. In these areas, there will be monsters, insects and other pests that must be defeated by powering up your spells by solving math-magical problems!  Mathcaster can be used in classrooms, at home, or independently by children themselves - with the skill including an Achievement system that rewards solving problems with the correct answers, as well as providing tangible targets and goals.  With being easy and free to use, Mathcaster is the perfect addition to learning kits and frameworks. By simply saying; “Alexa, open Mathcaster” you can start the adventure straight away and begin sharpening your sorcery with educational enchantments!

skill_name: Alpacalpa Alpaca | StoryQube Original Music game
skill_description: Alpacalpa Alpaca is a tongue twister game for Kids. This StoryQube Original is designed to make people of all ages laugh. A perfect party game that can engage anyone and everyone. The story behind the game is that there lived a cool and cheerful Alpaca long time ago who was called Alpacalpa Alpaca. She sang songs that made no sense but filled people up with Joy. Kids and adults visited Alpacalpa Alpaca whenever they were down and sang the gibberish along with her. So are you ready to sing along?

Alexa quizzes you on trivia topics. Provide the answer and try to achieve a high score. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

Very simple and extremely compelling math puzzle game. For kids especially, it  helps with additions, subtractions and divisions. It is a variant of the famous 21 game. The game starts with you counting numbers starting from 1 followed by your opponent Alexa continuing where you left off. Each can say up to 3 numbers at a time and gets turn one after other. Whoever says 17 loses the game. So plan your strategy accordingly. Once you win some games, the difficulty starts to increase. You'll then need to be quick and smart in using your mathematical skills to continue winning. -You can say "help" at any point to know what numbers you have to say and find what the target is -You can also say "increase Difficulty" or "Decrease difficulty" make it harder or easier -You can say "restart game" or "start a new game" to start over again -You can also say Alexa, ask Number Ladder start a new game with 27 and 5 for higher difficulty and custom target

Sight Words provides children with an interactive platform to learn how to read.  Learning all 1,000 words within the Sight Words list would enable a child to read about 90% of the words in a typical English book, magazine, newspaper, or website. This skill currently supports grade 1 level reading words but will soon be updated to included grade levels 2 to 9.  *NOTE: This skill was designed to work best with Alexa devices that support a display (i.e., Echo Spot and Echo Display). However, if you do not have a display enabled device then you can use the Alexa App or Website to view cards.

One day you woke up in the morning and found yourself locked in a room.  You are in the most mysterious house in the world. A house, that is ready to isolate in its walls anybody who is not able to solve its puzzles. The house of 13 Doors! Every room is filled with puzzles, hidden objects, questions that will help you to escape from the room.

Welcome to the World of Robot Boxing! Play each day to train, upgrade, and personalize your Robot to create your perfect Battling-Bot. Fight your way up the ranks to claim the ultimate title of the Mega Weight Champion. Based on the classic Mattel Toy, Rock ‘Em Sock ‘Em Robots offers a new voice game made for screen-based devices. Give your Robot Boxer commands and watch your champion throw Quick Jabs, Mega Punches, and Block-Knockin’ Super Moves! Join the Robot Boxing League today! To start training your own Robot Boxer, just say, “Alexa open Rock ‘Em Sock ‘Em Robots”. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This skill requires Alexa’s parental consent by an adult in the household (if not already granted). Visit https://www.amazon.com/myh/vpc/intro?clientId=Alexa_rw_vpc to give consent through your Amazon account. Voice purchase settings are available in your Alexa App. NOTE: Disabling the skill will cause you to lose your game progress. © 2020 MATTEL. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.

skill_name: Pledge of Allegiance (US) Multiple Voice Options
skill_description: Choose from one of five voice options to accompany you while you recite the U.S. Pledge of Allegiance. Voice options: Logan, Olivia, Jordan, Noah and Mia.  Logan and Olivia are adult voices. Jordan is a genderless voice. Noah and Mia are younger voice options. A voice preference can be set. Bugle options: on/off. A preference can be set to play a bugle just before the Pledge of Allegiance begins. You will be asked to pick a voice and a bugle option the first time you use this skill and they will be saved as preferences for future sessions.  During future sessions, you can say, "Alexa, change preferences" to change your preferences. ____________________ Pledge of Allegiance: I pledge allegiance  to the Flag  of the United States of America,  and to the Republic  for which it stands,  one Nation  under God,  indivisible,  with liberty  and justice for all. ____________________ Updates: April 10, 2019: Added a genderless voice option (Jordan), and an optional bugle which plays before the Pledge of Allegiance begins.  Added ability to save these choices as user preferences during first session. Added a command, "Change Preferences", enabling users to change their preferences during subsequent visits. ____________________ Please leave a five-star review if you like this skill, and please include your comments and suggestions for improvement.  Your review will help us continue to improve this skill. ____________________ Credits: Development: https://voices.app Linguistics Consultant: LaLa Speights Icon Image: DepositPhotos

Testing your memory regularly is a great way to keep your mind sharp.  This skill is an amazing tool for children and adults alike.  The review portion will give you 3 sets of letters with words that correspond to the letter.  Once you have comfortably gone through the entire review you can test your skill by taking the test that will go through the entire alphabet and the corresponding words that you learned for the week.  When you are in the review portion of the program please say "OK" between every 3 sets of letter to continue learning.  When your done after a 3 letter spread say "NO" or "STOP" or you can say "TAKE TEST" if your ready to test your self for the week.  It is usually good to do a wednesday test after using the program for the first 2 days of the week and then do a final test on friday to see the progess you have made.  You can play this with your child and you can help them new words and you can test your memeory as well.
This is the song that never ends Yes it goes on and on my friends Some people started singing it not knowing what it was And they'll continue singing it forever just because...

Poppy and Tiny Diamond need a song for their party, and they want YOU to create it. But to make your music, you’ll need to visit one of three incredible Trolls musical lands—Pop, Rock, or Country. Build the song one way, and then you change it until your toe-tapping melody is just the way you want it before you reveal it for all of Troll Village. Save your songs and play them back later for your friends and family.

This skill will listen to what you say and will respond with different cat sounds.  I built this skill so my kids could pretend that we still had a cat in the house.  Speak to the Chatty Cat like she's your pet and listen to how she responds.  I hope you enjoy using this skill.  Icon illustrator Taniel Harvey (c)2018

Have a hard time getting your child to brush their teeth? Getting your young child to properly brush their teeth can be a daily challenge. Save thousands of dollars on future dental bills with the Alexa 'toothbrush adventure' skill. Invoke the skill with "Alexa start toothbrush adventure". Say "Begin" when prompted and Alexa will play a friendly song to guide you through brushing your teeth thoroughly. You can pause the song with "Alexa stop" and resume the song where it left off with "Alexa resume". No more fuss when it comes to getting your child to brush their teeth! Happy brushing

You choose the difficulty level of easy, medium, or hard with this skill. A description of an animal is given. and you have to guess the correct animal.You are given four tries before the correct animal is given. If you get the animal wrong, you will be given the description again and then a hint. Once you guess the correct animal, you can hear a fact about it or play again. This educational game is perfect for kids to learn about different animals. There are over 100 animals to guess!

How much money do I have Alexa? Now you and your kids can ask Alexa questions about their RoosterMoney account! Whether it’s seeing what’s left to spend, or what chores there are to do today, Alexa is there to support your families’ money conversations. Why not have a bit of fun and find out who spent and earned the most this year? You can ask questions on the following topics: -    Spend balance -    Account total -    How much has been spent or earned -    What chores there are to do today
Join Peter Powers and his super powered family, fighting crime in Boulder City! Grow your own set of super powers and face-off against villains from the Peter Powers universe.

The worlds of plush and technology collide with the kid friendly Fuzzible skill for Alexa! Fuzzible Friends™ are adorably soft, plush animals that speak their own unique language. When paired with a compatible Amazon Echo device, the Fuzzible skill for Alexa magically translates their funny little language to yours!  Once you’ve successfully paired your Fuzzible Friend with your Echo device and enabled the skill, Alexa will indicate that your Fuzzible plush is ready to play. Just squeeze your Fuzzible’s left paw to begin interacting and watch as its antenna lights up. When playing connected to an Amazon Echo device, your child can interact with their Fuzzible Friend by playing color guessing games, choosing their own story adventure and more! Fuzzible Friends™ plush have over 40 sounds and 140 translated Alexa phrases!  Hardware requirements: 1 Fuzzible Friend plush and 1 compatible Amazon Echo device. To enable the skill, simply say “Alexa, let’s play Fuzzible Friends™.”  To quit, just say “Alexa, stop” anytime during connected play.  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The Fuzzible Skill for Alexa may include the use of anonymous persistent identifiers for skill management purposes and enabling this skill constitutes your permission to such usage of anonymous persistent identifiers for all users on your device. Disabling this skill will a) permanently disable use of previous anonymous persistent identifier, and b) disconnect all user experience data from previously related account managed by Amazon.

DISCLAIMER: This game is not developed or sponsored by Disney. Test your knowledge of the Disneyverse! Over 75 unique Trivia questions regarding all things Disney! Questions range from the classics to recent releases - and some will even test your knowledge about Disney World itself! Be sure to answer by saying the number of the correct answer. Examples: "One.", "It's three."  or "It's number four." If you get confused, say 'help'. If you need to hear a question again, say 'repeat'. Enjoy and have fun - leave comments and review if you enjoy the trivia questions! :) Updated weekly with additional questions. DISCLAIMER: This game is not developed or sponsored by Disney.

This skill "Teach My Child" is a Single Window system to learn pre - school basics which consists of  three Sections:  LEARN, PRACTICE and ASSESSMENT  The LEARNING Section has below categories: 1.Alphabets, 2.Numbers( 1- 10),  3.Number Names (1-10),  4.Colors, 5.Colors with spelling,  6.Basic Shapes,  7.Basic Shapes with Spelling,  8.Seasons,  9.Seasons with Spelling,  10.Days of the Week,  11.Days of the Week with spelling,  12.Months of the Year  , 13.Months of the Year  with spelling  14.Magic Words. In the  LEARNING Section, you have options to choose any one of the categories like Alphabets from random letter / Alphabets from start letter to  end letter / Numbers from any random number( 1- 10) / Numbers from start number to end number (1 - 10) / Number name from any random number ( 1 - 10) / Number names from from start number to end number (1 - 10).  The PRACTICE Section has below categories: 1.Alphabet week 1 practice 2.Alphabet week 2 practice  3.Alphabet week 3 practice  4.Alphabet week 4 practice  5.Number week 1 practice  6.Number week 2 practice  In the PRACTICE Section, the skill helps the children to teach the Alphabets / Numbers . The Alphabets has four weeks teach plan and Number has two weeks teach plan.   The ASSESSMENT Section has below categories: 1.Alphabet week 1 Assessment 2.Alphabet week 2 Assessment 3.Alphabet week 3 Assessment 4.Alphabet week 4 Assessment 5.Number week 1 Assessment 6.Number week 2 Assessment 7.     Alphabet Assessment 8      Number Assessment In the PRACTICE Section,  the child's  learning and development can be assessed by ASSESSMENT Section. The Skill can be invoked by 'Alexa, Open Teach My Child' or using the below Utterances. Once the session is invoked, any category by name can be asked to continue the Session. Ex: Alexa,           Open Teach My Child          Ask Teach My Child Alphabets          Ask Teach My Child Alphabets from E         Ask Teach My Child Alphabets from K to P         Ask Teach My Child Numbers          Ask Teach My Child Numbers from 5         Ask Teach My Child Numbers from 4 to 8         Ask Teach My Child Number names          Ask Teach My Child Number names from 3         Ask Teach My Child Number names from 6 to 9         Ask Teach My Child Seasons         Ask Teach My Child Magic words The Skill has other options like  Help and repeat. The help will give the detailed information and the the repeat option in the skill helps to repeat the last content. Note: This skill do not collect any personal information
If we say "question", we will issue a problem. It is one digit + one digit. Please answer "The answer is X".

This simple fun skill picks a favorite person of the day. It can pick from its own favorites (like Santa) or from your suggestions. A suggestion can also include why someone should be a favorite. To get started, enable the skill and say 'open Favorite Person'

This is one skill that would help your kids recognize the sounds of a lion. It is such a fun for kids to learn animal sounds such as lion. Just ask for whats flash briefing and you get to hear the lions sounds Enjoy!

Toddlebot is a delightful robot who likes to talk to little kids about food, numbers, shapes and more. Suitable for ages 2 - 4 years. Toddlebot will lead the conversation by telling you her favorite color, shape etc. and you can tell Toddlebot what your favorite is. If you match with Toddlebot then she will be happy, if she recognizes what you said then she will acknowledge it. The skill is for young kids who are familiarizing themselves with common words and subjects. Privacy Information No personal information is collected by this skill. The skill only asks for favorite food, meals, shapes, colors, days and numbers. This information is only used within the skill session. The information is not stored or reused anywhere except within the application itself.

Welcome to Music Bop Adventures! This Alexa Kids Skill features fun, interactive adventures that encourages movement whilst also incorporating educational themes. There are currently 4 adventures to explore with more adventures available: 1. Space – Hop into a spaceship and zoom into outer space; dance and sing along to the names of the planets in a fun song. 2. Under the Sea - Hop into a submarine and explore the wonders of the sea; bump into various sea creatures, tackle obstacles and sing along with a featured friend. 3. Jungle – Hop into a super jet and explore the wonders of the jungle; swim across the river, avoid wild animals and sing along with a featured friend. 4. Weather - Hop into a super jet and tinker with a weather machine; tackle the different weather types as they come. ----------------------------- GOLD SUBSCRIPTION ----------------------------- 5. Sky Adventure 6. Cave Adventure 7. North Pole Adventure 8. Dinosaur Adventure 9. Pirate Adventure Each adventure begins with the same theme tune. To begin the adventures, please use any of the following Alexa commands: “Alexa, ask Music Bop to play adventures” “Alexa, ask Music Bop to shuffle adventures” To play one specific adventure, please use any of the following Alexa commands: “Alexa, ask Music Bop to play Space adventure” “Alexa, ask Music Bop to play Under the Sea adventure” “Alexa, ask Music Bop to play Jungle Adventure”
In the game, the player and Alexa will say the name "Shrek" back and forth until the player decides to say something else. When this happens, Alexa flips a fair coin to see who won.

While her Abuelita is at work as a doctor at the hospital, Olivia and her dog, Bruno, take care of the home, treating patients like Fuzzy the Teddy Bear, Rubber Ducky, and Frisky, Olivia’s pet hamster.  From anxiety to coughing and tummy aches, this adventure is full of songs that teach you how to be a good doctor and help your friends feel better. - Wash Your Hands - Cover Your Face - You Got a Boo Boo - 4-7-8 Breathing - Sometimes My Tummy Feels Funny Help a vibrant cast of characters feel better in this fully-voiced musical adventure – but make sure you wash your hands first! This skill is for informational and educational purposes only, and is not a substitute for professional medical advice, treatment or diagnosis. Call your doctor to receive medical advice. If you think you may have a medical emergency, please dial your local emergency response phone number.
Have Alexa quiz you on division. You can decide how many questions are asked, and when you are done, you can check the full report to see the right answers, and which questions you got right.

Fun Animal Facts is all about fun and interesting animal facts for kids. Let your kids learn about animals in easy to remember bite size  facts. Teaching kids in bite size chunks makes in fun, interesting and engaging and when they are having fun learning, the facts start to stick! Your kids can ask as many questions as they want and will learn about a broad range of animals, insects, sea creatures and more through fun facts.   We are constantly adding to this "skill" to grow every kids general knowledge about the world we share with some amazing creatures and hopefully along the way grow a healthy respect and care for the planet and all its inhabitants.  To get started, you can say any of the following phrases: "Alexa, open Fun Animal Facts" "Alexa, start Fun Animal Facts" "Alexa, launch Fun Animal Facts" Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at support@cogentmarketer.com   Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks a bunch for your support.

Parents, you and your child are invited to join your favorite American Girl characters! Visit Julie at her home in San Francisco, go on a musical tour with Melody in Detroit, and discover countless adventures every month. Explore their worlds, learn about their stories, play their games, and, of course, have sleepovers! Julie, Melody, and many other favorite American Girl characters invite you and your child to enjoy unforgettable experiences with them. Just say, “Alexa, open American Girl” to start. Meet more characters, play new games, and enjoy additional sleepover activities. There’s something new every month!  American Girl Plus is also available as part of FreeTime Unlimited. The best animal sounds app featuring over 70 animals.  Great for the kids to play along with.

Frida the farmer is intended to be the modern equivalent to a picture book. Parents and children can together explore some of the sounds you might encounter on a farm: cows, pigs, tractors, cats. To make it easy for kids, it's enough to say 'okay' or 'yes', to hear the next sound.
Play an interactive adventure-themed story with sound effects and prompts. Get ready for laughs and giggles

Multiplication Dojo can be used to help you practice your multiplication tables! This skill allows users to choose which multiplication table they want to practice, and then randomly generates ten multiplication questions using the specified number. Immediate feedback is one of the keys to effective learning, and in this app, each response is met with either a "Correct!", or an "Incorrect," as well as what the correct answer should have been. At the end of the ten questions, the user is given a final score of how many questions they answered correctly.

Cheetah Facts is a skill that teaches toddlers and kids wide range of interesting facts about Cheetahs. By default, the skill will play until you stop it. To stop the skill, say "Alexa, stop.” To resume it again, say "Alexa, resume." Please leave a 5-star review if you love this Skill. Your 5-star reviews will encourage us to keep making more great skills for kids.

*Please use the "Gallery" skill if you are on display device. Do you want to have your songs/audios library available on the Alexa, then, "Music Gallery" is the spot where you get all this. The skill allows you to classify your audios into albums. Just open the skill and select the album you want to listen to. The "Music Gallery" is an alternate service to "Gallery" which focuses only on Audios and is offered by VoiMes.com. To use this service, you need to register yourself on voimes.com. Once registered, you are allowed to use the services. To use the service, go to the gallery/album section and create some Albums as you want, select albums and then, link audios to those albums. Now, enable our Skill and use it by saying "Alexa open Music Gallery". The method is really easy and doesn't involve any complex steps. However, a few steps are mentioned here. Here are some commands: play album sample audios/show album one (To play all the audios) resume/next/previous/pause home/goto home, my feedback is "could be little better/Awesome/Nice skill". stop (To end the skill) Steps to access the Services: Step 1: Register/Login on voimes.com Step 2: Enable the skill "Gallery" on Alexa and open it by saying "Open Album Gallery" Step 3: You will get the code, note this code and get it verified on the Gallery/Albums section of the website Step 4: Once you are verified go ahead and create albums. Step 5: Once albums are created link few media under audios Step 6: Open the skill on Alexa and use it To view the process demo click on the link or visit the faq section on voimes.com https://www.voimes.com/faqs.php You are welcome to drop feedback or give suggestions on what you like or what you don't like. Also, what you want me to improve in the next version. Drop an email on voimesservices@gmail.com.

A simple math quiz with multiplication factors (numbers 1-10). During the game Alexa keeps track of how many questions you get right and wrong. At the end, Alexa will tell you how many you got right out of how many questions were asked.

Zoinks! Put on your detective hat and experience the spooks and sounds of Scooby Doo! Mystery Inc. Theater. This interactive storytelling experience puts you in control as you choose where and how the story unfolds. Work alongside your favorite characters including Scooby-Doo, Shaggy, Fred, Daphne and Velma to unravel the secrets behind their latest caper. Get ready to be challenged by the seemingly supernatural…things are not always what they seem. The mystery awaits, so gather ‘round and get solving! To Enable the skill, simply say "Alexa, enable Scooby-Doo" To open the skill, try "Alexa, open Scooby-Doo" To quit, just say “Alexa, quit” anytime during the game.

"Lucky the Leprechaun needs your help for a Magical Mission! Grab your kids and join him on an adventure to bring back the magic. Go through his magic portal to the 8 charm lands filled with new friends that can’t wait to meet you and Lucky! You’ll all work together to restore the magic. Use your imagination because magic is all around us. You just have to look for it! To get started, simply say, “Alexa, open Lucky Charms Magical Mission.” To start over at any point, say, “Alexa, start over.” To quit, just say, “Alexa, quit” anytime during the story. If you need to leave in the middle, you can say, “Alexa, pause” to pick back up where you left off when you return. Lucky Charms Magical Mission is for families and kids ages 6+."

It's me..!! Your Bye Buddy!!!  Isn't it cool, if there is always some Buddy to say Bye to you with a positive note every-time you say Bye and offer you a pleasant musical mood!! The day started positive is an opportunity to make a huge difference and have big impact in everyone's lives! Bye Buddy always wishes you to be positive! Now Bye Buddy also provides you seasonal greetings and shows her kindness by wishing you stay healthy quotes during uncertain times!  Whoever you are, whatever your age is, never mind!! Here comes your Bye Buddy! You can always leave home with happy Bye or surprise your kids or friends with a cool bye when you say Bye Buddy to me!! As Alexa playing one of the key role being part of family all day long, helping most of our daily routines, why not we start saying Bye to her whenever we step out of home,  wouldn't it be great if she says a happy bye with a positive note in Alexa's way and voice?? Do you and your family want a Cool Bye everyday and every-time!! It's so simple!! Step 1: Enable the Alexa Skill - "Bye Buddy" Step 2: Just say "Bye Buddy" Step 3: Hear Alexa saying cool bye with a positive note followed by a mild music; If you own a device with display, along with hearing, you can see a positive note with a cool Background. In headless devices, After enabling Bye Buddy skill to Alexa, whenever you say "Bye buddy" she will say "Bye Bye Buddy!! followed by a positive note and a pleasant music" In screened devices, After enabling Bye Buddy skill to Alexa, whenever you say "Bye buddy" she will say "Bye Bye Buddy!! followed by a positive note along with a pleasant music and Background image with the note displayed on it. Moreover "Bye Buddy" can say Bye to you or your kids, even you can make her say Bye to your friends too!! You will be surprised to hear and see, there is a buddy to say Bye Bye always with a positive note followed by a mild music and make your day an awesome start. Want to enjoy Bye Buddy? Just start saying, Alexa, "Bye Buddy" Alexa, "Launch Bye Buddy" Alexa, "Open Bye Buddy" Alexa, "Open Bye Buddy and say Goodbye!" Alexa, "Ask Bye Buddy to say Bye to my friend or kid or him..." Alexa, "Ask Bye Buddy to say Bye" Kindly leave your ratings and reviews which would be helpful in shaping Bye Buddy!  If would like to leave any feedback or experience any issues in Bye Buddy, the developer can be reached at byebuddyalexaskill@gmail.com

skill_name: Sleep Sound: Relaxation Sounds for Pre-K
skill_description: Sleep Sound: Relaxation Sounds for Pre-K, helps you to play ambient sounds to help you sleep in peace, or block unnecessary noise at work or at home. You'll be able to sleep better with high quality sounds, remain focused, study without interruption, relax quickly, meditate more effectively and get your baby to go to sleep faster!.
Celebrate mom with a list of awesome compliments. At any point, you can say "Alexa, stop" to exit the skill.
Play a Valentine's Day greeting card for your loved one. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

Spot the Set is a fun game designed to help build concentration and focus. There are three levels and four rounds per level - followed by a “Super Bonus” level. Players advance rounds by getting three in a row and early ToyBot™ Tokens that can be redeemed for virtual prizes. Levels and round are as follows: Voice level: - Round 1: voice sets - Round 2: speed sets - Round 3: volume sets - Round 4: Lightning Round (2x points) Word level: - Round 1: Letter sets - Round 2: Color sets - Round 3: Shape sets - Round 4: Lightning Round (2x points) Sound level: - Round 1: Instrument sets - Round 2: Animal ses - Round 3: Vehicle sets - Round 4: Lightning Round (2x points) Super Bonus level (unlocked after all prior levels have been completed) Commands - “Change level” - Change levels - “Reset” - Start over - “Tokens” - Hear how many ToyBot™ Tokens earned Why it’s really educational: This experience is designed to build executive function skills such as working memory, flexible thinking, and self control in a fun, engaging way! About SayKid By combining voice technology and tangible play, we help educators and families learn together in a safe, natural, and engaging way - without screens! For more on our innovative approach to screen-free, play-based learning, see our TEDx Talk on our website. Welcome to the future of financial literacy. NuMoola is a family-focused consumer banking app that uses real money, gamified education, and the family network to teach all about managing money, missions, and budgets. NuMoola makes financial literacy fun! NuMoola uses gaming and voice technology to teach the principals and resulting benefits of saving, spending, donating, and investing. With educational tasks based nationally recognized standards, you’ll learn all aspects of personal finance and accountability at your own unique pace. Our mission is simple: Prepare learners for tomorrow’s financial hurdles. NuMoola helps discuss money management topics when money starts to matter.

skill_name: Pedro's Fire Challenge by American Red Cross
skill_description: Brought to you by The American Red Cross, Pedro the Penguin’s fire safety challenge is an interactive game that helps you get prepared for a home fire and learn to be fire safe. Each game is a set of 5 randomized activities, including a mixture of home fire safety activities, coping activities (because home fires can be stressful) and good old fashioned penguin fun. Each time you play, you will get a different set of challenges, making for never-ending excitement! The game is designed for 4-8 year olds and is suited to individual or group play - all you need is your Alexa and your imagination! Give yourself plenty of room to complete the activities, swimming like a penguin and practicing your smoke crawl takes plenty of space, after all!  Each time you complete the challenge, you'll earn a fire safety badge in your Alexa app. With 20 badges to collect, keep playing to collect them all! To locate the badges, open your Alexa app, navigate to the More menu on the right side of the menu bar and select Activity. There you will find your badge!  To get started, simply say “Hey Alexa, open Pedro’s Fire Challenge!”

Buzz in with Echo Buttons in this fun trivia game show. This game requires at least 2 Echo Buttons. Echo Buttons offer a new way to play game skills through your compatible Echo device. To learn more just ask "Alexa, what are Echo Buttons?"    Get two to four contestants together to star in this game show! In each round, Alexa will ask a question. Players will buzz in with their Echo Buttons to answer. As you play, Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The contestant with the most correct answers wins!   While playing, you can say "Alexa, repeat that" to hear Alexa read the question again. You can also say, "Alexa, what are the scores?" to hear a score report. You can say, "Alexa, help!" to hear about what you can do next. You can say, "Alexa, start over" if you want to abandon the current game and pick up from the beginning. At any time you can say, "Alexa, stop" to halt the current game. If you had already started a game, Alexa will remember where you stopped and pick back up from the last question asked, when you next launch the skill. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

With the My Firetruck skill, you can hear your Firetruck come to life by starting your engine, using your siren, or calling into dispatch.  HOW DOES IT WORK? After enabling this skill, talk to your Firetruck by saying: "Alexa, use my Firetruck".  Then, you can say... - Alexa, turn on Siren - Alexa, listen to Dispatch - Alexa, open Equipment Drawer - Alexa, start the Engine - Alexa, call Dispatch - Try using "Repeat", "Stop", "Resume", or commands like "Loop" to add custom control to your Firetruck's sound effects when a sound effect is playing Tip: You can also speak directly to Alexa if you know which commands you'd like to give. Ex: "Alexa, use my Firetruck and turn on Siren" will activate your Firetruck and play your Firetruck's sirens.  We're constantly working on new updates to your Firetruck, and will be releasing additional sound effects in the future to. Check out our What's New section for the latest updates.

KIDS CARTOON QUIZ is a simple quiz skill created specifically for kids, including the younger ones.  ⭐GAMEPLAY⭐ During the game, Alexa will ask you questions about some of the most popular children cartoon series from recent years, and give you four choices of answers. All you have to do is respond by choosing Answer 1, 2, 3 or 4. You can also say the actual answer, in which case Alexa will ask you to confirm your answer just to be sure she heard you correctly! ⭐COMMANDS⭐ The following commands are available during the game: - WAIT, for Alexa to play you a music while you take time to think about the answer. To talk to Alexa before the end of the music, just say the name of the device, e.g. Alexa, Echo, or any other name you have set for your Alexa device. - REPEAT, to hear the question and choices of answer again. You can also ask Alexa to repeat only the question, or just the options. - HELP, to get a reminder on how the game is played, as well as the commands available. ⭐NOTE TO PARENTS/CARERS⭐ Kids Cartoon Quiz was built specifically for children and as such, the content is adapted to a younger audience. For example, you won't find any question about who created a cartoon show, or the date it first aired on TV! The language and interaction was also kept as simple as possible so that children can play the game on their own. Enjoy!

Take your children on an adventure with Let's Play: You Decide, a series of fun, interactive and educational activities led by Rebecca and Sid from the hit kids TV show Let's Play, a CBeebies favourite. Encourage your little ones to move their bodies, improve their listening skills and teach them the importance of helping those in need.  In the Emergency Pack, step into the shoes of a Key Emergency Workers. Help Dr. Rebecca get patients back to good health in the hospital and learn about the sound of the heartbeat. Next, lend the Fire Department a helping hand in preparing a fire truck so that it's ready for action - and then help Rebecca and the Chief Fire Officer put out a small fire in a nearby building. Finally, take on the role of a Police Officer helping Officer Sid find a lost cat.  There are three game packs available: the Emergency Pack; the History Pack; and the Explorer Pack. Each game pack features three exciting stories to immerse yourself and the kids in. The emergency pack is **free** to play. The other two game packs: History and Explorer are available through In-Skill Purchasing. skill_name: Indian NCERT Stories collection English and Hindi
skill_description: Many students tend to concentrate more on books that have been published by private publishers and less on the books which have been published by NCERT (National Council of Educational Research and Training). There are doubts amongst students and parents on whether they should do the studies as per the NCERT books or as per other books available in the market. This article will address these questions and help the students and parents to clear their concerns.  National Council of Educational Research and Training is an independent organization of the Government of India set up in India with the sole objective to design and implement a common education system in the entire country. Currently, the role of NCERT is to develop study material for students from class 1 to class 12 which includes the development of NCERT Textbooks, learning material for students, teaching material and reference material for teachers, audio and visual education content, organize various national level examinations and much other useful education material for school level students. NCERT books have been designed in an easy to read and understand format. The teachers in the schools should make the students read and understand the chapters in the schools class room itself. The teachers should make the students understand all the concepts which are given in each chapter. The concentration should be more on making the students understand the topics and concepts more rather than solving the questions which are given at the end of each chapter. The whole purpose of teaching should be to make the student understand the concept and the preparation of the student should be such that if any question comes in the exams from part of the chapter, the student should be able to answer the question from his understanding and not from what he has mugged up. The students should start from plain reading of the chapters followed by a discussion on the topics with the teacher and other students and making sure their understanding is correct followed by solving the questions which are given at the end of the NCERT chapters. The skill presents audio in the Hindi and English Languages.

Waka Waka! Talk to PAC-MAN in his own language and help him chomp his way through spectacular mazes, escaping ghosts and eating delicious fruit along the way. Meet PAL, the PAC-Assistant and Liaison, who helps out PAC-denizens in their day to day lives... just like Alexa does for you! But the Ghosts have stolen PAL’s voice powers! You and PAC-MAN need to help him recover them in this electrifying new adventure! Each power will be in a voice assistant-themed world. Can you find them all? Features: - Speak Wakanese with PAC-MAN – Say “waka”, “wiki”, “wika” and “waki” to tell PAC-MAN which way he should go! - Explore wondrous and different Worlds, each with 15 mazes for you to help PAC-MAN complete. New Worlds are added in every regular content update! - Experience classic arcade action with Inky, Pinky, Blinky and Clyde – all with a new voice-controlled twist. - Collect classic Power Pellets and discover the new Frenzy Mode, along with all the new mechanics each World has to reveal. - Complete objectives to earn stars and stack up an epic high score on each level! - Built by Doppio, the leading voice game developer founded by gaming veterans, makers of voice game hits The Vortex and The 3% Challenge. - NEW! Kick it off in Sports World, the latest PAL function, with 15 new levels. Steal all bases to reach the Max Score and kick soccer balls around the maze to defeat any Ghosts in your path! If you like this game, please leave us a review on the Alexa Skills Store. We love reviews! If you need assistance with PAC-MAN™ WAKA WAKA, or have any feedback about the game, please get in touch at https://doppio.games/support ******* AUDIO-ONLY EXPERIENCE: You can play the full version of PAC-MAN™ WAKA WAKA on an Echo Show or a Fire TV Cube device. If you don’t currently have one of these devices, don’t fret! You can still enjoy the PAC-MAN experience through the audio-only experience. Have insightful and fun conversations with PAC-MAN about anything. Ask him about his birthday, request a beatbox, and listen for the moods that PAC-MAN may be in. Try out all kinds of interactions with this classic arcade character! PAC-MAN™ WAKA WAKA & ©2021 BANDAI NAMCO Entertainment Inc. Published by BANDAI NAMCO Entertainment America Inc. ************** Update History ************** We update PAC-MAN™ WAKA WAKA regularly! For a full list of updates, visit us online at https://doppio.games/waka ************** In-Skill Purchases ************** Access to all of the content in PAC-MAN Waka Waka requires a subscription to the Waka Club. Waka Club members have full access to all available Worlds, and will get access to new Worlds as they are released. Without a subscription, you can enjoy the five levels of Tutorial World, as well as the first level in each other World, free of charge.

Buzz in with Echo Buttons in this fun trivia game show. This game requires at least 2 Echo Buttons. Echo Buttons offer a new way to play game skills through your compatible Echo device. To learn more just ask "Alexa, what are Echo Buttons?"    Get two to four contestants together to star in this game show! In each round, Alexa will ask a question. Players will buzz in with their Echo Buttons to answer. As you play, Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The contestant with the most correct answers wins!   While playing, you can say "Alexa, repeat that" to hear Alexa read the question again. You can also say, "Alexa, what are the scores?" to hear a score report. You can say, "Alexa, help!" to hear about what you can do next. You can say, "Alexa, start over" if you want to abandon the current game and pick up from the beginning. At any time you can say, "Alexa, stop" to halt the current game. If you had already started a game, Alexa will remember where you stopped and pick back up from the last question asked, when you next launch the skill. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Imagination meets innovation with the KidKraft 2-in-1 Kitchen & Market skill for Amazon Alexa (parental consent required). On one side, kids can learn to shop in the market with self-checkout, working smart scanner, bagging area, cash and drawer, storage shelves and freezer. On the other side, kids can cook in the lights and sounds kitchen, which includes fridge, freezer, sink, smart faucet, smart stovetop, smart oven, smart cutting board, microwave, storage hooks, chalkboard sign, storage shelves, utensils, plates, smart pot and pan. There are 34 interactive food items plus pot and pan that interact with the stove, cutting board and checkout scanner through built-in sensors. With 360˚ play for multiple kids and realistic kitchen and market sounds, the fun is magical, inspirational and unlike anything seen before. Once enabled, the KidKraft skill for Alexa will only respond when one of the RFID sensors are triggered in the kitchen or market. This skill will also respond to other inputs such as the stove/oven, faucet, oven door, game buttons and recipe cards.

Based in Foster City / San Mateo, CA, Peninsula Balvihar is a community of about 80 children & their families that meet every sunday, to discuss & learn, Hindu religious morals & Indian cultural values. We make it fun & easy for the kids - no home work - we mix it up with exercises, games & lots of humor to make it a unique learning experience - that kids look forward to every week. This skill helps newcomers to the Peninsula Balvihar family get acquainted with the songs and prayers. Please note that the prayers are in Sanskrit and Hindi; the lyrics can be found in our handbook.

skill_name: Indian Telugu Kids - Kids Stories and Rhymes
skill_description: Hi Kids, The wait is over. The Alexa skill consists of various Stories and Rhymes, especially for Telugu Speaking Kids. We hope you will love the Skill. From Ant and Dove to Old Granny, there are 700+ stories and rhymes in this skill. Panchatantra will take you to an adventurous ride by narrating stories. An example of mystic India, Panchatantra tales are the oldest surviving stories of mankind, surviving for centuries, from mouth to mouth, before they were documented. You will love the lucid pace of the stories, and they always make for great bedtime or storytelling sessions. These stories are converted from Sanskrit to Telugu with a mixture of local accents which helps the children to grasp the meaning and narration for listeners. Steps for using the skill: Session 1: User: Alexa, open Telugu kids Alexa: Starting Telugu Kids and stories - <audio> - You can say, play the stories, to begin. User: Play the stories User: begin Alexa: This is Episode <number> <Alexa completes the story or user interruption> User: Alexa, next User: Alexa, stop User: Alexa, next / previous User: Alexa, resume User: Alexa, start over User: Yes/No Session 2: User: Alexa, open Telugu kids Alexa: <audio> You were listening to Episode <number>, Would you like to resume? User: No Alexa: <Alexa starts over to the first episode and you can ask Alexa to step forward by saying Alexa, next> You are listening to the Telugu stories. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Session 3: User: Help Alexa: You are listening to Telugu stories. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. The skill memorizes your last activity and continues from the last time when you used the Telugu Kids Stories. All the Stories are presented in Telugu, which makes this skill only for Telugu speaking or related language understanding users. We hope you all like the Skill. For all users in India and the rest parts of the world, the skill responses in Hindi and Telugu audio. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Disclaimer ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This “Telugu Kids stories and rhymes” Alexa skill is intended for fun and entertainment purposes only. It contains audios in Indian local language ‘Telugu’. Users of this skill are fully aware of the local language and accepted to play the stories with their own knowledge and experience. Thank You!

Quiz of Kanyakumari ,Temples, Ancient, waterfalls, Seas, Ocean and Geography . Compete with like minded people from India and check your knowledge/Trivia. Kanyakumari, also known as Cape Comorin, It is a small coastal town in Tamil Nadu and the southern tip of India.  The waters of the Arabian sea, Bay of Bengal and Indian Ocean meet at this very place but the three shades of blue look distinct. The Triveni Sangam is the point from where you can speculate this marvel of nature. It has a coastal line of 71.5 kms stretched on the three sides. This small district is famous on its vast green stretches of paddy fields, coconut groves, Rubber garden and luxurious forests and the rare earth of the western sea shore and stretched valley mountain of the Western Ghats.

Buzz in with Echo Buttons in this fun trivia game show. This game requires at least 2 Echo Buttons. Echo Buttons offer a new way to play game skills through your compatible Echo device. To learn more just ask "Alexa, what are Echo Buttons?"    Get two to four contestants together to star in this game show! In each round, Alexa will ask a question. Players will buzz in with their Echo Buttons to answer. As you play, Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The contestant with the most correct answers wins!   While playing, you can say "Alexa, repeat that" to hear Alexa read the question again. You can also say, "Alexa, what are the scores?" to hear a score report. skill_name: LEVOOBA Kids: Educational Multiplayer Voice Battle
skill_description: EDUCATIONAL SINGLE- AND MUTLIPLAYER QUIZ With LEVOOBA Kids kids can train school subjects at home. They virtually get together for challenges - even if they don’t live in the same neighbourhood, have to stay at home because of Corona or are in times of virtual learning. If no one else is there for a voice battle, children can of course also solve quiz questions on their own. LEVOOBA Kids is meant for personal use and will enhance the learning situation of all students while they are at home. NOTE: Multiplayer mode only works after registration on the LEVOOBA website and a successful Account Linking with LEVOOBA Kids. You can do both with your Alexa app. Singleplayer mode does work without any registration or Account Linking. FULL PARENTAL CONTROL Only parents are allowed to set up the LEVOOBA Kids account. They link the account by using the Alexa app. Kids can also play LEVOOBA Kids without accountlinking - the singleplayer mode is always open. SCREEN-FREE DIGITAL LEARNING No reading or writing is necessary – so perfect already for pre-schoolers and first graders. And: LEVOOBA Kids is absolutely screen-free! Kids will learn just by voice-battles. DIVERSE QUESTION TYPES Unlike other voice quizzes LEVOOBA Kids offers multiple options for natural language answers. Instead of only saying answer "a", "b" or "c" kids can give their result after calculating or the letters when spelling straight away. Even whole words and sequences of numbers are possible. LEARN FROM MISTAKES If students give the wrong answer, they get the chance to learn from that. LEVOOBA Kids will explain the correct answer - which helps keeping it in mind. NOTIFICATIONS When a kids challenges another, the preferred opponent will automatically receive a notification. So you’ll always know when someone is challenging you. (Attention: Notifications only work if turned on in the Alexa app. Parents have to guide kids through the process of accepting a challenge.) PHYSICAL ACTIVITY During breaks and waiting periods LEVOOBA Kids encourages physical activity, because physical and mental fitness are tightly linked together. While performing funny activities, the brain turns on its rest mode and will be double the fit for the next voice battle afterwards. TEACHER-FRIENDLY Educators can register their classes for LEVOOBA Kids. They select fitting topics either from our database or they supply their own material. They follow up on the kids' results and learning progress at home, so they can circle it back to their own teaching. LEVOOBA Kids is not designed for classroom usage. It improves digital learning opportunities at home for all students. FEEDBACK What do you think about LEVOOBA Kids? Let us know! You can also contact us with your questions and feedback. If you like playing LEVOOBA Kids, feel free to provide feedback by writing a review or rate the Skill in the Skill store.

Everyone loves to play Simon Says! So, how do you play? Simple! Start with a group of your best friends or family standing in a line with enough space to move. Next, say "Alexa, open Simon Says". After a quick prompt, say "Start the game" and you'll be playing! The rules are simple: only perform the spoken action if I say 'Simon Says' first. If I don't say 'Simon Says', don't do anything or you are OUT. The last person still playing the game is the winner!   Beyond that it is totally up to you if you want to add rules, make it more or less strict, or whatever else you want to do! Some people try to require you to maintain all actions at the same time (which is really hard!) and other people only want you to perform the last action spoken.  The important thing is to have fun!

Buzz in with Echo Buttons in this fun trivia game show. This game requires at least 2 Echo Buttons. Echo Buttons offer a new way to play game skills through your compatible Echo device. To learn more just ask "Alexa, what are Echo Buttons?"    Get two to four contestants together to star in this game show! In each round, Alexa will ask a question. Players will buzz in with their Echo Buttons to answer. As you play, Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The contestant with the most correct answers wins!   While playing, you can say "Alexa, repeat that" to hear Alexa read the question again. You can also say, "Alexa, what are the scores?" to hear a score report. You can say, "Alexa, help!" to hear about what you can do next. You can say, "Alexa, start over" if you want to abandon the current game and pick up from the beginning. At any time you can say, "Alexa, stop" to halt the current game. If you had already started a game, Alexa will remember where you stopped and pick back up from the last question asked, when you next launch the skill. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Welcome to Maths Monsters Island.  This mysterious Island is home the the Maths Monsters. Rumour has it that there is buried treasure here on the Island and the Maths Monsters protect it and that they will do anything to stop people getting their hands on it. The only way to find and keep the treasure is by answering times tables questions to distract the Maths Monsters for long enough not to notice what you are doing. Maths Monsters is great for children to learn the times tables whilst having fun and competing to reach the top of the leaderboard. We have partnered up with select schools to allow them to see the results anonymously which will allow them to help children in the classroom by working on areas of the times table where a bit more practice is required. If your child's school has given you a pass phrase, you can use it when prompted by the skill or by saying my pass phrase is, followed by your pass phrase. We would like to thank Leamington Primary Academy for partnering up with us to make this skill. v1.0

With the Number Pirates children at pre-school and primary level can playfully learn the numbers from 1 to 10. The player is on a sea voyage and travels from island to island getting to know the numbers and their written form. At the end of each island the player experiences an adventure with Peter the pirate. Step by step the children learn three numbers on each island and is practicing them in short and fun games. Overall there are many hours of learning fun waiting for the kids. The learning is realized absolutely child-friendly and children can handle the skill completely on their own. Due to the varied mini games the adventure stays exciting the whole time. Whenever the kids need a break the skill will remember their progress, so they can continue right where they stopped. It is also possible for several kids to learn with one Alexa, since every kid will save their own progress. Each island belongs to one animal. When you are on an island you can either learn or practice the numbers for example: - „Panda learn“ - „Panda practice one“ Possible answers in the games are: - „yes“, „no“ - „one“, „two“, „three“, „four“, „five“, „six“, „seven“, „eight“, „nine“, „ten“ - „left“, „right“, „middle“ - „wrong“, „right“ Features: - Over 50 mini games - Many hours of gameplay fun without repetition - Exciting pirate adventure - Child-friendly introduction in the world of numbers - Progress will be saved - Different progress for several children is possible - Visual and auditory arranging of the numbers Currently Number Pirates is only available for the Echo Show first and second generation and for the FireTV

skill_name: Indian Marathi Kids: Stories and Rhymes
skill_description: Hi Kids,  The wait is over. The Alexa skill consists of various Stories and Rhymes, especially for Marathi Speaking Kids. We hope you will love the Skill. From Ant and Dove to Old Granny, there are 700+ stories and rhymes in this skill. Panchatantra will take you to an adventurous ride by narrating stories. An example of mystic India, Panchatantra tales are the oldest surviving stories of mankind, surviving for centuries, from mouth to mouth, before they were documented. You will love the lucid pace of the stories, and they always make for great bedtime or storytelling sessions. Share them will all story lovers, and let them enjoy the light, enchanting life of the stories. These stories are converted from Sanskrit to Marathi with a mixture of local accents which helps the children to grasp the meaning and narration for listeners.  Steps for using the skill: Session 1: User: Alexa, open marathi kids Alexa: Starting Marathi Kids and stories - <audio> - You can say, play the stories, to begin. User: Play the stories User: begin Alexa: This is Episode <number> <Alexa completes the story or user interruption> User: Alexa, next User: Alexa, stop User: Alexa, next / previous User: Alexa, resume User: Alexa, start over User: Yes/No Session 2: User: Alexa, open Marathi Kids Alexa: <audio> You were listening to Episode <number>, Would you like to resume? User: No Alexa: <Alexa starts over to the first episode and you can ask Alexa to step forward by saying Alexa, next> You are listening to the Marathi stories. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Session 3: User: Help Alexa: You are listening to Marathi kids. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. The skill memorizes your last activity and continues from the last time when you used the Marathi Kids Stories. Keep loving Alexa and Keyring Corp. All the Stories are presented in Marathi, which makes this skill only for Marathi speaking or related language understanding users. We hope you all like the Skill. We have also released various Alexa skills for stories in regional languages in Marathi, Kannada, Telegu, and Bangla, Tamil  For all users in India and the rest parts of the world, the skill responses in Marathi and Hindi audio.  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Disclaimer ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This “Marathi Kids stories and rhymes” Alexa skill is intended for fun and entertainment purposes only. It contains audios in Indian local language ‘Marathi’. Users of this skill are fully aware of the local language and accepted to play the stories with their own knowledge and experience.

Flywheel's  is changing the current landscape of education. Our mission is to teach you any subject, anywhere, and anytime you want. And we don't want to just "teach" you. We want to teach you in a way that helps you become an expert, and most importantly, have fun in the process. We are starting with two topics:  'Math- Addition', 'Math-Subtraction', ideal for kids ages 4-12.  For our little friends to relax, we have also added a third topic, story time. The teaching starts with Level 1 (single-digit numbers) and auto-upgrades the student to the next level if five consecutive responses are correct. The skill will also keep track of where and how many mistakes you are making, and will take a few minutes to teach the user some helpful tricks. Give it a try! We would love to hear from you on how we did and what can we improve.

In Hide the Robot, one person hides a robot while the others try to find it. When someone finds the robot, say “I found you” to end the game or “new game” to start again.  Why it’s educational: Kids learn by moving around and searching for a robot. In doing so, they build important gross motor skills in a fun, engaging way! Hello Math is a mini-game for kids to practice elementary arithmetics. The user can choose from addition, subtraction, multiplication, division or mixed questions. Each round is made up of 10 questions, at the end of which a final score from 0-100 will be given.  - Addition: the answer will be in the range from 0 to 100. - Subtraction: the answer will be in the range from 0 to 100. - Multiplication: the given numbers will be in the range from 0 to 10. - Division: the answer will always be an integer from 1 to 10. Have fun learning! :)

When you mix blue and yellow you get green.  Children often learn this concept of blending colors very early in life.  When you mix consonant sounds, by placing two or more consonants next to each other in a word, you end up with blend.  There are many consonant blends and Brainspray has lessons for each.  However, this lesson simply reviews a brief collection of some popular consonant blends.  Before trying this lesson, you should first make sure the student has been through the individual consonant blend lessons.

Buzz in with Echo Buttons in this fun trivia game show. This game requires at least 2 Echo Buttons. Echo Buttons offer a new way to play game skills through your compatible Echo device. To learn more just ask "Alexa, what are Echo Buttons?"    Get two to four contestants together to star in this game show! In each round, Alexa will ask a question. Players will buzz in with their Echo Buttons to answer. As you play, Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The contestant with the most correct answers wins!   While playing, you can say "Alexa, repeat that" to hear Alexa read the question again. You can also say, "Alexa, what are the scores?" to hear a score report. You can say, "Alexa, help!" to hear about what you can do next. You can say, "Alexa, start over" if you want to abandon the current game and pick up from the beginning. At any time you can say, "Alexa, stop" to halt the current game. If you had already started a game, Alexa will remember where you stopped and pick back up from the last question asked, when you next launch the skill. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

If your child can count to ten, they have then they have the ability to add one to at least eight numbers.  You can prove this with the Next Number skill. If they can add one to at least eight numbers they can also add one hundred eight times using their fingers.  This MathHack is designed to help you introduce the concept of counting by hundreds and adding hundreds.  Toddlers and preschoolers can do amazing things with numbers and letters, given the right incentives.  Now you can measure their progress two numbers at a time, while helping them master adding and comparing numbers.  If your toddler or preschooler can count to ten and add one, using their fingers or by memory, this lesson is for you.

Learn the colors in a playful way with the help of Alexa. As a prerequisite to play you need at least two echo buttons OR an Alexa device with display. The following In-Skill products are available for purchase to extend the game with additional colors: - Color Package 1: violet, orange, white, turquoise - Color Package 2: pink, lime, gold, lavender, coral The game continues to run until it is stopped with the voice command "Alexa, stop". Are you ready to explore your emotions? DJ Missy Motion is in the house to help kids celebrate their feelings.  Join in DJ Missy’s Dance Party, Name That Mood guessing game, and Feelings Facts trivia and earn rewards. Then, power down in The Chill Zone. MOOD MAGIC is a first-of-its-kind Alexa skill that teaches kids ages 5 to 8 about their emotions (and improves moods!) using original songs and feelings-focused activities. It’s part dance party, part mindful play, and a whole lot of fun. DJ Missy teaches self-awareness and the powerful idea that we can control our emotions—and even change and enjoy them—with music.  Developed with a respected child psychologist, MOOD MAGIC also lets kids know it’s okay to have feelings and gives them the words and tools to better express themselves. Everyone gets [angry/afraid/etc.] sometimes! Whether kids need to “shake the sillies out” or go from “blue to happy,” DJ Missy will find a song or activity to match the emotion.  ** Make sure ‘Kid Skill Purchasing’ is enabled in your Alexa app to purchase the expanded experience with bonus songs, Feelings Facts, Chill Zone activities, and reward sounds. ** If you enjoyed MOOD MAGIC please leave us a review below! We'd also love to hear from you at hello@boomintegrated.com. Thanks for playing and dancing with us!  —DJ Missy Motion. Please Note: Disabling the skill will erase all previous player data on the game. All songs written and produced by John Marshall Media Vocals performed by Aspen Vincent, Bryce Ryness and Jeff Washburn DJ performed by Kara Oates Illustrations by Helen Haggerty Mood Magic™ is © 2020 BOOM Integrated, a division of John Marshall Media. If you and your child have completed enough Math Hack lessons, it's time for you to take a Prize Closet challenge.    The Prize Closet challenge in Math Hack is not a typical "quiz", because the questions are designed to balance math problems you are nearly certain your child can answer (one third of the questions), another third of the questions are problems they seem to be gaining proficiency in and the final third are truly challenging questions.   This is a great opportunity for you to reinforce math skills that require practice, help your child reinforce some nearly acquired math skills and assess how close they are to future math concepts.   Most of all, this is a fun and safe environment to introduce your child to the reality that both familiar and new math problems can be solved correctly using different methods.   As your child gores beyond learning their 81 addition facts much sooner than the national average, it's a great time to transition into multiplication and exponents.  Their age doesn't matter (this sample prize closet was successfully completed by a child just before their fourth birthday.

If your child can count to 25 and you've used MathHack's "Next Number" lesson to help them add one to any number, it's time to move on to adding single digit numbers to double digit numbers.   This means that even if your child isn't in kindergarten yet, but can count to 25 and has succesfully completed the Next Number skill by Brainpsray, they may be able to solve the "81 addition facts" 1st graders aim to achieve. Bigger Number First teaches applies a somewhat new spin to the widespread strategy of adding the biggest (or larger) number first when adding two numbers.  Students using this MathHack are instructed to make a fist with one hand say the larger number, then begin counting up from their using their other hand to add the smaller number. The system, using the Brainspray's Alexa lesson, has taken a child just shy of four years old from being able to add two digits to being able to accurately complete all 81 math facts  within three weeks of starting the program.  Your child may take less time or more time, but they will have a tool that goes beyond rote memorization in their box of solutions needed to master some basic math skills way above schedule. Toddlers and preschoolers can do amazing things with numbers and letters, given the right incentives.  Now you can measure their progress two numbers at a time, while helping them master adding and comparing numbers.  If your toddler or preschooler can count to 25 and add one digit, this lesson is for you.

Based on Strengths and Virtues, kids can explore stories related to Wisdom, Courage, Humanity, Transcendence, Justice, and Moderation. To start a Kids Decision session, you can ask, Alexa, open Kids Decisions. You can also ask, Alexa, ask Kids Decisions to tell me a story.  You can ask for specific topics and see if Ember has a story for you. For example, you can ask, Alexa, ask Kids Decisions to tell me a story about chocolate.  You can ask for specific virtues and Ember will tell you a story related to that virtue. For example, you can ask, Alexa, ask Decisions for Kids to tell me a story about courage.  Decisions for Kids has a website, http://decisionsforkids.com/, where teachers and parents can craft and submit stories that Ember will use.

Nanak Time is dedicated to anyone who wants to live a beautiful and purposeful life. Inspired from the Mool Mantar composed by Guru Nanak Dev Ji, this app explores universal concepts such as Oneness, Truthful Living and living Without Fear and Hate. Specifically created to work around your busy lifestyle, the app allows you to: * Explore the 9 Gems of Mool Mantar by listening to short Audio Lessons and Guided Meditations * Apply the essence of the Gems to your daily life with simple-to-follow guides and hands-on exercises *Journal your thoughts and experiences * Use the reminders to keep you on track to complete your lessons * Enjoy the ripple effect of the simple exercises designed to impact the community around you Guru Nanak Dev Ji was the first of ten Sikh Guru’s and was born in 1469. He composed many sublime poems through a lifetime of traveling the globe and sharing his enlightened message of Ek Onkar, Oneness. The Mool Mantar is said to be the first composition uttered by Guru Nanak Dev Ji upon enlightenment at the age of about 30. The word ""Mool"" means main or root and ""Mantar"" means chant or verse. Together the words ""Mool Mantar"" mean the ""Main chant"" or ""root verse"" The Mool Mantar is regarded by many as the thesis of his work. Often described as just a summary of the Divine, the Mool Mantar is actually considered to define and carry a deep implication for human existence. Each of the 9 words (Gems) encompass a truly global concept of habits, traits and mindset we should aim to achieve. By explaining the theories and suggesting practical ways to integrate each of the concepts into your daily life, Nanak Time intends to get you started on this journey of discovery and self-reflection. You can pause and play by saying "Alexa, pause" and "Alexa, resume." Just say "Alexa, stop" when you're done for the day. When listening to podcasts you can say "Alexa, shuffle" to shuffle the playing order, or "Alexa, loop" to loop the current episode. You can also ask for previous and next episodes by saying "Alexa, previous" and "Alexa, next".

If your child can count to ten, they have then they have the ability to add one to at least eight numbers.  This MathHack from Brainspray is designed to allow your child to start doing that in as little as a day, but on average in about a week. Now you can measure their progress two numbers at a time, while helping them master adding and comparing numbers.  If your toddler or preschooler can count to ten, this lesson is for you.

Hoggy Missions is a part of the vast Hoggy Universe, now available for free on Alexa to help kids stay at home while having fun. Hoggy is a cute piggy alien that has come from planet Hoggyland to seek help from a Superhero on Earth. Kids get a chance to be a superhero by helping Hoggy on Missions to save Hoggyland from the evil 'Naruko'. Kids participate in highly engaging & interactive missions by being a part of the story and performing actions to move forward in the mission. Alongside fun &good habits, kids also get educational learning- For ex. when they unlock Magical doors by speaking the correct spelling of 'Ice-cream'. Keep your kids busy while you work & rest peacefully. How to go on Missions- 1. Start with 'Hoggy Missions' 2. Follow instructions, try to perform actions as Hoggy tells, to move forward in Missions. Hoggy Missions are Pretend Play, where the kid uses his/her imagination to imagine the world and uses relatable household objects to perform actions in the Mission- Like using a Pencil Eraser as Magic Stones for attacking evil Naruko with Magic, Climbing on the bed to avoid hot Molten Lava or hiding behind the curtains to hide from Naruko's bodyguards.

Cherry Math makes learning basic arithmetic operations fun and engaging. Cherry Math keeps track of your answers, and will periodically ask you those that you missed. The difficulty is adapted automatically, while providing encouraging feedback as you progress. Cherry Math makes learning math efficient and stimulating. Here are some of the basic commands to get you started:  "five questions on additions" "four questions on subtractions" "nine questions on multiplications"                                                                       "three questions on divisions" On multiplications and divisions, you can provide the tables as follows:  "1,2 and 3"                                                                                         "from 2 to 5" "all except 6 and 7" "from 1 to 3 and from 5 to 7" Some of the interactions that Cherry Math will understand: "Random order" - questions to be asked randomly "Ascending order" -  tables questions to be asked in ascending order "Long answers" - for a bit of cheering after each answer "Short answers" - for the pros and impatient ones "Harder" - make questions a bit harder   "Easier" - make questions a bit easier "Boring!" - will stop current series and ask what do to                                                               "Repeat" - repeat last question "Next" - skip to next question "Review" or "Practice" - recently missed questions will be asked "Revise subtractions" - recently missed questions on subtractions will be asked "Score" - will tell your current score                                                                                                                "Close" or "Bye bye" - Cherry Math will leave your place The more Cherry Math gets to know you, the faster you will improve your math skills! Attribution: https://public-cherry-math.s3.amazonaws.com/www/quotes.html Feedback and questions: alexa.cherry.math@gmail.com

skill_name: Bandar mama pehen pyajama Indian rhyme
skill_description: "Bandar Mama Pehen Pyjama" is a Hindi Rhyme funny song. Enjoy Kids. We have updated the skill with a more smooth and fault-free experience. We are continuing the legacy of the previous skill with a more advanced and smooth voice experience. bandar mama will take you on an adventurous ride to the jungle. Whether it is time to sleep or dinner, play this rhyme for kids and your kid will love it. Steps for using the skill: Session 1: User: Alexa, open bandar mama Alexa: Starting bandar mama, you can say start or begin User: Start / Begin Alexa: Playing bandar mama User: Alexa, next User: Alexa, stop User: Alexa, shuffle User: Alexa, next / previous User: Alexa, resume User: Alexa, start over User: Yes/No Session 2: User: Alexa, open bandar mama Alexa: You were listening to bandar mama already, Would you like to resume? User: No Alexa: <Alexa starts over to play the audio from start> You are listening to the bandar mama stories. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Session 3: User: Help Alexa: You are listening to the bandar mama. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Once invoked, Alexa will automatically start the conversation and play the audio. Sit back, relax, and enjoy the rhyme of bandar mama. To start again on finishing one story, you can ask Alexa to open it again. When you reach the bottom of the playlist, try saying, Alexa, start over or Alexa, shuffle

The vowel pattern e. a. most often makes the long e sound, as in eat.  But there are a fair number of exceptions you should practice and this skill can help. The e.a. vowel pattern is pronounced like the long e sound, a single vowel sound.  This means it's technically a monophthong in lingual parlance.  What?  Well, don't worry, you don't need to know all of that to practice identifying words with the e.a. pattern that make the long e sound from words with the e.a. vowel partners that make a different sound, like the long a sound in break or the short e sound in bread.   We'll just call the ones that rhyme with "eat" eat words.  Feed some baby monsters their eat words to practice.  If you do well, reward yourself with an apple or a jelly bean.
