As someone who has a child with sensory processing disorder, we often need to utilize different strategies to help calm down during a meltdown or in crowds. These are similar strategies Occupational Therapists use to help people with anxiety and sensory processing disorders. When helping our child with these strategies, we found that it also really helped adults as well.  These strategies help with anger episodes, anxiety, meltdowns, tension. Even if you do not have any of  diagnoses, this information can still be very helpful. Anytime any of these situations begin, just say "Alexa, open sensory avoider," and a helpful strategy will be provided to help calm down. Between our echo devices and echo auto, it makes using this skill helpful in many areas. Have you ever scratched your head when some one from a hindi community mentions a number when dealing with money? Have you asked what's the English version of the number mentioned in Hindi? Or do you have tough time negotiating prices while travelling in auto/cabs in North India  Whether you are in India or abroad, Novice or expert, it does not hurt to revise the hindi number system!!  Amaze your friends with your new found super power!! We have specifically recorded short audios for numbers from 0 to 100 with a short pause. The pause enables you to think of the number yourself before we reveal the hindi number. To master any number from 0 to 100., you can repeat them any number of times. The numbers in the 100's and 1000's follow similar pattern. Once you have gained mastery over 0 to 100 numbers it will be easy to master others Sample Utterances Invocation: 1. Alexa, Open Master Hindi Numbers After the welcome message You can say 2. Alexa, fifty five --- for having 55 in Hindi or  3 Alexa, get me 77 --- for having an audio of 77 in hindi with a short pause between the english and hindi version OR 4 Alexa, yes, for series of numbers from 0 to 100 with english and hindi versions for about 4 minutes Welcome to Master Hindi Numbers !! May you attain mastery!!

Players, especially children and adults, improve cognitive areas such as attention and language. They will also enrich their vocabulary. Initially there are 8 categories: - Colors, Animals, Fruits, Cars, Clothes, States of USA, Months, or Actors Alexa will spell different words totally randomly depending on the category chosen. How to play: Alexa open Word Mix and select "Actors"     Alexa: Next Actor -> s,w,m,t,h,i,l,l,i     You: Will Smith     Alexa: Next Actor -> ... ** NOTE: If you have an Echo, we recommend you take a piece of paper and a pen to write down the letters that Alexa will spell. In case you haven't had time to listen, say "repeat" and it will spell the word again. FEEDBACK Please leave a review if you like the game. Select a number and Alexa will give you math operations and another number for the operation. This Alexa skill helps kids to start and master mental math abilities in a fun and interactive game. How to play: 1)   start by saying "start mathematics guru". 2)   The skills should reply with "Welcome to the mathematics guru. Start by saying a number" 3)   The user should speak a number after this. This number will be considered as one of the operands 4)   Alexa will announce another number along with an operand. 5)   The user is now supposed to perform the operation on the operands and announce the result to alexa. 6)    If the answer is correct, Alexa will say another number and another operand. 7)    The user gets 3 chances to find the correct answer. 8)    the user can say exit if he wants to quit.

Young minds learn best when taught in an interactive fashion. Our skill considers these factors and presents a character, Simba, for them to explore countries and learn about festivals with. The skill is targeted towards 3-9-year-old children. The skill is designed in a way that children can learn on their own, or parents can invoke the skill and walk through it with their children.   Once the user launches the skill by saying, "Open Simba Safari", he/she can use it in two ways- 1. Interactive mode that helps them learn about festivals. 2. Interactive mode of exploring countries and learning about them.   If the user wishes to explore a country, Alexa randomly selects a country for the user to explore or explore one of the user's choice. If the user wishes to learn about festivals, Alexa randomly selects a festival to learn or starts with one of the user's choice.

You can guess your answer, say repeat or say next for the next soundbite.  Your game will end after all of the game's sounds have been solved.

skill_description: Lots of family fun! Interact with Bubbles the Bobcat in activities for children 3-5 years old. Includes music to dance to, educational activities and a little Simon Says gotcha fun! Bubbles the Bobcat is the mascot for the Bubble Sayz line of products available on Amazon Alexa and in the Amazon Kindle eBook Store. Please try out Bathe With Bubbles the Bobcat. Listed here in the Alexa App. We highly request you seek out these and other works by the Artists included in our Skill.  Here are their works inside: Heads, Shoulders Knees and Toes by Stockwaves Put your Hands in the Air by Stockwaves Dancing Like an Animal by Stockwaves I hope you enjoy this Skill. Please leave your valued feedback. Please visit us at BubbleLogix.com

Next time you're trying to decide whose turn it is pick something or perform a task, just ask Alexa for help. For example, if you're trying to decide whose turn it is to pick a movie on movie night, Alexa can randomly select someone's name from the list. Or if you're trying to decide who should take out the trash, Alexa can help with that too!

Open the skill and Alexa will automatically tell you how many days remain until all your upcoming events. Alexa can also remind you about the exact date for a specific events. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

Ballyland™ Flight is a fun, educational game for young children. The story takes them to the popular Ballyland, an imaginary world that is home to the Ballylanders, created by Sonokids®. This is where they will find Ballicopter, the little red helicopter, flying high through the skies, on his way to visit one of his friends. What will happen and how his adventure will develop, will be decided by the children! They are encouraged to use simple words to select twists in the story, developing voice control interaction with Alexa in a safe environment.  This game was created by experienced audio game developers and is particularly rich in audio. It uses a well-known voice for narration, includes two original songs that your children may want to move, sing, or dance along with, and offers great sound effects that will capture their imagination. Young children who are blind or visually impaired will also be able to enjoy and engage with this story, building self-confidence in the use of voice control technology.  “Every day is a Ballyland day, and a Ballyland day is a happy day!” The game helps to develop: • Simple voice commands to use smart speaker technology with voice control • Language skills • Choice Making skills • Concept of Cause & Effect • Concept of sequencing • Concepts such as nice/bad, slow/fast, grumpy/happy  • Singing and moving along to songs • Recognizing musical instruments and styles

UnpauseIt Podcast is a family of geeks - a dad, a mom, a son, and a daughter - who are here to review and rate today's entertainment for your family! UnpauseIt reviews movies, shows, video games, events, and experiences so your whole family can have a solid idea of how to enjoy life together.  Listen to our podcast reviews, and also check out our website for reviews, ratings, and lists at www.unpauseit.show. We'll also take your suggestions and recommendations for what you'd like us to try!

Fast Facts is a fun way to practice mental math.  Just tell Alexa what grade level you want to play at (1st grade through 6th grade available today, more to come), and then choose multiplication, division, addition, or subtraction.  For each game, you'll have one minute to answer as many questions as you can.   Fast Fasts will track your results and let you know whenever you beat your high score for each grade and game mode. Examples: Alexa, Open Fast Facts and play first grade (Alexa will offer you game choices within that grade) Play fourth grade multiplication (Alexa will start the game immediately) Times Table Challenge (Alexa will ask you to select a number) Pre-Algebra Integers (Alexa will ask you to choose addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division)

This game requires at least 2 Echo Buttons, but the more the merrier!  Two to four contestants will battle each other to become top star of the Christmas Tree!  Alexa will ask three questions about the objects on the Christmas tree.  Players will have 30 seconds to find the answer, race back to their Echo buttons, and buzz in with their answer.  If you're right, you get a point.  Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The player with the most correct answers wins!  If there's a tie, you can celebrate your joint victory with Christmas cheer!

Buzz in with Echo Buttons in this fun trivia game show. This game requires at least 2 Echo Buttons. Echo Buttons offer a new way to play game skills through your compatible Echo device. To learn more just ask "Alexa, what are Echo Buttons?"    Get two to four contestants together to star in this game show! In each round, Alexa will ask a question. Players will buzz in with their Echo Buttons to answer. As you play, Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The contestant with the most correct answers wins!   While playing, you can say "Alexa, repeat that" to hear Alexa read the question again. You can also say, "Alexa, what are the scores?" to hear a score report. You can say, "Alexa, help!" to hear about what you can do next. You can say, "Alexa, start over" if you want to abandon the current game and pick up from the beginning. At any time you can say, "Alexa, stop" to halt the current game. If you had already started a game, Alexa will remember where you stopped and pick back up from the last question asked, when you next launch the skill. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Just before the holidays, a frozen container, recently recovered from an iceberg floating in the North Sea, arrived at our offices.  Upon examination of the mysterious container and its contents, we believe we have come into possession of audio recordings from an expedition that successfully made contact with Santa’s famous North Pole workshop. Yes that’s right.  This isn’t just some pretend fantastical audio tour!  These are actual recordings of elves from the North Pole, assembling toys and flying reindeer.  In addition, our researchers also believe there is a moment captured when you can actually hear Santa Claus himself - but only if you listen carefully. If you enable our skill you will be able to listen to the following areas… -Train Depot- Loud whistles in the distance, locomotives blasting in and out of the icy mist. Everywhere, elves creatures, scrambling, unloading barrels of nails, wood, and paint.   Where is it all going? -Toy Hall- A thunderous hallway filled with tiny creatures whirling about assembling toys. Who are they? Rivers of trinkets, ornaments, nicknacks, games, dolls, cutting edge electronics fly into a great hall where miles and miles of brightly colored wapping paper spin together into presents, all flying to and fro.  Whats that in the distance?  A giant sleigh! -The Naughty or Nice Department- Tiny creatures all around, hundreds of them writing names down on an enormous list.  Nice … Nice … Nice … Naughty … Nice … Nice … Naughty … Nice … Who’s naughty and who’s nice? BONUS ACCESS We at Trees With Leaves (developers of fine applications and other useful things) are proud to bring you these recordings in the form of Santa’s Workshop, and would love it if you might consider purchasing some of our bonus access.  This purchase will help us restore some of the more damaged recordings and help us with our ongoing research.  -Woodworking Shop- Tapping, chattering little creatures everywhere … All tapping, sawing, and painting. So many toys! … Trains, cars, dolls, animals. A giant clock ticking and tocking on the wall. -Reindeer Flight Testing- Outside in the reindeer paddock we hear the sounds of reindeer taking flight, practicing for the big day.   Overhead, Dasher and Prancer are racing around in circles. INSTRUCTIONS Fist say … “Alexa, open Santa’s Workshop.” ... after prompt, say … 1 “Visit” or “listen.”  Alexa will take you through the entire collection. Or visit individual locations, for example … Fist say … “Alexa, open Santa’s Workshop.” ... after prompt say … 1. “Visit the Train Depot.” or 2. “Visit the Toy Hall.” or with bonus access 2. “Visit the Toy Hall.” HELP Fist say … “Alexa, open Santa’s Workshop.” ... after prompt say … 1. “Help.” 2. “Send info card.” Feedback and contact We love feedback, please leave a review or contact us at … contact@treeswithleaves.com Privacy Policy https://treeswithleaves.com/swprivacypolicy Terms of Use https://treeswithleaves.com/swtermsofuse

skill_name: Old MacDonald had a farm E.I.E.I.O.
skill_description: Old MacDonald had a farm Ee i ee i o And on his farm he had some cows Ee i ee i oh With a moo-moo here And a moo-moo there Here a moo, there a moo Everywhere a moo-moo Old MacDonald had a farm Ee i ee i o Old MacDonald had a farm Ee i ee i o And on his farm he had some chicks Ee i ee i o With a cluck-cluck here And a cluck-cluck there Here a cluck, there a cluck Everywhere a cluck-cluck Old MacDonald had a farm Ee i ee i o Old MacDonald had a farm Ee i ee i o And on his farm he had some pigs Ee i ee i o With an oink-oink here And an oink-oink there Here an oink, there an oink Everywhere an oink-oink Old MacDonald had a farm Ee i ee i o We have updated the skill with a more smooth and fault-free experience. We are continuing the legacy of the previous skill with a more advanced and smooth voice experience. old macdonald had a farm Indian Rhyme will take you on an adventurous ride to the famous old macdonald had a farm right from your home. Whether it is time to sleep or dinner, play this rhyme for kids and your kid will love it. Steps for using the skill: Session 1: User: Alexa, open old rhyme Alexa: Starting old macdonald had a farm, you can say start or begin User: Start / Begin Alexa: Playing old macdonald had a farm User: Alexa, next User: Alexa, stop User: Alexa, shuffle User: Alexa, next / previous User: Alexa, resume User: Alexa, start over User: Yes/No Session 2: User: Alexa, open old rhyme Alexa: You were listening to old macdonald had a farm already, Would you like to resume? User: No Alexa: <Alexa starts over to play the audio from start> You are listening to the old macdonald had a farm rhyme. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Session 3: User: Help Alexa: You are listening to the old macdonald had a farm. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Once invoked, Alexa will automatically start the conversation and play the audio. Sit back, relax, and enjoy the rhyme of old macdonald had a farm. To start again on finishing one story, you can ask Alexa to open it again. When you reach the bottom of the playlist, try saying, Alexa, start over or Alexa, shuffle

Will you help join Mica to build a new school on The Moon? ------------------------------------------------------------------------ The children behind the stories The stories from this interactive Alexa Skills experience are all based off real-life stories from Save The Children: •Salah from South Sudan realised that there was nowhere for villagers to get a haircut, so started to offer haircuts himself. - Told by Moses  •After a typhoon hit a village in the Philippines a local boy there started to have fun again by learning to surf. - Told by Ashly  •The village that Munni from India lived in didn’t have a school, so she taught her friends how to read and write. - Told by Pinky  •Frasier from the UK wrote a story about being friends with a refugee - Told by Peter  •Abdullahi from Tanzania had no well in his village. So he built one. - Told by Jacob  •Faisal from Syria had to walk a long way to his new home. He finds joy in painting and especially bears! - Told by Salma ------------------------------------------------------------------------ Your feedback If you think we could improve this skill, then please email mediacomalexa@gmail.com with your feedback.

Does your toddler or preschooler know the alphabet?  Then they can probably start reading some three letter CVC (consonant vowel consonant)  words some "Letter Monsters" in a matter of weeks with a little bit of practice.   This skill is designed give parents another way to help very young learners gain fluency in reading words that have just three letters.  There are many reasons this early skill is important to developing reading.    There are about 200 CVC words you will want you early reader to know.  They probably recognize some you didn't even know they were familiar with.  Practicing is key and this skill is one of many tools you can use to keep the process of practicing rewarding and fun. Toddler's and preschoolers that know their phonics can read simple three letter words without knowing how to tell the difference between a vowel and a consonant.   But there are many good reasons but perhaps simplest is that virtually every word used in English has a vowel in it.   You may want to try to the Long Vowel Monster and Short Vowel Monster Alexa skills if your child hasn't had much exposure to the concept of vowels and consonants. As your young learner progresses in reading their ability to quickly decipher, or "sound out" more difficult words will improve how fast they can read and how accurately they can read.  This impacts reading comprehension and as a result the ability of your child to teach themselves as they get a little older.   Before most little children can read they've heard "Old McDonald had a farm, 'E', 'I', 'E', 'I', '0', many times.  Simply knowing that E, I and O are vowels can be helpful.  We hope this skill is also a helpful tool for you and your child find another way to make word sandwiches (consonants are the bread and a vowel is the meat) fun.

With Tricky Words, kids can practice reading tricky/exception, and high frequency, words that they should learn and be able to recognize almost instantly in order to become the great little readers we want them to be!  For every 10 words read properly, you get a star. The stars you collect give you access to higher levels introducing new words. <!> NOTE: Because this skill is about reading, it is better suited for devices with a screen. If you don't have one, you can still play but you need to make sure you have a device with the Alexa app handy as the words will be shown on the app (on the 'Activity' page). <!> ⭐GAMEPLAY⭐ Simple! Alexa will show you a word on the device's screen or on your Alexa App ('Activity' section), and all you have to do is read the word back. Alexa will then tell you whether your answer is correct or not. You can have as many tries as you want to read the word. The most important is for you to try your best and practice! ⭐COMMANDS⭐ During the game, you can ask Alexa to: 1. WAIT, if you need more time to read the word. Alexa will play a hold music lasting 30 seconds. To interact with Alexa during that period, just say Alexa (or any other wake word if you changed your device's settings). 2. SKIP, if you really can't find the word and want to come back to it later. Alexa will ask you to repeat the word three times to memorize it. 3. tell you HOW MANY STARS you have, if you have been reading well and lost count of the number of stars you have collected. If you or you little one enjoy this game, please show your support by rating this skill and leaving a review. The objective is to make this game interesting enough for kids to be willing to practice reading all those words regularly, so if you have any suggestion to improve the game, or encounter any issue or bug while playing, please get in touch by emailing me at translationfd@gmail.com. LET'S GET READING!

If your toddler or preschooler has learned to count to ten, congratulations!  Those number skills will help them to read and spell also.  But when using numbers to describe letters, you are often more concern with the position (ordinal values) of the letter than cardinal values (quantity).  You might ask your child, "what's the first letter?", or "what's the second letter?"   In these situations, the value of knowing 1st, 2nd, 3rd and so forth to reading efforts becomes clear. Fortunately, there are many fun ways to get your young learner to voluntarily explore ordinal values while learning other important things about the world they live in.  Learning about the planets is one way to do this. Toddlers and preschoolers can do amazing things with numbers and letters, given the right incentives.  Now you can measure their progress by adding numbers to five one at a a time by voice, while helping them master adding and comparing numbers.  If your toddler or preschooler can count to ten, this skill is for you. Every child is unique, but they all have to learn some of the same things to succeed.  Planet Monster is a skill you can try yourself and, if it's something you think might fit with your child, you can request to personalize in the following ways:  Choose an incentive (prize) for your child         - One jelly bean         - An apple         - Using the iPad         - A lollipop          - Whatever else you want to offer! If you got something useful out the Planet Monster, tell us in the review comments and, if you want, let us know what you would like changed to better fit your child (number of questions, specific questions, prizes, etc.).  We'll try to incorporate the personalization request into the app for free for the community and let you know when it's ready.  It's that easy!  Have fun and keep feeding those monsters planets!  Yum!

Would you like to create a story about a space alien inventor who crash lands on an island full of pirates?  A space alien whose best friend is a cowgirl, and goes on an epic quest against a stinky hobgoblin?  Or, how about a pixie princess who goes on a crazy space adventure with a parrot who thinks he's a human?  What about a law abiding sheriff (coming soon) who has his favourite hat stolen by a pirate queen and goes after her in a rocket? Then it's time to MASH UP! Choose your favourite hero. Pair them up with a sidekick. Decide where will your story begin. Best of all... chose a dastardly villain. Mwah! Mwah ha haaa! .... and lots more ways to mash up your story any way you like. You can mix and mash from very different story universes to create thousands of epic tales. No two are exactly the same. And as your story unfolds you're asked memory questions and make decisions for your hero. Whatever you say will change the outcome of each Mash Up even further. Will your ending be happy or not so happy? It's up to you. There are so many stories, twists and hidden surprises to unlock and discover. You'll never run out of new adventures. If your Alexa device has a screen you can enjoy rich visuals. Mash Up Adventures features lots of humor and fun, but it also has educational value too. As they enjoy each crazy tale, kids learn the components of what makes a story a story! This skill supports learning for kids in the area of English Language Arts (ELA). Say 'help' if you're not sure what is going on. If you'd like to start over, you can say 'Alexa, start over.'

Have fun practicing multiplication and division with math loving sidekick Ginger the Math Cat! Earn star points and embark on the journey to become next math Ninja Master! Check all that apply: ⭐️ Have you just started practicing your first multiplications and divisions? ⭐️ Are you looking for help memorizing those pesky times tables? ⭐️ Were you ever wondering if cats would be good practice partners? ⭐️ Did you possibly consider against all well meant advice to pursue career of Ninja Master? ⭐️ Do you excessively overuse emoji whenever you can? And, could all of this be a little fun too, please? You might have just arrived! For grown-ups: Ginger Math helps your child memorize 2nd and 3rd grade times tables using simple daily multiplication routine. Designed with accessibility in mind, Ginger Math lets your child easily replay preset practice terms on their own. Choose multiplication or division, number of questions and one of four increasingly challenging difficulty levels. • Easy, factors from 0 to 4. • Medium, factors from 2 to 6. • Advanced, factors from 3 to 8. • Hard, factors from 4 to 12. Ginger Math adjusts to your child's progress emphasizing repetition where necessary. Conversely, with increasing proficiency, reduces verbosity and provides your child with opportunity to redo missed answers. Skill attempts to engage with funny voice interactions, visual appeal, practice score keeping and long term goal with easy to understand progress summary. If your practitioner is visual learner and you do not have Echo device with the screen, have your child practice using the Alexa app on the tablet or phone first. Invocation phrases: • Have Ginger Math help you start new or replay usual practice: “Alexa, open Ginger Math”. • Ask Ginger Math for particular times or division table: “Alexa, ask Ginger Math for times table”. • Have Ginger Math summarize practice progress: “Alexa, ask Ginger Math about results”. In-skill invocation phrases: • Ask Ginger Math for more time to answer the question: “I need more time” or “Wait”. • Tell Ginger Math to repeat the question: “Say that again” or “Repeat”. • Have Ginger Math help with the answer: “I don't know” or “Tell me”. • Ask Ginger Math to start new or restart usual round: “Start new practice” or “Play usual round”. Let us know what you think, good, bad, we take 'em all. Or just feel like leaving us friendly note? Drop us a line at hello.gingermath@gmail.com and we will get back to you as soon we finish our daily practice!

Does your toddler or preschooler know the alphabet?  Then they can probably teach long vowels to some "Letter Monsters" in a matter of weeks with a little bit of practice.   This skill is designed give parents another way to help very young learners identify long vowels. Toddler's and preschoolers that know their phonics can read simple three letter words without knowing how to tell the difference between a vowel and a consonant.  So why should your child get to know their vowels as soon as posible?  There are many good reasons but perhaps simplest is that virtually every word used in English has a vowel in it.   As your young learner progresses in reading their ability to quickly decipher, or "sound out" more difficult words will improve how fast they can read and how accurately they can read.  This impacts reading comprehension and as a result the ability of your child to teach themselves as they get a little older.   Before most little children can read they've heard "Old McDonald had a farm, 'E', 'I', 'E', 'I', '0', many times.  Simply knowing that E, I and O are vowels can be helpful.  We hope this skill is also a helpful tool for you and your child find another way to make learning vowels fun.

Want to practice adding the number two using your hands, counting with your monster fingers and using your voice?  Then this skill is for you! Toddlers and preschoolers can do amazing things with numbers and letters, given the right incentives.  Now you can measure their progress two numbers at a time, while helping them master adding and comparing numbers.  If your toddler or preschooler can count to ten, this skill is for you. Every child is unique, but they all have to learn some of the same things to succeed.  Number monster is a skill you can try yourself and, if it's something you think might fit with your child, you can personalize in the following ways:  Choose an incentive (prize) for your child         - One jelly bean         - An apple         - Using the iPad         - A lollipop          - Whatever else you want to offer! If you got something useful out the Monster Two, tell us in the review comments and, if you want, let us know what you would liked changed to better fit your child (number of questions, specific questions, prizes, etc.).  We'll update the app for free and let you know when it's ready.  It's that easy!  Have fun and keep feeding those monsters correct number!  Yum!

Ever wondered what it would be like to talk to the Clangers? Well now you can find out from the comfort of your own home! Tiny and Small are waiting to talk to you, with Alexa on hand to get the conversation started. Tiny & Small love to chat - find out about life on the Little Blue Planet, ask what they eat and what they do for fun... you can ask them anything you want and hear their charming whistle responses back. If you are lucky you might bump into Major Clanger, Mother and Granny Clanger - and the Soup Dragon, Iron Chicken and Baby Soup Dragon are never far away. If you stick around long enough a Sky Moo might fly past and say hello! You can also ask the Clangers to sing ‘Happy Birthday to You’ or ‘Merry Christmas’ to brighten up your day. With something for everyone, simply say ‘Alexa, open Clangers Talk’ to start talking to Tiny and Small.

The fun animal guessing game for kids of all ages!  Developed by Speech professionals to promote a variety of speech and communication skills! Alexa will pretend to be an animal and it's your job to guess who she is pretending to be! All the Animal guessing games consist of: * A Fun rhyming Riddle * Creative Clues * Fun facts about the animal Alexa was pretending to be! If you have a compatible device, Alexa will show some stunning photography of the animals and the habitats they reside in. The game has been developed in partnership with a certified Speech and Language Therapist.  Particular effort has been made to promote key areas of communication development. * Listening - The riddles rhyme so as to be engaging for ears young and old. * Memory - To recall earlier clues and combine with later ones and deduce the animal. * Turn Taking - Alexa models the key process of speaking in turn before giving the player a chance to guess. * Building Vocabulary - Uses a variety of language to deepen the semantic knowledge of words. * Clear Speech - Alexa accepts common mispronunciations of animals (ie 'munti' for 'monkey') and models the correct pronunciation. * Visual Association - On Echo devices with screens, the skill associates the word with engaging pictures. * Positive Reinforcement - Alexa encourages the player positively, there is no score keeping and no penalty for incorrect answers. * Repetition - The format doesn't change, so each of the above is positively reinforced with each new play. If you are enjoying the game, leave us a review! Terms ------- All effort has been made to ensure the animal facts are accurate at the time of writing.  Please let us know if we've got something not quite right! Privacy Policy ---------------- This skill only stores the number of times you have heard an animal clue.  This is to reduce the chance of hearing the same one in succession. It contains no ads, does not communicate outside the Amazon Web Services ecosystem and uses no other personal data.

This skill dictates graphic dictations. There are several dictations in the skill, whose difficulty will increase as the user makes more dictations. Dictation speed can be changed (there are five speed levels, the game is default to the medium one). Dictations are told trace by trace so the user can guess what they are drawing as the dictation goes on. Traces are referred to the cardinal points (north, south, east and west). This way, kids get used to managing with cardinal points. A piece of graph/plotting paper is needed to draw following the squares on the paper. If the user gets lost, they may say so and the dictation will start again from the beginning. Have fun drawing this dictations!

skill_name: Story Starter by selfStarter VOICE EDUCATION
skill_description: Help your child become a self starter! Just teach them to say, "Alexa, open Story Starter" then say "Student," and Alexa will give them a daily writing prompt. Educational exercises initiated by students can help them become independent learners, while at the same time, developing confidence in their ability to finish assignments.   After your child writes their response to the writing prompt, have them give it to you, and at your own leisure say, "Alexa, open Story Starter." Choose the "Teacher" option, and Alexa will read the teacher's guide for the daily writing prompt so you can review your student's work.  If you have a pre-writer, have them dictate their answer to you, and use some or all of what you wrote down as an opportunity for them to do copy work. Dictation and copy work exercises will build reading, writing, and grammar skills. This is the first Skill by selfStarter: VOICE EDUCATION. Go to https://selfstarter.io for more info about how to use this Skill, and for tips on how you can help your child become a self starter!

Rylee has selected a sample of her favorite sleep sounds so that she doesn't keep her parents up at night!  This skill is super simple to use. My goal was to create something that would be really easy to use and avoid excess speaking while doing exactly what it is supposed to do: namely, play sleeping sounds for babies, children, or adults!  1) Say next or previous to choose sounds.   - The skill will remember your most recent selection when relaunching. 2) Say turn whisper on or off.  - It will remember your settings whenever you launch so you don't wake your baby up. 3) Say loop on or loop off.  - It will remember your settings and continually loop your current selection. 4) Say play (sound name).  - Jump right to the sound you like. And that is it! Here are the sounds: - Rain - Ambiance - Drone - Vacuum - Stream - River - Fan - Hallway Fan - Thunder I'll keep adding new and different sounds over time so keep your eyes out for those! I know that there are tons of similar offerings out there, but my goal with this was to cut down on the verbiage and sales pitches and get right to the sounds.

Buzz in with Echo Buttons in this fun trivia game show. This game requires at least 2 Echo Buttons. Echo Buttons offer a new way to play game skills through your compatible Echo device. To learn more just ask "Alexa, what are Echo Buttons?"    Get two to four contestants together to star in this game show! In each round, Alexa will ask a question. Players will buzz in with their Echo Buttons to answer. As you play, Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The contestant with the most correct answers wins! Almost 300 million people around the world play soccer, and the amount of people that watch the sport is equally staggering. It is the most popular sport in the world and is the national sport of over 60 different nations. The STEM Familia skill offers evidence-based, dual-language instruction, practice, and feedback in scientific academic vocabulary (SAV). The skill is designed to help elementary English learner students and their families acquire the specific vocabulary and language skills that support STEM learning and success.  STEM Familia contains 18 sequential 12-minute lessons. Each lesson targets a single word. To facilitate a dual-language experience, all directions, commentary, and feedback is delivered by a bilingual narrator via the skill’s embedded audio files. Each instructional activity is delivered first in Spanish and then in English. Questions that call for a Spanish language response trigger general feedback that reinforces users’ effort and offers a statement of the correct response. Users’ English language responses trigger specific feedback, with reinforcement for correct answers or corrective feedback for incorrect answers.  To initiate the skill, users say, “Alexa, Open STEM Familia.” A narrator delivers an introductory message in Spanish welcoming families and providing directions about how to access the three possible paths for engagement.  Path 1-“New word” allows users to access a word lesson.  Path 2- “Review words” allows users to review abbreviated lessons of previously learned words. Path 3-“Repeat word” allows users to repeat a specific word lesson. A follow up prompt asks users to specify which word they would like to repeat.  As users complete word lessons, they advance to the next target word lesson. Word lessons. Game 1/new word: When users initiate a new lesson, they hear skill’s narrator giving instruction on the new word (La nueva palabra es ‘evidencia’/The new word is ‘evidence’). The narrator then poses a question to test users’ knowledge (¿Cual es la nueva palabra?/What is the new word?). Users’ responses trigger general feedback in Spanish (Muy bien! La nueva palabra es ‘evidencia’!) or specific feedback in English (Yes, the new word is ‘evidence’/ Good try! The new word is ‘evidence’.)  Game 2/definition: A similar instructional sequence in used for the target word’s definition. Users are given instruction in the target word’s meaning, asked to generate the target word’s meaning, and then given general or specific feedback based on their response.  Game 3/spelling: Users are given instruction on how to spell the target word, then asked to spell the target word. Generic feedback is provided in Spanish and English.  Game 4/usage: To practice usage, users are asked to complete a sentence using the target word and receive general or specific feedback based on their responses. Game 5/synonyms: Users are taught a common synonym for the target word, tested on their ability to recall the synonym, then provided with generic or specific feedback. Game 6/meaning verification game: Users listen to sentences with the target word and are asked to verify (si/no, yes/no) if the correct word meaning is reflected in the sentence. Game 7/complete sentence usage: Users are asked to repeat full sentences that include the target word.  Modeling vignettes: Following a brief review of the target word’s meaning and spelling, users listen to a 30-second Spanish language audio vignette in which a parent and child model an interaction using the target word.  Users then hear a 30-second English language audio vignette in which the same student and his/her teacher interact using the target word in an academic context.  Conclusion: Users hear a Spanish language parting message encouraging them to use the target word in family conversations.

How fast can you climb the mountain? Just ask Alexa!  Introducing “Mountain” by Audiolex LLC. Mountain is one of the most well-known dice games, now transformed for you to enjoy through Alexa.  Mountain is a simple arithmetic game for kids all ages. The mountain game can be played directly against Alexa or Alexa can take on the role of the scorekeeper and overseer. Beyond enjoying our game, parents have the option to gain access to our progress-tracking dashboard.  Through this dashboard, parents can monitor their child’s speech & language development over each successive game in accordance to the ASHA Guidelines*.  *ASHA is the American Speech-Hearing-Language Association. More information can be found at https://www.asha.org/about/    ** Make sure ‘Kid Skill Purchasing’ is enabled in your Alexa App to play the full game **  RULES BELOW  ——————————————————————————————————————————— Age: All-ages  Number of players: 1 - 4 (including Alexa)  Equipment: 2 dice (optional)  The object of the game is to be the first to climb your mountain, in number order, and then descend the other side. Youngest player goes first.  First player rolls the dice and hopes for a 1, which will allow them to reach the first step in their mountain. They must ascend in numerical order, so they cannot cross off the 2 until they have crossed off the 1. If they roll a 1 and a 2, however, they can cross ascend both steps in one turn. The player continues rolling dice until they roll numbers that do not match the next step(s) on their mountain. The turn is then passed to the next player. Play continues until someone has made it all the way up their mountain and down the other side in the correct order. You may choose to roll your own, physical dice or have Alexa roll virtual dice for you. If personal dice are rolled, each player has to announce the numbers they’ve rolled in order to climb the mountain or move onto the next player. If Alexa rolls the virtual dice, she will announce the numbers that have been rolled. However, the player still has to repeat the roll outcome in order to continue playing the game.  Alexa may participate as one of the active players or simply maintain score and order of the game.  ——————————————————————————————————————————————————— Mountain skill is suitable for kids and will require verified parental consent if not granted earlier for another kid skill. PLEASE NOTE: If you have issues, questions or comments please email us at info@audiolex.org. We want to hear directly from you! ADDITIONAL NOTE: Disabling the skill will erase all previous player data on the game. DISCLAIMER: The data contained in the progress-tracking dashboard, including the text, images, and graphics, are for informational purposes only. Use of the dashboard is not intended to be a substitute for professional medical judgment and you should promptly contact your own health care provider regarding any medical conditions or medical questions that you have. THE DASHBOARD DOES NOT OFFER MEDICAL ADVICE, AND NOTHING CONTAINED IN THE CONTENT IS INTENDED TO CONSTITUTE PROFESSIONAL ADVICE FOR MEDICAL DIAGNOSIS OR TREATMENT. © 2019 AUDIOLEX LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.

Your Story Hour has encouraged young people (kids, teens and the young at heart) for nearly six decades, helping them to embrace high moral principles, while at the same time enjoying storytelling at its best.  Once enabled, you can listen to the most recent episode by saying, "Alexa, play Your Story Hour" To pause or resume any episode, say "Alexa, pause" or "Alexa, resume." If you want to know the title of an episode while the episode is playing, say "Alexa, ask Your Story Hour for the title of this episode." If you want to know the air date of an episode, say "Alexa, ask Your Story Hour for the date of this episode."

“Lunnis de Leyenda” es una skill interactiva en la que los niños y niñas vivirán junto a los Lunnis las maravillosas aventuras de personajes como Hércules, Velázquez o Marie Curiede la serie de Clan Internacional. A lo largo de la narración, los Lunnis pedirán ayuda a los niños y niñas para decidir qué debe hacer el protagonista de la leyenda en distintos momentos clave de su historia. ¿Cómo puede cruzar Aníbal el río? ¿Qué podría pintar Velázquez para impresionar al Rey?. Al escoger una de las opciones planteadas, la historia se desarrolla por nuevos y divertidos caminos que pueden llevar a una canción original de Lucrecia… o a volverlo a intentar para lograr un final feliz. De esta manera, cada leyenda puede jugarse de hasta 15 formas distintas, para aprender de forma activa la vida de algunos de los personajes más relevantes de la historia.“Lunnis de Leyenda”, se basa en la reconocida serie de televisión del canal ClanInternacional de RTVE. Lupita, Lucho, Lulila y Lublú hacen de anfitriones de 10 historias originales protagonizadas por Hércules, Cervantes, María Pita, Gara y Jonay, Aníbal, Quevedo, Concepción Arenal, Tambor del Bruc, Marie Curie y Velázquez.

Welcome to the Sudoku game skill. This skill offers you 4 levels of difficulty suitable for everyone. Also, you get 5 different themes. The Letter Game is designed to help parents teach early literacy skills in a safe, natural, and engaging way! The Letter Game works on three important early literacy skills (3 levels per literacy skill and 10 questions per level) as follows: - Letter names (identify the names of letters) - Letter sounds (identify the sounds of letters) - Letter blends (identify combination of letters that make a sound) To skip ahead: - Start Over  -Say, “New Game” - New Game - Say, “Letter Names” or “Letter Sounds” or “Letter Blends” - New Level - Say, “Next Level” or “Previous Level” By combining voice technology and real-world, tangible play, SayKid helps families learn together in a safe, natural, and engaging way. Search "SayKid" on the Alexa Skill store for additional learning experiences.  If you found the skill helpful, we greatly appreciate reviews! Awards - SayKid wins Grand Prize in the 2020 Alexa EdTech Competition  - Harvard names SayKid a Finalist in the Saul Zaentz Early Education Competition - SayKid wins MN Cup "Moonshot" Prize at US Bank Stadium

Let your kids enjoy listening to the most popular nursery rhymes of all times. A selection of most popular and melodious rhymes to keep your kids enthralled. Listening to these will help improve their imagination, concentration and focus.  HOW TO USE Before first use, enable the skill by pressing the Enable button in the Skill Store, then say "Alexa, open Yo Rhymes" to begin. To finish, say "Alexa, stop". Got a distraction or need a break? No problem. Simply say 'Alexa, Pause' and resume listening to the playlist when you return by saying 'Alexa, Resume'.  To move to next or previous song, you can say 'Alexa, Next', or 'Alexa, Previous' . List of Rhymes currently available:  ------------------------------------------- 1.  Baa Baa Black Sheep  2. Chubby Cheeks  3. Five Little Ducks  4. Goosey Goosey 5. Humpty Dumpty  6. Hickory Dickory Dock  7. Incy Wincy Spider  8. Johny Johny  9. Jack and Jill   10. London Bridge  11. Little Teapot  12. Mary had a little Lamb  13. Old MacDonald  14.One Two Buckle My Shoe  15. Rain Rain Go Away  16. Ring a Ring a roses  17. This is the way  18. The Grand   19. Three Blind Mice  20. Sample Utterances:  - For Addition - What's five-point nine plus three.  - For Subtraction - What is five-point nine minus three.  - For Multiplication - What is five-point nine multiplied by three.  - For Division - What's five-point nine divided by three. This is being developed for middle school kids like me in mind.  Link to my Git Hub page where you can get source code: https://github.com/joelmanjet/my-calculator-py Explanation of the code is on my YouTube channel where I do educational videos: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCSt9bIi3GKhuTw7n1WaYz8Q

It's the classic game What's the time Mr Wolf. You probably already know how to play this game but if you don't keep on reading... HOW TO PLAY: Enable the skill. Stand at least 6 steps away from your Alexa device. Then shout "Alexa, open What's the time Mr Wolf." Mr wolf will then tell you the time, which will be the number of steps you need to come closer.  If he says 3 O'clock. Then you need to take 3 steps closer to your Alexa device.  If you don't have much space then just do small steps when you are given the time. BE WARNED! Mr Wolf is a hungry chap and if you ask him the time enough it will eventually be DINNER TIME!! When it's dinner time you need to turn around and run away to safety. Safety can be your starting point or a base that you decided at the start of the game.   Good luck! ON SCREEN: If you have a device with a screen you will get to see what Mr Wolf looks like. Even when it's dinner time. FEEDBACK: If you loved the game then please do give the skill a 5 star rating and tell all your friends. If you hated the skill or have ideas on ways to improve the skill then please don't leave a negative review (it will break my heart). Send all that negative feedback to: Threadwell studios.  threadwellstudios@gmail.com I will do my best to improve the skill from that feedback and make it a 5 star skill for everyone :) Thanks for playing! Henry ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ This skill was a collaboration with HUGO.FM Check them out for more great Alexa skills.

This is an educational skill that presents interesting facts about the deep sea through the eyes of Drippy Dip - a friendly and fun deep sea creature who has come to the surface to tell us about the place she is from. She uses simple language to describe fascinating facts about deep sea exploration, some history - and mainly, the wonderful creatures that live there. The skill has a number of facts that are presented one after the other in a random order, as long as the user continues to ask for more. Just ask Alexa to open Drippy Dip - and let Drippy introduce herself and guide you through fascinating details.  The information will be refreshed periodically - so please do come back for new facts.  This skill is for curious kids of all ages - who we hope can learn something new about the mysterious deep sea.

Los “Cuentos de Clan” es una skill interactiva con 100 cuentos para todos los gustos: de fantasía, de animales, de travesuras, historias divertidas o fábulas del mundo. Los niños y niñas pueden pedirle al asistente virtual qué cuento quieren escuchar y repetir sus favoritos de manera sencilla e intuitiva. De día, el asistente contará dos cuentos seguidos, y de noche, uno ideal para ir a la cama.  Los “Cuentos de Clan” nace de las narraciones de Esther de Lorenzo para Radio 5 de RTVE y han sido cuidadosamente seleccionados para ofrecer un aporte educativo y equilibrado a los niños y niñas.  De una forma tan sencilla como pedir ‘Alexa, abre Cuentos de Clan’, empieza una experiencia virtual en la que brujas, ogros, madrastras y lobos nos harán pensar y reflexionar a lo largo de 100 historietas originales.  Una vez haya empezado el cuento, de unos 4 minutos de duración, nuestro joven oyente podrá parar, seguir, salir o bien cambiar de cuento mediante sencillos comandos como “Alexa pausa” o “Alexa continua”.  Y tras el colorín colorado hay mucho más. Con solo decir “Alexa, quiero otro Cuento de Clan”, la experiencia empezará otra vez con más cuentos por descubrir y disfrutar.

skill_name: Twinkle Twinkle Little Star - Indian Rhyme
skill_description: We have updated the skill with a more smooth and fault-free experience. We are continuing the legacy of the previous skill with a more advanced and smooth voice experience. Twinkle Star will take you on an adventurous ride to the moon. Whether it is time to sleep or dinner, play this rhyme for kids and your kid will love it. Steps for using the skill: Session 1: User: Alexa, open twinkle star Alexa: Starting twinkle star, you can say start or begin User: Start / Begin Alexa: Playing Twinkle Star User: Alexa, next User: Alexa, stop User: Alexa, shuffle User: Alexa, next / previous User: Alexa, resume User: Alexa, start over User: Yes/No Session 2: User: Alexa, open twinkle star Alexa: You were listening to twinkle star already, Would you like to resume? User: No Alexa: <Alexa starts over to play the audio from start> You are listening to the Twinkle Star stories. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Session 3: User: Help Alexa: You are listening to the Twinkle Star. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Once invoked, Alexa will automatically start the conversation and play the audio. Sit back, relax, and enjoy the rhyme of Twinkle Twinkle Star. To start again on finishing one story, you can ask Alexa to open it again. When you reach the bottom of the playlist, try saying, Alexa, start over or Alexa, shuffle

skill_name: Haathi Raja Kaha Chale - Indian Rhyme 🐘
skill_description: Haathi Raja depicts an elephant that roams in the village and visits different villagers. People in the village ask the elephant to pay a visit to their houses and be their guests. Further villagers offer food and stay to the elephant. Elephants are considered sacred in the Great Indian History because of lord Ganesha. Hence all the villagers love the visit of the elephant "Haathi Raja" in their small village. The poem will take you to the magic world of the Haathi Raja.  The Alexa skill is specially designed for kids of the age group 4-13 years old. We have updated the skill with a more smooth and fault-free experience. We are continuing the legacy of the previous skill with a more advanced and smooth voice experience. Haathi Raja will take you on an adventurous ride to the village. Whether it is time to sleep or dinner, play this rhyme for kids and your kid will love it. Steps for using the skill: Session 1: User: Alexa, start haathi raja Alexa: Starting haathi raja, you can say start or begin User: Start / Begin Alexa: Playing haathi raja User: Alexa, next User: Alexa, stop User: Alexa, shuffle User: Alexa, next / previous User: Alexa, resume User: Alexa, start over User: Yes/No Session 2: User: Alexa, start haathi raja Alexa: You were listening to haathi raja already, Would you like to resume? User: No Alexa: <Alexa starts over to play the audio from start> You are listening to the haathi raja. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Session 3: User: Help Alexa: You are listening to the haathi raja. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Once invoked, Alexa will automatically start the conversation and play the audio. Sit back, relax, and enjoy the rhyme of haathi raja. To start again on finishing one story, you can ask Alexa to open it again by saying Alexa, start haathi raja When you reach the bottom of the playlist, try saying, Alexa, start over or Alexa, shuffle. However, all the audio are same which plays different versions of haathi raja.

The Stolen Stars of Matariki is a bilingual (English and Māori) illustrated story with engaging voice recordings, sound effects, music and illustrations. Synopsis: Sam and Te Rerehua, visiting Grandma and Pōua at Te Mata Hāpuku (Birdling’s Flat). While collecting agate and fishing for eels from the beach they look up at the stars and their grandmother tells them stories. One night Grandma notices two Matariki stars are missing from the sky. They then discover some naughty patupaiarehe playing on the beach with two glowing rocks. It’s up to Sam and Te Rerehua to save the stars. The two fair-headed children blend in with the patupaiarehe on the beach and ask what is happening.  The patupaiarehe spend so much time skiting about what they’re going to do with the two stolen stars they don’t notice it’s nearly sunrise. When Te Rerehua tells them the sun is coming up, the patupaiarehe run from the beach, fearing their delicate white skins will burn.Pōua launches the two Matariki stars back up into the sky with his eeling gaff, and the nine stars of Matariki are back together again. The grandparents and children then carry their freshly caught eels home. About the Book’s Creators: Miriama Kamo is an award-winning journalist. She is the anchor of TVNZ’s flagship current affairs programme Sunday and Māori current affairs programme Marae. Miriama has worked on many of TVNZ’s key programmes including 1 News at 6 as a newsreader. She is also a keen writer who is published in Metro, NZ Herald and The Spinoff and is currently trying her hand at writing a screenplay. Miriama and husband Mike are proud parents of Sam and Te Rerehua. This is her first book with Scholastic NZ.Zak Waipara is a former NZ Herald graphic artist and HOD of Animation at Animation College.   Zak Waipara (Rongowhakaata, Ngati Porou, Ngati Ruapani, Ngati Kahungunu) is now Digital Media lecturer at AUT. He has worked as a designer for Māori Television’s children’s show Miharo, illustrated comics and a range of books, and created animated music videos. He is the illustrator of Horeta and the Waka (Scholastic NZ). Born in Milton, in the South Island, Zak now lives in Auckland. About the Scholastic: Scholastic is the world’s largest children’s book publisher and Scholastic New Zealand has been bringing the best in children’s books to Kiwi kids, Kiwi families and Kiwi schools throughout New Zealand for more than 50 years. With LUCKY Book Club and Book Fairs, Scholastic helps Kiwi kids learn to love books and reading, and works with New Zealand teachers to help build a culture of literacy at their school. For more information visit www.scholastic.co.nz. This project was funded by Perpetual Guardian Foundation from the Shifted Perspectives fund.

The Wizcart platform began as a pure self-scanning application and grew over time in response to the needs of merchants and customers. Now it includes a variety of capabilities designed to allow different retail formats to fully digitize their customer interactions. The core platform involves an application for shoppers and a separate application for staff that mediates shopping, customer service, and promotions. The shopper application comes in two flavors: Universal, for use by multiple smaller retailers, and Private White-label, for larger brands. Additional capabilities include product marketing, order-ahead counter service, and a special loss prevention system that is more secure than a standard checkout lane​.

skill_name: Ask My Kid - Remote Learning Activities
skill_description: Designed to help students and kids learn and study at home. Teachers and parents love having the extra support during busy days and evenings with AskMyKid. Whether kids are distance and remote learning or after a full day at school, kids often struggle to focus on study and homework. To support, AskMyKid has brain breaks, timers, academic practice, and emotional support activities. Teachers and parents can instantly add their own activities too. To learn how visit and see the full list of commands, go to:  https://askmykid.com/activities For example: - Need to get students to refocus for homework? Say “Alexa, calm down with my kid" or "Alexa, ask my kid to calm down" - Need to get their wiggles out? “Alexa, dance with my kid” or "Alexa, ask my kid to dance" - Want to build their attention muscle? “Alexa, mindfulness with my kid” or " Alexa, ask my kid for mindfulness" - Want a timer? “Alexa, 2-minute music countdown with my kid” or "Alexa, ask my kid for a 2-minute music countdown" - How about calm music during work time? “Alexa, background music with my kid” or "Alexa, ask my kid for background music" Either start the command with "ask my kid" or end with "with my kid". Learn more: At AskMyClass, we believe in making education more empowering and engaging, using affordable tools, so every child learns better. Voice technology and AI are skills that all kids will be interacting with when they enter the workforce in 10 years, and we’re keen on getting them ready for that future. Visit us at GoAskMyClass.com.  If you’re a teacher looking for AskMyClass - Classroom Edition - search the skills store or learn more here: GoAskMyClass.com. If you’ve got content ideas or constructive feedback just email team@goaskmyclass.com. We’d love to hear from you.

•Summary Highlights Storybooks from Bamboo boosts kids’ reading and listening comprehension through interactive Highlights professionally narrated stories. Highlights’ unique approach to “Fun with a Purpose” helps engage children through entertaining stories, while also promoting skills that help lead to success in school – and beyond!  •Basic Use (How it works) Children and parents can start the skill by asking Alexa to “Open Highlights Storybooks.” They then can select a reading exercise level and story. A friendly narrator begins reading selections from the storybook. After each narration, children are asked questions about the story, which they can verbally answer. Alexa identifies whether the answer is correct or incorrect.  Navigation tips: Say “Alexa, open Highlights Storybooks” to open skill Say “Level 1”, “Level 2”, or “Level 3” to change difficulty Say “Switch Books” to change story Say “Give me a Hint” to get a hint Say “Alexa, stop” to exit •Story Titles (content available)  Level 1: Enjoy the Show, Bea and Lop, Pigs in My Garden, Davy Duck's Grumpy Day Level 2: Lulu Builds a Choo-Choo, Little Bunny Celebrates Spring, The Lucky Penny, Time for a Party Level 3: Robin's Best Nest, Balto the Sled Dog, In the Rain Forest, The Skeleton Crew MORE levels and stories to come!  •Development evidence  How will this help my child?  -Fosters reading skills for both readers and pre-readers to expand vocabulary, hone grammar and better prepare for tests  -Sparks interest and imagination with audio stories, a new and different way of learning -Increases engagement and independence with child-friendly content and interface Why is this fun for kids?  -Professionally voiced storytelling conveys depth and emotion, engaging children in multisensory experiences and brings reading to life.  -Multiple genres allow kids to choose stories that appeal to them, building a passion for reading.  -Wide variety of stories, themes and reading levels encourage hours of engagement and learning! •Bamboo Grove (Optional Parent Portal) & Account Linking Registration on Bamboo Grove provides results about how children are progressing, so parents can understand their strengths and areas for development & view badges awarded. Parents can register for a FREE Bamboo Learning account on Bamboo Grove at grove.bamboolearning.com.  After signing up for a Bamboo Learning account, parents need to link that account with the Highlights Storybooks Alexa skill by opening the Alexa App (or going to alexa.amazon.com) and then search for Highlights Storybooks within the skills section of the Alexa App.  After finding Highlights Storybooks in the Alexa App, select “Settings”, and then “Link Account”.  A Bamboo Learning screen will appear.  Sign in to the Bamboo Learning account and Highlights Storybook will be linked.  Then visit Bamboo Grove at grove.bamboolearning.com to view progress. •About Highlights / Bamboo Highlights is a beloved global media brand dedicated to inspiring children to become Curious, Creative, Caring and Confident individuals. Through print and digital content that encourages thinking, creativity, self-expression and respect, Highlights helps kids build literacy, and other school and life skills, all while having fun. Highlights’ magazines, book clubs, apps, activity packs and more bring kids “Fun with a Purpose,” anytime, anywhere. To learn more and to connect with Highlights, visit Highlights.com. Bamboo Learning is an education-focused software and services company with a mission to become the leader in voice-first education applications and content. Bamboo Learning is focused on developing skills for Alexa that enable children and adults to have fun learning and practicing different subjects while listening, viewing pictures, and using their voice. Learn more at BambooLearning.com. Copyright © 2019 Highlights. All rights reserved. For personal use only. To learn about Highlights™, please visit Highlights.com.

skill_name: Mein Tota hare rang ka - Indian Rhyme
skill_description: Usage: Alexa, start mitthu mitthu "Mein Tota hare rang ka - Indian Rhyme"   is a comfort to ears for kids. It will take you to the world of a parrot and its experiences. A parrot narrates the story of its life in a poem and tells about itself. How it looks like, what does it do, what does he eat, how a parrot repeats to its master thus called as an artist of nature. "Mitthu Mitthu" is the keyword to invoke the Alexa skill and thus the most fascinating word throughout the poem. The Alexa skill is specially designed for kids of age group 4-13 years old. English version (English): Alexa, start mitthu mitthu Hindi version (Hindi-India):   “Alexa, मिट्ठू मिट्ठू शुरू करो” We are continuously adding more and more handpicked stories and rhymes for kids which could bring more value to education among them and entertain them.  For all users in India and the rest parts of the world, the skill responses in Hindi audio.  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Disclaimer ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Mein Tota hare rang ka - Indian Rhyme skill for Amazon Alexa contains audio in the Indian local language ‘Hindi’. I am a dad of two boys who, unfortunately, like to wake up early in the morning! If you are reading this, chances are you are in the same boat. Well I have good news for you, this skill is here to help. Ever since I had my kids use this skill in the morning, my amount of sleep in the morning has gone up significantly, my kids like me more (sort of), and my marriage has never been better. I even got promoted at work, so seems like a no brainer. Here is how to use it. The first time you open the skill, it will ask you to set the time that your kids can wake up. Tell it a time and that's it! Now tell your kids in the morning to first say 'Alexa, can I wake up?', if it's not time yet, Alexa will tell them to wait in their bed a bit longer. Once its past the wake up time, then they can get up, and probably run into your room and make sure you are awake to. For this skill to work, the time zone of the device that you use to setup your wake up time has to be correct. If you are having issues with the wake up time being wrong, go into your Alexa App and update the time zone for your device. Re-set the wake up time by saying 'Alexa, ask Can I Wake Up for settings', re-set your wake up time and you should be good to go! Now get out there and get some sleep!

skill_name: King Minister Thief Police - Popular indoor game
skill_description: The game begins with making 4 chits namely Raja or king (1000 points) , Mantri or minister (800 points) , Chor or thief ( 0 points) and Sipahi or police (500 points). Each chit is randomly picked by alexa against the 4 players.Alexa discloses the raja or king and sipahi or police. The sipahi or police, then has to identify the ‘Chor’ or the thief, from the other 2 remaining players. If the sipahi or police, guesses correctly then the points are retained or else he/she surrenders them to the Chor or thief. Several rounds of this game are played before counting the points. The player with the highest score wins the game. The default winner is the player who reaches 10000 points first. The game helps develop cognitive thinking by requiring deductive reasoning. This entertaining game can be learned quickly and is a tool to make new friends. This game provides a platform for social interaction and enhances communication skills. skill_name: Third Grade Kids Daily Math Practice by AskMyClass
skill_description: Designed to help third graders (students and kids aged between 7 and 9) practice their math everyday.  So easy to use: * 10 multiple-choice math problems that are aligned to common core topics for 3rd grade.  * Problems are delivered from a large random bank and goes beyond simple arithmetic (like addition, subtraction, or multiplication). * Most are spoken problems, so they require listening, thinking, and then selecting one of the choices. You might want keep a paper or pencil handy for writing down the questions. How to answer a question: * At the prompt, say the correct number of the multiple choices given. Your answer will be checked to see if it is right or wrong. With the correct answer given. * Say "repeat" to hear the question again. * Say "more time" instead of answering the question to get additional thinking time. Don’t forget, most parents set a daily reminder “Alexa, remind me to ask third grade at 5pm”. We want to encourage kids to love math and be open to making mistakes and trying again. More info: AskMyClass is used by thousands of educators everyday, and is recommended by teachers to reduce learning loss over the summer. At AskMyClass, we believe in making education more empowering and engaging, using affordable tools that are screen-free, so every child learns better. Voice technology and AI are skills that all kids will be interacting with when they enter the workforce in 10 years, and we’re keen on getting them ready for that future. Visit us at GoAskMyClass.com. If you’re a teacher looking for AskMyClass - Classroom Edition - search the skills store or learn more here: GoAskMyClass.com If you’re a parent or student looking for study assistant then check out AskMyClass - Home Edition - search the skills store or learn more here: GoAskMyClass.com/home If you’ve got content ideas or constructive feedback just email team@goaskmyclass.com. We’d love to hear from you.

skill_name: Open Campfire Sounds! - Night Relax sound
skill_description: Enter the world of your imagination and mind relaxing sleep in minutes. As Alexa to open cricket sound and sleep back. The skill will help you to get sleep very soon. Audio in the skill is especially recorded from the jungle and brought to you directly from the woods. Relaxing nature sounds of crickets chirping, summer night noises. The skill offers a plethora of relaxing and healing nature sounds with no distractions. Enjoy listening to calming sounds of the night as you drift off to sleep. In today’s world, peace and quiet can be something of a rarity. The sound of neighbors laughing late into the night, your partner snoring, music playing from across the hall, a buzzing phone on the bedside table, a television left on— – there are an array of everyday noises that can disturb you and have detrimental effects given the importance of sleep on overall health. However, perfect silence isn’t always necessary or even desirable. Some sounds at night can actually enhance your sleep.  Alexa skill will help: 1. HELPS YOU BUILD A BEDTIME RITUAL Especially if you have trouble falling asleep, but even if you don’t, it’s a good idea to establish a routine before bed (both for children and adults). Make sleep hygiene a habit! 2. KEEPS YOUR BEDROOM QUIET For optimal sleep, you need the optimal sleep environment. Cricket sounds buffers disturbing sounds and creates a quiet cocoon, regardless of your surroundings or sleep situation.   3. SHUTS DOWN YOUR BUSY BRAIN Ever have trouble falling asleep because your To-Do list won’t stop buzzing, or personal worries keep you awake? Cricket sounds can help - it’s even shown to help ease symptoms of anxiety. There’s a reason some people use it to meditate! 4. ONCE YOU'RE ASLEEP, YOU STAY ASLEEP By masking sounds that might interrupt your sleep, Cricket sounds to protect your peaceful slumber. And if you DO wake up, it’s often easier to fall back asleep.  5. YOU'LL SLEEP MORE SOUNDLY You may not realize how many times you wake up each night. But even if you don’t remember it in the morning, those little interruptions affect the quality of your sleep. So give Cricket sounds a try and see if you don’t wake up feeling more refreshed. 6. YOU CAN TAKE Cricket Sounds fro Alexa ANYWHERE While you can’t count on your environment, you CAN manage the noise factor, if you’ve got a sound machine in Alexa. And many are compact and portable, making them easy to throw into a suitcase, diaper bag, or handbag. (This one’s especially helpful when traveling. Hotel room doors slamming and noisy hallways, anywhere?) 1. Frequent Waking Lowers Sleep Satisfaction 2. Stressful Sounds Increase Sleep Struggles 3. Noisy Environments Cause Restlessness 4. How to Manage A Noisy Bedroom Relaxing sounds Nature sounds Water sounds Running water sounds Outdoor sounds Babbling brook sounds Oscillating fan sounds Fireplace sounds Forest sounds Country night sounds Ocean sounds Rain sounds River sounds Thunderstorm sounds White noise For all support queries and questions please write in the review section. We have also released various Alexa skills. Your reviews motivate us to build wonderful skills like this one. If you have not already, please show your support by sharing your suggestions by writing review. We want to hear from you!

Rapid Fire Math will help you sharpen your mind by making you do simple math calculations in your head. At start, you will be asked to rate yourself in a scale of 0 to 10. Based on your rating you will be asked math questions involving a combination of addition, subtraction, multiplication and division of numbers. Voice cricket game is similar to book cricket game but instead of book we are using alexa.Book Cricket is an indoor game. It is popular among students in schools. Kids play this at home when the weather is not conducive for outdoor games. The easiness to play this game makes it more popular among kids. In our skill we are playing between user and alexa,where alexa will bat first and user has to chase the score. The overall match is of 2 over’s that is 12 balls. If the user reached the target in 12 balls (2.0 over’s) than the user is the winner else alexa is the winner How to Play book cricket: 1) Player has to randomly open the book and look for the page number 2) The player should always look for the side of book which has even numbers on it. 3) In the opened page, look for the even number and take note of the last unit in that number. For Example: If the opened page is 154, then the last unit is 4 so the score is 4. So the possible scores are 2, 4, 6, 8. 4)2, 4 and 6 score will be added to the batsman score as such and 8 will be counted as 3 runs, it is decided at the beginning of the game when the decide on the number of bats man. 5) Close the book and open it again. 6) Note the score for that again. 7) The innings will go on until 2.0 over’s is complete 8) At the end whoever has the bigger score is the Winner But for the voice cricket we need not have a book or pen ,Just an alexa with voice cricket game enabled skill How to Voice cricket: 1) Just enable skill and launch it 2) Once you have updated your name alexa will bat for 12 balls (2.0 over’s) and will give the target 3) You just have to hit the ball to score the runs ,rest alexa will take car. 4) You can bat for 2.0 over’s(12 balls) and chase the target Alexa will suggest the required runs from balls remaining

skill_name: Kiddo ABC - Alphabet and Words Learning Skill
skill_description: Kiddo ABC is a fun based alphabet learning and vocabulary building skill for small children. The game teaches the new words to kids in increasing order of complexity i.e. starting with simpler words. Game is adaptive in nature i.e. it remembers the words that kids have already used during the game; using that memory game encourages the kids to learn new words instead of repeating the same old word again and again. Also in learn mode game ensures that kids are taught new words instead of the words that they have already used. Skill will start by using any of the following phrases 'Alexa, start abc' 'Alexa, open abc' 'Alexa, launch abc' Skill will then give option to the user to - Learn All letters by saying 'LEARN' or 'LEARN ALL' - Learn individual letters by saying LEARN followed by any letter, as an example 'LEARN D', 'LEARN T' or 'LEARN A' or any valid combination   - Play with letters and words by saying 'PLAY'.  kids can use these options one after the other, as many times as they want. In LEARN ALL mode Alexa will speak out words for all English alphabets one by one starting from A to Z. When learning specific letter Alexa will speak words for only that Letter. Alexa remembers the words that child has already used in PLAY mode, those words are not repeated in the learn mode again, hence allowing for more learning & vocabulary building for kids.  In Play mode, Alexa will ask word for English alphabets, by prompting 'A For'. Kids are supposed to respond with any of the common English words starting with letter A. If word is found to be incorrect, skill will prompt user for one more try. Also if child repeats the same word more than twice that may not be allowed. If word is found to be correct. Skill will continue and ask for next letter i.e. 'B For' and likewise the game will continue and will end with letter 'Z' once the kid has responded correctly with words for all English alphabets.  Alexa will help on its own in case kid gives incorrect responses twice for the same letter. Also kids can take help any moment by saying 'HELP' to Alexa, then Alexa will help back by speaking words for that letter. Once kid has completed all letters, Alexa will revise all letters where either there were mistakes or where help was given. In Play mode, game has a PAUSE feature, so at any letter kids can simply say 'PAUSE', the game will record the letter where child was and next time if the game is restarted within two hours it will resume from that letter instead of starting from A again.  Likewise in Play mode, if child misses to respond to skill's prompts and game stops. In this case also, game will record the letter where child was and next time if the game is restarted within two hours it will resume from that letter instead of starting from A again.  The word list that skill uses contains only the common words as per primary standard. This list is very rich and is continuously updated. In case more complex words are spoken the skill will recognize them. But when in learn mode the skill will only teach the words from its own list, these words are more suitable for small children. Also game arranges its list in increasing order of complexity, so simpler words are taught first followed by difficult ones. Best of Luck Kid! Good fun and great learning to you!

This game can be played by player by a single user or a group of people one by one. - User can start the game by saying  "Alexa, open rock-paper-scissors" On start alexa asks the user to select an option from rock , paper and scissor. When user submits the answer, Alexa shall also select one item randomly.  As per game rules rock wins over scissors, scissors cuts the paper and paper can cover the rock. If selections of Alexa and the user are same e.g. rock and rock then it will be a tie. Alexa shall tell the results to the user.  - Alexa shall record the score of the game also.  User can ask the score by saying: "What is the score" "Score Please"
