skill_name: Brain Master - Multi Device Brain Facts and Fun
skill_description: Lots of fun for the whole family. Brain Master is a multi device skill, playable on any type of Amazon device. With or without a screen. You can choose from 9 categories of facts, education, and fun such as; * Brain Boost - Fun advice on activities to help boost your brain. * Brain Fun - Advice on activities that will help you enjoy your brain  * Brain Laughs - Brain Jokes * Brain Dimensions - Facts about the 5 main parts of your brain * Brain Loving - A Brain hug a day, keeps the doctor away. Brain loving helps lift you up when your feeling down * Mind Blown - Facts to blow your mind * Brain Nap - Facts about sleeping and your brain * Brain Cooldown - A little help to blow off some steam * Brain Health - Facts about nutritional foods that give you super brain powers ** Featuring a sliding interchanging screen for Alexa Display devices and little hints to help you decide what to do next! Just follow the prompts during the skill, Alexa will be with you the whole time to tell you what you can do and to give you advice on what to do next and how to navigate around, relax, have a go and most of all, have fun! The Information in this skill is for informational and educational purposed only. ** You can say; TO START THE GAME: * "Alexa, open Brain Master" * "Alexa, start Brain Master" * "Alexa, launch Brain Master" ALTERNATIVELY TO START THE CATEGORIES DIRECTLY: * "Alexa, ask Brain Master to start Brain Dimensions" (or any of the Categories) * "Alexa, ask Brain Master to start Main Menu" ***** IF YOU LOVE THIS SKILL. PLEASE BE KIND AND RATE US 5 STARS. THANK YOU.***** Thank you for choosing Brain Master and we really hope you enjoy this skill. If you have any advice or feedback for making this skill better, please contact sargef38@bigpond.com.  You can also check out our other skills such as; * Hypnotize Me * Whale Symphony * Hearts Desire * Take Me Flying * Dream Achiever * Just Chilling * Yoga Me * Majesty Words * Out of this World

The world celebrates as scientists push the boundaries of nature by reviving a date palm tree that has been extinct for thousands of years.  Unfortunately, sometimes when you push nature…nature pushes back! Billie Smith is a typical eleven-year-old girl who loves stories about mummies, ancient Egypt and the mysteries of that region.  At the same time, she’s also still a little afraid of the dark. Her father is a botanist who has been in Israel helping revive seeds found in King Herod’s tomb and trying to grow them again.  Amazingly, he finds success and the Judean Date Palm is now on a world tour like a rock star.  All that means to Billie is that her father is finally coming home. The gift that her father brings her…three ancient seeds that are duds, will change the course of her life forever.  On the other side of the planet, Portrand is angry.  He has been asleep for two thousand years when the familiar scent of pollen awakens him.  This proud dragon, who ruled the skies for hundreds of years, is suddenly thrown into a world where he no longer knows the rules.  He’s scared, hungry and currently on a collision course with Billie’s young family. What happens when you meet a creature from your worst nightmares?  This ‘dragon out of water’ tale is a story of understanding, friendship and eighteen thousand pounds of fantasy. Bedtime will never be the same... Imagine reading a story where your child's reading triggers cool audio effects that bring the whole story to life! This is a completely immersive adventure for young readers! Story Theater is an exciting new system that makes you part of the adventure.  You'll read along, read aloud and eagerly anticipate the next turn of the page. You can try the system for free.  Just say "Alexa, play Dragonpalm." When the narrator says, "It's your turn to read," just say "Next".  You'll instantly become part of an exciting serial adventure tale that will make everyone eager to see what happens next. If you enjoy the experience, you can explore the entire system by purchasing the companion illustrated book here on Amazon or at immersive-publishing.com. All of the Story theater stories from https://immersive-publishing.com are family friendly and designed for kids.  If your child loves to read, this just enhances the experience by adding sound effects, a narrator, interactive reading, music and ambient backgrounds.  But if your child views reading as a chore, this might just be the factor that gets them excited about reading.  The stories are exciting and fun...any kid should love them.  Also...the stories are interesting enough that parents should enjoy them too!   You can try the first few chapters for free and if you like it...you can purchase the whole book and more like them at our web site.   We hope you enjoy the show!  Parents:  Story Theater is designed for kids.  We make it so that your child develops a lifelong love of reading.  The system moves forward using prompts read by your child which trigger narration, sound effects, music, background sounds...even Alexa herself in an age appropriate exciting adventure.  Don't worry...once you start listening, we think you'll enjoy the ride as well.

Try not to blow up the BOMB !!! The game is really simple, you have to count in turn with alexa and say BOOM! instead of multiples of 3. For example: Alexa - 1 Player - 2 Alexa - BOOM! Player - 4 Alexa - 5 Player - BOOM! Alexa - 7 Player - 8 Alexa - BOOM! and so on... It seems easy, but both the little ones and the older ones could find difficulties. Especially when the number to count gets bigger! The functions to be added in the future updates are:  - personal record  - total score  - Ranking  - multiplayer mode Latest updates:  - new design for screen devices (available in this version)  - game score (available in this version) Have fun! PS: 5-star reviews motivate us to create new skills and add functionality to this one. If you liked the game, write a 5-star review!

Some might say storytelling is a lost art.  Before computers, the best stories were told by the voices of our ancestors and shared through the expressions of our family members.  Passed down through generations, we felt connected in a way that's hard to replicate.  Until now.   EverAfter™ is a new platform that enables friends and family to capture and share stories privately.  The cloud-based application streamlines the ability for users to quickly and easily record and share audio or video files.  These special moments can now be replayed on Amazon Echo devices. Imagine a grandparent sharing a special story to a grandchild or an active duty service member reading a bedtime story to their child thousands of miles away.  Or a mother sharing a special recipe in a virtual cooking demonstration to help her son host his first Thanksgiving.  These priceless moments connect families through the innovative use of the EverAfter™ platform.   This service is free for a limited time and offers an annual subscription fee to record unlimited stories and store them securely.  Special offers apply for retired and active duty service members.   EverAfter™ is the first chapter in a new way of connecting and preserving memories so that the art of storytelling can be shared for future generations.  Visit www.everafter.cloud to learn more.

130+ Riddles for everyone:  ★50 HARD RIDDLES★ & ★50 EASY RIDDLES★ & ★30 NORMAL RIDDLES★ Ask for a new cool riddle and try to guess what's the answer: Phrases you can use to ask for a new riddle: ♦ Alexa ask riddle games a new riddle ♦ Alexa ask riddle games give me a riddle ♦ Alexa ask riddle games to tell me a new riddle Then try to guess the answer saying something like: ♦ Alexa ask riddle games is the answer to riddle fourteen orange? ♦ Alexa ask riddle games answer to riddle number five is blue ♦ Alexa ask riddle games the answer to riddle number two is red You will get a "YES!" or "...nope..." or "Heh, kinda, try again" based on how much you were close to the correct answer. If you are stuck, just ask: ♦ Alexa ask riddle games What's the answer to riddle ten? ♦ Alexa ask riddle games The answer to riddle number four ♦ Alexa ask riddle games What's the answer to number one? You'll get the correct answer, maybe you'll feel like a cheater.. i can't help with that but you can always ask for another riddle. If you think too much about a riddle you might forget what it was, or since this app will give you a random riddle, it might happen that you hear all the riddles except for one or two 'cause you're not lucky with randomness. Don't worry, just ask for a specific riddle: ♦ Alexa ask riddle games to repeat riddle twelve ♦ Alexa ask riddle games say again number three ♦ Alexa ask riddle games repeat riddle nine ■ This skill offers premium content, in the form of onetime purchases ■ You can purchase 2 in-skill products to extend the gameplay: ♦ 50 Hard riddles for the brightest minds ♦ 50 Easy riddles for the youngest minds Enjoy :D

Ever wanted to learn every country in the world? Stamp My Passport makes it easy. The skill features a simple learning platform; just choose one continent to learn at a time.  Along your journey, you'll also pick up on the capitals and languages spoken in each country. Once you guess a country right without any help, you get that country stamped onto your passport. When you return to the skill, you may choose a continent and say "review". You'll be able to review only the countries you've stamped from that continent. Other features include: - Ask to show the location of a country. "Show me Libya" - Create unique passports for each user in the household. "Create a passport" - Delete passports. "Delete a passport"  - Pick a continent. "North America" - Pick a mode. "Learn" to learn, "Review" to review stamped countries - Pick both a mode and a continent. "Learn/Review North America" - Ask for help on the game rules. "Help" - Personalized Amazon Polly voices for each continent The skill is multimodal, as it shows images of the countries. It should work fine on the Echo Show and Spot, and Fire TV. To use the skill on a voice-only device such as an Echo or Echo Dot, please click on the 'Activity' tab of the Home page on the Alexa app, or go to alexa.amazon.com. Then you will be able to view questions and maps of countries.

"Teach me Tables" helps kids learn and memorize math tables in a new, interactive, visually appealing and fun way.  It starts out by asking which table kids like to learn. It then displays and recites the first five items from that table. It will ask the user to memorize them and once they are ready, it tests their memory with a short quiz. It congratulates kids using funny voices when they get it right, and when they get it wrong, it makes funny sounds and tells them the correct answer. For every correct answer, it assigns 10 points and the score is tracked through out the session to keep kids engaged. Once the first half of the table is completed, it then goes on to teach  the rest of the table using similar techniques.  This skill is developed based on a real life, proven teaching techniques used to teach kids master their math times tables.

Rapid Math is a multi-modal skill helps users practice addition, subtraction and multiplication math problems. Users earn points by answering questions correctly on the first try. Rapid Math keeps track of high scores, allows users to review incorrect answers and provides a summary of the user's performance. Rapid Math offers multiple skill levels that will challenge users of all ages.  For users with a screen, Rapid Math displays each math problem along with the current score, the user's high score and the medals the user has earned. For users without a screen, Alexa provides options for navigating the skill throughout play.  To launch the skill, say, "Alexa, open Rapid Math."  Once Rapid Math has been launched, say, "Alexa, play a game." The skill will prompt the user for the desired difficultly level, easy, medium, hard or expert. The skill also allows users to directly launch into a game by saying, "Alexa, ask Rapid Math to start an easy game."  Rapid Math keeps track of any math problems the user answered incorrectly. At any time the user can review these problems by saying, "Alexa, review the problems I missed." Users can also review a summary of their performance including the number of problems attempted, problems answered correctly and percentage of correct problems in each problem category, addition, multiplication and subtraction. To review a summary of game performance, say, "Alexa, show the score."

Aloo Kachalu is a masterpiece in the family of Indian rhymes. You will learn all the vegetable names in Hindi audio. The best time to play is with dinner or lunch. Or all day! Steps for using the skill: Session 1: User: Alexa, open aloo kachalu Alexa: Starting aloo kachalu, you can say start or begin User: Start / Begin Alexa: Playing aloo kachalu User: Alexa, next User: Alexa, stop User: Alexa, shuffle User: Alexa, next / previous User: Alexa, resume User: Alexa, start over User: Yes/No Session 2: User: Alexa, open aloo kachalu Alexa: You were listening to aloo kachalu already, Would you like to resume? User: No Alexa: <Alexa starts over to play the audio from start> You are listening to the aloo kachalu rhymes. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Session 3: User: Help Alexa: You are listening to the aloo kachalu. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Once invoked, Alexa will automatically start the conversation and play the audio. Sit back, relax, and enjoy the rhyme of Twinkle Twinkle Star. To start again on finishing one story, you can ask Alexa to open it again. When you reach the bottom of the playlist, try saying, Alexa, start over or Alexa, shuffle

As a parent myself, I understand that nothing is more important than the well being of your children.  Everyday, kids are bombarded with messages that are detrimental to their happiness, confidence and self esteem. I built this simple skill for my son to ensure that he starts every day feeling confident, happy, calm and ready to have the best day he can. Try it for a while with your kids too and watch as their confidence, self esteem and happiness grows. This skill itself is very simple. The idea behind it is very powerful. Kids repeat 6 randomly chosen, positive affirmations about themselves. It takes about one minute to complete. Positive affirmations have an extraordinary effect on children - They help to inspire, motivate, and build confidence and self-esteem. When kids use positive affirmations from an early age they'll reap a lifetime of benefits. A really great way to start or end their day! This skill never collects any personal data. If you have suggestions to improve the skill, please let me know in the comments. Thanks and have a great day!

This is an app to help test and improve our math and letter skills, it is intended to provide random questions  related to math like addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. It also asks questions in english vocabulary like what comes before after a letter and what letter does a word start with. Math is divided into two section, prek section which is asking questions for number( less than 6) and vocabulary,  other set of users which will get little harder questions To answer the questions use terms like: * answer is <answer> * its <answer> since some questions require more time, recommend using word like "repeat", "sorry", so that Alexa is busy repeating question and you get more time to answer.

Numbers Trivia uses the famous "numbersapi" API for getting facts related to numbers and dates and presents it to Alexa users in an elegant fashion. It is a multimodal skill and has both voice and visual aspect through which user can interact with their Alexa device using this skill. This is a great skill that helps the young bright minds to learn numbers and stories about dates in a beautiful and interactive manner. Just give the skill a test run and you will fall in love with it. Numbersapi is an elegant API designed to bring meaning to your metrics and stories to your dates. This skill uses this free API to provide the users those great interesting facts about the numbers they use in their daily life. Here are some of the commands to help you get started: 1) "Alexa, open Numbers Trivia" "Welcome to the Numbers Trivia skill! I can give you many interesting facts about the numbers, their significance in the world of mathematics. I can also tell all the great historical facts any date is known for." 2) "Help!" "You can ask me questions like, 'Give me a fact about number 42'; 'What is significance of 42 in mathematics?'; 'What is special about 5th September?'" 3) "What is special about 5th September?" "September 5th is the day in 1927 that the first Oswald the Lucky Rabbit cartoon, Trolley Troubles, produced by Walt Disney, is released by Universal Pictures." 4) "Give me a fact about number 42" "42 is the answer to the Ultimate Question of Life, the Universe, and Everything." 5) "Tell me a fact about any random number" "145 is the atomic number of Unquadpentium." 6) "What is the significance of 100 in mathematics?" "100 is the smallest number whose common logarithm is a prime number." 7) "Tell me the importance of today" "January 1st is the day in 1860 that First Polish stamp is issued."

Use your Echo buttons or your voice to play a fun winter game throwing snowballs.  Play in "Solo Mode" with a single player, or if you have buttons go "Head to Head" with two player mode. Listen carefully to each scenario, and see if you should throw a snowball. For example, if someone else is playing outside, you can throw at them, but don't go after the mailman or your mother with hot chocolate!  Act quickly as you don't have much time and other players are throwing at you, so be quick with your selection. If you have buttons, try the "Head to head" mode. The first player to hit the target scores a point, and Alexa tracks the score.  Don't be too quick with your buttons, else you might end up getting knocked out of the game.

Players get the same math question at the same time. If you get the right answer quicker than others then you will get more points. The more players you beat, the more points you get. ----- Echo Buttons ---- You can play as a team with Echo Buttons. If each team member has a button, they can use them to determine who gets to answer the question and avoid cluttering the voice input each round. Remember to wake up the buttons by pressing them once the skill starts. --------------------- The best time to play in is around 7pm US eastern time since players from both the West and East coast of the USA are active. It is not much fun playing by yourself, so tell your friends about this to ensure there are more players and points up for grabs. Playing on your lonesome will only get you one point per successful round. Your seven day total score is what determines your standing on the global leaderboard. So you don't need to win every round to be on top. Just play consistently well to stay on top. The maths questions are moderate difficulty (e.g 4 x 22 or 144 / 2 ) so best suited for children between 7 to 13 years. Younger kids can join in by practising with a calculator. If you have multiple devices around the house connected to the same Amazon account then the highest score will be taken for each round, so playing as a team can be beneficial. This is one of the first realtime games on this platform so please provide feedback and suggestions to steven.bowden@protonmail.com Privacy information Only anonymous player scores are stored in the skill. No personal information is collected by this skill.

skill_name: London Bridge is falling down Indian Rhyme
skill_description: "London Bridge Is Falling Down" (also known as "My Fair Lady" or "London Bridge") is a traditional English nursery rhyme and singing game, which is found in different versions all over the world. It deals with the depredations of London Bridge and attempts, realistic or fanciful, to repair it. It may date back to bridge rhymes and games of the Late Middle Ages, but the earliest records of the rhyme in English are from the seventeenth century. The lyrics were first printed in close to their modern form in the mid-eighteenth century and became popular, particularly in Britain and the United States during the 19th century. We have updated the skill with a more smooth and fault-free experience. We are continuing the legacy of the previous skill with a more advanced and smooth voice experience. london bridge Indian Rhyme will take you on an adventurous ride to the famous London Bridge right from your home. Whether it is time to sleep or dinner, play this rhyme for kids and your kid will love it. Steps for using the skill: Session 1: User: Alexa, open london bridge Alexa: Starting london bridge, you can say start or begin User: Start / Begin Alexa: Playing london bridge User: Alexa, next User: Alexa, stop User: Alexa, shuffle User: Alexa, next / previous User: Alexa, resume User: Alexa, start over User: Yes/No Session 2: User: Alexa, open london bridge Alexa: You were listening to london bridge already, Would you like to resume? User: No Alexa: <Alexa starts over to play the audio from start> You are listening to the london bridge rhyme. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Session 3: User: Help Alexa: You are listening to the london bridge. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Once invoked, Alexa will automatically start the conversation and play the audio. Sit back, relax, and enjoy the rhyme of london bridge. To start again on finishing one story, you can ask Alexa to open it again. When you reach the bottom of the playlist, try saying, Alexa, start over or Alexa, shuffle

Your Uncle's master swords have been stolen. Your mission is to retrieve them by searching the four kingdoms. You'll do battle against grubby gramlins, hideous orcs, wicked-tongued witches, brain-hungry zombies and a horde of other fantastical creatures.  Words are your weapons! Defeat each enemy you encounter by spelling words correctly. Pick up special magical items for your backpack to aid you on your quest. Expand your vocabulary and flaunt your spelling prowess in three difficulty levels: Easy, tricky and masterful.  - Easy words are the easiest to spell. For young adventurers who are just learning starting out. - Tricky words are just a little bit harder. - Masterful words for older children, expert spellers and adults.  MasterSwords helps children and adults improve their spelling in a fun and exciting way. Explore a rich and fantastical universe with hidden surprises lurking around every corner.  HELPFUL HINTS: - If you need help at any point in the skill just say "help"! - Wondering how you're doing? say "status update" or "how am I doing?" - To use magic items you've collected during a battle say "backpack!" - To reset the skill say "reset." - Change your difficulty level by saying "change difficulty." - Keep an eye out for updates as we add new enemies, new scenes and more master swords!

A fun multiplication game for kids ideally aged between six and twelve - but anyone is welcome to try and beat Alexa! In Simple Mode, see how many points can you get answering multiplication questions which progressively get harder - up to 20x table Example:  Alex will ask "Six times five"  You need to give the answer "Thirty" or "The answer is Thirty" Or Battle Mode. Can your multiplication beat Alexa's answer? Can you ensure you don't use the same multiplication twice? Example:  Alexa will ask "Six times five equals Thirty"  You need to give a multiplication where the answer is higher than Thirty  "Six times Six equals Thirty-Six"  - But don't use the same answer twice as Alexa will know and will give you three chances to try again!

skill_description: This Alexa skill plays Billi Mausi rhyme which is an Indian Hindi rhyme. You can say, Alexa, open billi mausi to start the audio. You can say Stop to stop the music. You can say resume/pause/stop to control the audio We have updated the skill with a more smooth and fault-free experience. We are continuing the legacy of the previous skill with a more advanced and smooth voice experience. billi mausi Indian Rhyme will take you on an adventurous ride to the world of cat. Whether it is time to breakfast or dinner, play this rhyme for kids and your kid will love it. Steps for using the skill: Session 1: User: Alexa, open billi mausi Alexa: Starting billi mausi, you can say start or begin User: Start / Begin Alexa: Playing billi mausi User: Alexa, next User: Alexa, stop User: Alexa, shuffle User: Alexa, next / previous User: Alexa, resume User: Alexa, start over User: Yes/No Session 2: User: Alexa, open billi mausi Alexa: You were listening to billi mausi already, Would you like to resume? User: No Alexa: <Alexa starts over to play the audio from start> You are listening to the billi mausi rhyme. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Session 3: User: Help Alexa: You are listening to the billi mausi. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Once invoked, Alexa will automatically start the conversation and play the audio. Sit back, relax, and enjoy the rhyme of billi mausi. To start again on finishing one story, you can ask Alexa to open it again. When you reach the bottom of the playlist, try saying, Alexa, start over or Alexa, shuffle Once invoked, Alexa will automatically start the conversation and play the poem. The skills by saying "Alexa, open billi mausi". After invoking Alexa automatically starts the rhyming poem. Once it is finished you can invoke again by saying "Alexa, open billi mausi". The Alexa skill is specially designed for kids of age group 4-13 years old. For all users in India and the rest parts of the world, the skill responses in Hindi audio.  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Disclaimer ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Billi mausi kaho kaha se aai ho Indian Kids Rhyme skill for Amazon Alexa contains audio in the Indian local language ‘Hindi’. How to take a shot? You have five directions in which you can kick the ball when Alexa asks you to shoot. These are top right, top left, bottom right, bottom left and straight. Each time you take a shot, Alexa will randomly choose a direction in which the keeper will dive. If the two choices match, its a save but if they don't then you have scored a goal. Modes: There are two modes in which you can play the game, single player and multi player.  1. Single Player mode You will have endless amount of chances to try and score. In case your shot is saved by the keeper, you will get 3 additional chances to retry.  2. Multi Player mode This mode is for playing the game with friends and family locally. You will have the option to select the number of players which are playing the game. Once you select the number of players, Alexa will ask each player to take a shot in a round robin fashion. There will be five rounds in total and at the end of the last round you will get the final scorecard. Additional: At any point in the game, you can ask about the rules or your highscore.

Play the Outlier Game with Alexa, and see how good you are at identifying the patterns and find the "outlier" in a set of similar items.  Compete with your friends for added fun!   - Xylophone, guitar, brother, violin.   - Which word doesn't belong?   - Brother, because it's a relative, while the rest are musical instruments.  Easy, right?  Try this one.   - Spain, Japan, Argentina, Bolivia  - Which word doesn't belong?   - Japan, because all other countries in the list are Spanish-speaking   And things only get trickier from there!   Start with the "rhymes" or "mixer" pack until you get the hang of things.  Then move on to more challenging packs, like "places" and "animals," and show Alexa what you're really made of!  The game can be played by both adults and children. Just say "Alexa, start the Outlier Game". Good luck! We appreciate your feedback. Please send us a note at feedback@azalealabs.com if you have any suggestions how we can improve the game.

Here's how it works You (Dealer) will have your guest (Player) select a card at random. Based on the card that Player selects, you will give me a specific command and I will "guess" the card. Full cheat sheet is below but for example, if Player selected the Ace of Clubs, you would say, "WHAT card was CHOSEN?" If Player selected the Ace of Spades, you'd say, "WHAT card was SELECTED?" Alternatively,  if Player selected the Two of Clubs, you'd say, "WHICH card was CHOSEN." Printable Key: Full key here: https://s3.amazonaws.com/kidscardtrick/Card+Trick+-+Kids+Edition+Table.pdf Hints (to remember key): The 1st letter of the suit matches the first letter of the verb (except Hearts): Spades = Selected; Clubs = Chosen; Diamonds = Drawn; Hearts = picked [it may be helpful to remember [hand] “picked” Odd numbers = “What” Even numbers = “Which” # cards = alphabetical order (e.g., Guess < Predict < Reveal < Tell us) Face cards = Starts with "So" KEY ------------------------------------ Spades - ...card was selected Clubs - ...card was chosen Diamonds - ...Card was drawn Hearts - ...card was [hand] picked - DO NOT SAY THE WORD HAND; IT’S TO HELP YOU REMEMBER HEARTS 1/A. What... 2. Which... 3. Guess what... 4. Guess which... 5. Predict what... 6. Predict which... 7. Reveal what... 8. Reveal which... 9. Tell us what... 10. Tell us which... J. So what... Q. So which... K. So guess what… Jokers. So guess which... FULL KEY A of Spades: What card was selected A of Clubs: What card was chosen A of Diamonds: What card was drawn A of Hearts: What card was picked 2 of Spades: Which card was selected 2 of Clubs: was selected 7 of Clubs: Reveal what card was chosen 7 of Diamonds: Reveal what card was drawn 7 of Hearts: Reveal what card was picked 8 of Spades: Reveal which card was selected 8 of Clubs: Reveal which card was chosen 8 of Diamonds: Reveal which card was drawn 8 of Hearts: Reveal which card was picked 9 of Spades: Tell us what card was selected 9 of Clubs: Tell us what card was chosen 9 of For kids, counting is the first step of their mathematical journey. It usually starts with reciting the number sequence (one, two, three, etc.). Then the boundaries are getting extended (counting to ten, twenty). Soon, the kids start changing the counting direction (counting backwards), or skipping numbers using a specific interval. "Let's Count" is an Alexa skill that will help children (and adults) practice their counting. The user is supposed to define the upper and lower bound for the counting (these bounds are inclusive), the counting direction (forward or backwards) and the counting step (counting interval). The skill will do the rest. In case of invalid parameters, the skill will notify the user that the counting is not possible. Enjoy counting with "Let's Count" Alexa skill.

What Time is it Mr. Fox is a simple children's game. One player, the "fox", stands on one side of the room while everyone else stands on the opposite side of the room. The Fox stats with his back turned. The game starts by all the other players ask together "What time is it Mr. Fox?".          When the players ask "What time is it Mr. Fox?", the Fox replies with a time of the day of his/her choosing. If the Fox says 4 O'Clock everyone takes 4 steps forward. The Fox keeps his back turned. The game end when the Fox replies "Lunch Time!" and turns around and chases the players. The player the Fox eats(tags) will be the next fox.

Welcome to Guess the Letter! I will pick a letter of the alphabet and you guess what it is. If you are wrong, I will tell you whether the letter I am thinking of is later or earlier in the alphabet.  For example, I might think of the letter 'L', and would start by asking you to make a guess. You could start by saying "A". Because 'L' is later than 'A', I would tell you that the letter I'm thinking of is later in the alphabet. You then might say "Is it E?". Because 'L' is also later in the alphabet than the letter 'E', I would again tell you that the letter I'm thinking of is later in the alphabet. Next, you might say "How about X?" This time, you picked a letter later in the alphabet than 'L', so I would tell you that the letter I'm thinking of is earlier in the alphabet than 'X'. You might then guess "L", and I would tell you that you guessed my letter and won the game!

This skill is a super simple Christmas list builder with a bit of Christmas charm built in. It works like this: ADDING ITEMS TO THE CHRISTMAS LIST  - "Alexa, tell Santa Claus I want [insert item here]     e.g  - "Alexa, tell Santa Claus I want a bike"  OR   - "Alexa, tell Santa Claus I want [insert item here] for Christmas e.g.   - "Alexa, tell Santa Claus I want some toys for Christmas" Then Alexa will confirm the item and once confirmed she'll get Santa's elves to add it to the Christmas list. READ OUT THE CHRISTMAS LIST  - "Alexa, ask Santa Claus what is on my Christmas list' Alexa will get one of Santa's elves to read out the list. REMOVE AN ITEM FROM THE CHRISTMAS LIST  - "Alexa, ask Santa Claus to remove the [insert item here] from my Christmas list" e.g.   - "Alexa, tell Santa Claus to remove the bike from my Christmas list" The items will be instantly removed. OR If the item can not be found in the list then Santa's elves will go through the list one-by-one to find the right item for removal. T To start going through the list one by one you can also say: - "Alexa, ask Santa Claus to remove an item from my Christmas list"   RESETTING THE LIST Simply disable and re-enable the skill. Privacy information Santa Claus - Christmas list securely stores Christmas list items for access by customers at a later date. The information is not presented to anyone except for the anonymous customer ID connected to the list. Usage data is collected by the skill to ensure optimum functionality.

Enhance your knowledge about space with the help of this skill

Stars have a life cycle. As they age, they grow larger and eventually collapse under their own gravity. When massive stars collapse, they do so in a fiery explosion making them a supernova. As the mass that was held by them disperses, what remains is a small ball of mass. It is of the size of a city, but is extremely dense. In fact, neutron stars are one of the most dense objects. The gravitational pressure makes protons and electrons to become neutrons and make up for most of its density. A star rotates about its axis. When it goes supernova, it does lose a lot of its mass. However, in order to maintain angular momentum, it has to spin faster now [1]. Much faster. And when it does, it emits a blast of radiation along its magnetic field lines. When observed from earth, we see a pulsating beam of light. This is what gives birth to a pulsar.

"What’s it Like" is an educational experience designed to help children build empathy by helping them see and appreciate differences. In the game, families can explore differences related to: language, appearance, vision, hearing, focus, etc. and give them an opportunity to reflect by teaching a robot “What’s it Like” to be different. As fyi, robots don’t have feelings and kids learn by teaching! :) Each vignette was inspired by a real child so this may be especially for adults to help kids learn how to relate to children with differences in a practical, engaging way. To skip to a different experience, just say, “skip.” About SayKid For more screen-less, play-based learning, search "SayKid" on the Alexa Skill Store. By combining voice technology and real-world, tangible play, we help educators and families learn together in a safe, natural, and engaging way - without screens! If you found the skill helpful, we greatly appreciate reviews! Awards - SayKid wins Grand Prize in the 2020 Alexa EdTech Competition  - Harvard names SayKid a Finalist in the Saul Zaentz Early Education Competition - SayKid wins MN Cup "Moonshot" Prize at US Bank Stadium

The game is bees flowers bears.  Sometimes the bee wins, sometimes the flower wins, and sometimes the bear wins!  It is similar to rock, scissors, paper, but with some educational trivia and geared for kids!   _______________ This is how you play the game: First, I will ask you if you are a bee, a flower or a bear.   After you answer, I will take my turn and RANDOMLY answer bee, flower or bear.  The winner is determined and the current score is announced.  Then, I will tell you an educational fact about bees, flowers or bears.  Afterwards I will ask if you would like to play another round. _______________ Here is how the winner is determined: Bees collect nectar from flowers, and when this happens, the bee wins.   Bears provide fertilizer for the flowers, and when this occurs, the flower wins.  Bears collect honey from the bees, and when this occurs, the bear wins. _______________ You can play as many times as you like, and I love this game so much I never get tired! _______________ Update January 6, 2020: The emotional quality of Alexa's voice has been enhanced to express a sense of excitement and disappointment depending on game outcome. Update, December 31, 2018: A scoring system which tracks the winner of each round has been added. _______________  Your review will help us continue to improve this skill.  You may also contact us at support@voices.app if you need assistance, or for your suggestions and comments. Thank you. Credits: Development: https://voices.app Linguistics Consultant: LaLa Speights Icon Image: Pexels

Ever wanted to get your hands dirty and make some slime or play around with static electricity? Busy Hands has 6 fun science projects to keep you and your kids entertained. Pick a project and Alexa will provide a hands free voice experience so you can concentrate on the experiment. If you have a display then you can watch the experiment as you go along.  Experiments: - Roll A Can With Static Electricity (Easy) - Balance A Cork (Easy) - Pierce a Balloon with a Kebab Stick (Easy) *NEW* - Non Spill Water (Medium) - Make Slime (Medium) - Potato Battery (Hard) If it is a rainy day and you want to try a project with equipment you might have lying around the house then try: 'Non Spill Water', 'Balance a Cork' or 'Roll a Can with Static Electricity'  If you can't remember the projects then ask Alexa to read them out "Alexa, ask Busy Hands what projects are available?". To start an experiment say "Alexa, ask Busy Hands to start the make slime project." or if you just want to know what equipment you need then say "Alexa, ask Busy Hands what equipment do I need to roll a can with static electricity"  If you haven't got time for a project but still want to learn then ask for a fact. "Alexa, ask Busy Hands for a fact" or "Alexa, ask Busy Hands to give me a fact about non spill water" More fun science projects will be added shortly, watch this space!

Practice and perfect your grasp of basic math operations with Alexa!  Whether you're learning to add for the first time or just want to keep sharp, this skill has it all and is suitable for people of all ages! This skill covers the following four operations: addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.  If you haven't yet grasped these operations yet, use this skill's practice mode to take time and gain mastery!  Feeling confident about your mastery?  Then use this skill's play mode to answer as many questions as you can in 60 seconds!  The more you get right, the harder they become!  And: you get bonus points for speed! How many multiplication and division questions can you get right in a row? 10, 20, 100? Try to beat your personal best across multiple sessions with this engaging skill. You can choose between three activities: reciting, test and streak challenge.  Reciting is a way to quickly memorize an individual times table by listening and chanting along with Alexa who recites the multiples, for example, "4, 8, 12, 16", etc. Then, when you're feeling confident to take a test, Alexa will give you a series of random questions for a given times table and check your responses, for example, "what is 6 times 4?", "16 divided by 4?", etc. During the test, Alexa notes the incorrect answers and repeats those questions, until you get all correct. Kind of like flash cards, just spoken.  In this skill, times tables can go up to 16 by 16 which is the top, "hard" level. You begin at the "easy" level with tables of up to 8 by 8, while the middle level is called "moderate" with tables of up to 12 by 12. You can change the difficulty level at any time by saying, for example, "set level to moderate". If you're feeling pretty confident at a certain level, you can try the streak challenge. Unlike with a normal test, in a streak, Alexa asks questions across all times tables of your current level. The streak breaks with the first incorrect answer. Each correct answer brings points based on the difficulty of the question and as you progress Alexa keeps a total score. Alexa also tracks your personal best across multiple sessions and will congratulate you every time you beat it. If you need to leave in a hurry, just say "pause" and your streak will automatically resume next time you open the skill. Questions in tests and streaks also include real-life problems, such as: "Grandma is baking scones for the family of 5. How many does she need to bake if they all eat 4 scones each?" Most questions come with hints which are offered automatically if you wait for too long with an answer, or you can just say "help". For example, on a question "what is 9 times 6" the hint would be: "if you know what 10 times 6 is, just subtract 6 from that". All tests and streaks include division questions, which come up randomly in about a third of all questions.

skill_name: Guess the name : Animal Sounds Quiz
skill_description: Hey there, are you looking for a game which is fun to play and also educates you in learning new things in the process. Well, you have come to the right place. Our skill aims to help people recognize and differentiate between the sounds of different animals from the animal kingdom using a fun quiz.   How to play: 1. You will be asked a question followed by an animal sound. Each question will have multiple choice answers.  2. Guess the animal by listening to the sound. To give your answer, either repeat the number(one, two, three etc.) of the option or repeat the option value (tiger, lion, horse etc.)  3. After each set of questions, you will be given a score and the game will end. 4. You can play again, to get a new set of sounds. NOTE: At any point in the game, say, START OVER, to restart the game or REPEAT, to repeat the question.

Start with "Alexa, open Animal Sounds Quiz". Listen to the questions being asked and answer the animal's name. There are 10 questions, and there are 3 hints per question. If you want to hear the calling voice again, say "again". If you want to end it, say "end". If you want to start over, say "Start again". We hope you enjoy it with your children.

skill_name: Train Your Brain : Number Chain Game
skill_description: The Number Chain Game is a part of memory training skills that allows you to train your ability to remember sequences of digits. The game will start with a single digit and Alexa will keep on adding a new digit till you can remember the sequence of digits. This is a fun way to pass time and sharpen your memory in the process. Try to set a high score and challenge your friends to a memory battle. How to play: 1. The game will begin by Alexa giving you a number to memorize. 2. Speak back the number to Alexa, if correct it will give you the second number. 3. Now repeat both the numbers in the sequence given by Alexa. 4. Alexa, will then give you another number and the game will go on till you repeat the right sequence. 5. At any point in the game, say start over to start the game again, say high score to know your high score and help to know the rules again while playing. CHANCES: You will get 3 chances to retry when you give a wrong answer.

skill_name: Guess the name : Domestic Animal Sounds Quiz
skill_description: Hey there, are you looking for a game which is fun to play and also educates you in learning new things in the process. Well, you have come to the right place. Our skill aims to help people recognize and differentiate between the sounds of different animals from the animal kingdom using a fun quiz.   How to play: 1. You will be asked a question followed by an animal sound. Each question will have multiple choice answers.  2. Guess the animal by listening to the sound. To give your answer, either repeat the number(one, two, three etc.) of the option or repeat the option value (cow, pig, horse etc.)  3. After each set of questions, you will be given a score and the game will end. 4. You can play again, to get a new set of sounds. NOTE: At any point in the game, say, START OVER, to restart the game or REPEAT, to repeat the question.

Classical word chain game with Animals. Compete against Alexa chaining animal names without repeating any. You only need to say an animals name whose first letter match with the last letter of the previous animal name.  It's perfect as an entertainment for kids and adults. Also cool to use in educational environments. This game is really easy to use. You just need to tell alexa to start the game by saying for example: "Alexa, run Animal Chain" or "Alexa, start Animal Chain".  Then Alexa will start. First it will ask you if you know the rules, if you do, you will go straight to the game. If you don't, Alexa will explain the rules with an example.  Alexa always starts saying the animal, so you can take your time to search for another animal that match it's first letter with the last letter of the animal Alexa said, there is no time limit. If you didn't hear Alexa's animal name, or you forgot, you can ask Alexa to repeat it by saying: "can you repeat?" or " say again". If you don't know any animals, just say "I don't know more" or "I surrender". To exit the game just say: "Stop" or "Cancel".

skill_name: Math Masterclass AI Tutor from Eureka Eleven Plus
skill_description: Is your child studying math at school? Or are you looking to brush up on your own math? Eureka Eleven Plus, which publishes exam preparation materials, offers this AI-powered Math Masterclass tutorial game as a free service to our readers. AT HOME or IN CAR At home, on any Amazon Echo speaker or display. Driving with a child? Use any Android or iPhone. (1) Download the Alexa app. (2) Press the big blue button. When blue light appears, say "Open Math Tutor". (3) Works best when direct to phone rather than through in-car bluetooth. COMMANDS TO TRY WAIT (Amazon forces session to close unless you keep asking for more time) REPEAT HINT  NEW (fresh question) SCORE (gives your progress report) AIM Get the answers right first time, without needing hints on the method, and to achieve this quickly. The AI will report back your progress score when you ask for it.
It will help you in revising all the important formulas which are usually appear in important examination, it will keep on updating with new formula .

High Five Maths by Learning Mole and ProfileTree is a fun and interactive maths quiz suitable for ages 5-10. This Alexa Skill is perfect resource to challenge children and it also provides support to develop their mental maths skills. It’s very simple to use: · Wake up the App · Choose a level · Begin your quiz – 5 questions will be provided · Say’ Repeat’ if you would like to hear a question again or need more time to answer · Tell Alexa your answers – you will have 8 seconds to answer each question · Can you answer all 5 questions correctly? High Five Maths is an easy, fun way to practise mental maths with children. It can be used in the classroom, for home-schooling, at home or independently by the children themselves. The skill gives immediate feedback, gives children time to answer questions and allows the questions to be repeated. It is perfect for building number fluency and speed in mental calculations. The levels have been designed to suit differing age ranges and abilities as well as being closely related to curriculum concepts. The levels are matched with age but feel free to explore the range to find which one suits best. · Level 1 – Age 5-6 · Level 2 – Age 6-7 · Level 3 – Age 7-8 · Level 4 – Age 8-9 · Level 5 – Age 9-10 High Five Maths is a great resource for developing listening skills and understanding, a great way to start the day or give children a challenge throughout the day. It can also be used as part of an end of week quiz, giving an insight into the concepts that children are understanding or that they may still require some support with. The app has been developed by Michelle Connolly - a teacher with over 16 years teaching experience both internationally and throughout the UK and Ireland. Michelle also runs Learning Mole, an educational platform which specialises in supporting parents, guardians, teachers and everyone involved in the childcare sector to enhance children’s learning and development. You don't need any special hardware for this Skill and can even use it on your phone. It's an easy and free addition to your children's learning kit. Just activate "Kids Skills" on your phone, enable the skill and you are ready to go. Enjoy learning and have fun.

World of Equestria is both a skill of facts about My Little Pony - Friendship is Magic, and a fun trivia game to play on your own or with friends. This kids skill is not affiliated, licensed, or endorsed by Hasbro.  It's a family friendly, fan created unofficial guide to Equestria and a trivia game, built for fans of the show of all ages.  You can listen to some random facts about the show, or you can play a trivia game about it.  Do you know all there is to know about Equestria? Play the game every day to see if you can answer the random sets of questions correctly. Designed with 2 main parts and 1 surprise:   *Equestria fact: Alexa randomly chooses a fact to tell.  You can listen to just one, or as many as you like. *Equestria trivia game: A series of 3 random questions.  The goal, get all 3 correct.  If you get some wrong, there's a bonus question if you want it.  You should be able to play every day and always get a different combination of questions. *The hidden surprise:  This is my favorite part.  Within each step, Alexa will ask if you want to continue.  If you answer with something she won't recognize (you can say anything to trigger this hidden part, so go nuts,) Alexa will say randomly crazy Equestria related pony things in response, then she repeats her original question. To start the skill, you can say: "Alexa, open World of Equestria" "Alexa, start World of Equestria" "Alexa, launch World of Equestria" Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill.  Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep improving upon this skill and making even more great skills, thanks!

Let your kids play smart dice game and become the smartest player in World. You can be the coolest player and have your name shine on the Leader board. Keep playing, keep winning, improve your knowledge by answering simple questions, and hold your place tight on the leader board. Questions mainly consists of general knowledge and math.  Your kids can play smart dice with you, their friends or even when they are all by themselves. They will get rewarded for their knowledge which will keep them motivated.  Scores will be stored and compared with other players across your country for a place on the Leader board. Newer questions will be added every day, so keep playing and keep getting back for updates. Happy Lucky trip!! Rules *************************************************** User will have to score 100 points for winning the game. Can play in Single Player or Multiplayer mode. If the user has scored 99 Points, he/she should get another 1 point to win. In multiplayer mode, the one who scores 100 point first will be winner. If the User scores 99 points, then he/she should get 1 point to win. If user gets a 6 when he is at 99, the additional points won't add, and there will be negative marks for wrong answers. In short, the users will have to get an exact 100 to win the game. Any number of Players can be added to the game.  Single Player can play any number of times. Can Resume the game after any number of Days. Dice points ************************************************************* If the dice rolls 1, he will get 1 point for the right answers and -1 for a Wrong answer. If the dice rolls 2, he will get 2 points for the right answers and -2 for a Wrong answer. If the dice rolls  3, correct answer will be rewarded with 3 points and wrong answer will make you loose 3 points If the dice rolls  4, correct answer will be rewarded with 4 points and wrong answer will make you loose 4 points when rolled 5, correct answer gives +5, wrong answer gives -5 points roll 6 for 10 Points Bonus. You can pause: "Alexa, pause" You can check your status at any point in game by saying, "Alexa, what is my status" you can ask Alexa to repeat question by saying "Alexa, repeat the question." For more detailed description and scoring details, visits us at: https://pohostaging.club/smartDice/

Help! The animals have escaped, and you need to bring them back by completing different patterns. Animal Patterns is an educational game for preschool and kindergarten-age kids who are developing an awareness for patterns. The game presents a series of patterns and asks kids to complete them. Example patterns: - bear, lion, bear, lion -> What comes next? - dog, rooster, turkey, dog, rooster, turkey, dog, rooster -> What comes next? Animal Patterns automatically adjusts the difficulty of patterns based on prior responses. Patterns are randomly generated - play multiple times for different types of patterns. If you love this skill, please leave a 5-star review below! Feedback is always welcome at feedback@conversantdesign.com.

Every child is intrigued by trains, particularly when it comes chug chugging on to a railway station. Imagine their wonder and joy when they see a train come alive - talk, sing, tell stories and interact with them as a friend does? Meet their new friend is BOB THE TRAIN, who loves little children and who loves to play and hang out with them.  He is funny, smart, lovable, helpful and full of beans. He is always ready, at a touch of a button, to draw your children to learn, imagine, wonder and explore their little toddler world all through music, song, and dance.  He is the best friend any toddler would love to have and call his friend.   Dear parents, We bring to you - Bob The Train & Alexa. Alexa will help in introducing your little one to Bob. To make it fun and interactive, Alexa will ask a question which you need to answer after the song has played.  Below are some examples of how you can play with Bob the Train   Simply say :  "Alexa, open Bob the Train" Or "Alexa, ask Bob the Train to play Teddy bear"   Alexa will search for the song with the above name & starts playing it. Once the song is finished it’ll ask you a question based on the song, wait for your answer and will tell you if it’s correct.   Or   “Alexa, ask Bob the Train to play all"   Alexa will start playing all the songs one by one followed by a question about the song. You can always choose to say no if you don’t want to answer.    Do share your suggestions & feedback on this email id(uspapps@gmail.com)

This skill starts a session of 15 questions, asked one by one. Questions will have three options (1 or 2 or 3) out of which you will have to select only one option. Result to the question will be given immediately (correct or incorrect). After asking 15 questions, you will be given your score. You will also have the option of reviewing the incorrectly answered questions. You get a chance to enter yourself in the leader board by answering all 15 questions correctly. Good luck!

skill_name: Guess the Animal: Animal Sounds Game
skill_description: This animal game is all about fun. Can you guess what the cat sounds in Japanese language? How does the mouse squeak to a Swedish ear? Find it out right away! Fairy Tale Feud is an easy to play kid-friendly game with fun contests between fairy tale creatures. The Evil Witch is trying to take over the Enchanted Forest and only you can help the good fairy tale creatures.  You'll take part in series of contests to determine the fate of the Enchanted Forest.  If you get 5 good creatures into the Forest before the Witch you will beat her!   On each turn you will select who to send into the forest, the rules are simple: - Giants always defeat Elves since they are so much bigger and stronger. - Wizards always beat Giants by using magic on them. - Elves will always defeat a Wizard by tricking him.  You may also be joined by special characters from time to time!   The game is enhanced with images on devices with displays.  Good luck, the fate of the Enchanted Forest is in your hands!

Money Math is a game for kids and adults of all ages. Practice and improve your mental math and skills with money in this fun quiz game. Questions include calculating change, taking percentages, and adding and subtracting money values. Compete for a high score and try and beat your family and friends. The goal of Money Math is to help make math practical and enjoyable for kids, students, and even adults. Mental math skills with money are extremely important in day to day life. Spend some time with Money Math to improve your skills today! To play the game, say 'Alexa, money math.' Then say 'play' and answer the questions by saying '10 dollars and 47 cents.'

Bedtime Prayers is a skill to help children develop the habit of saying prayers at the end of their day. When you launch the skill or ask it for a prayer, the skill selects one from a small library of prayers.  Our prayers are all short and intended for children at bedtime.  Alexa says the prayer slowly, so that children and their families can easily follow along and join in. Be sure to tell any babysitters about the skill too.  It might help them keep children in their nighttime routine. After the first prayer, you can ask to repeat the same prayer, ask Alexa for another prayer, or just say goodnight. Some things you can say: To start the skill: "Alexa, open Bedtime Prayers." "Alexa, launch Bedtime Prayers." "Alexa, ask Bedtime Prayers to say a prayer." After hearing a prayer: "Repeat the prayer." "Say another prayer." "Goodnight." Parents can also say: "Add my prayer", to learn how to suggest your own prayer to add to the skill. "I like this", to hear how to send the skill's creator feedback. You can also say "Help" for examples of things you can say to this skill. Some of our prayers are traditional, and some may be contributed by users of this skill.  If you have a favourite bedtime prayer that children in your family have enjoyed, why not send it to us and we may add it in a future update. Please leave us a nice rating and a comment if you enjoy this simple skill.  By the way, we'd love to add more prayers contributed by our faithful users.  So if you'd like us to consider adding a family favourite of yours, just let us know by leaving a review in the Alexa app or skills store.  Your contributions, ratings and reviews encourage us to keep improving this skill.   Thanks!

Do you want to train your brain? Do you want to improve your spelling, but don't like those boring and badly working spelling skills? Then Clever Count is the right skill for you! Clever Count is not only the perfect skill for children, but also for adults who enjoy giving their brain a small exercise session.  Clever Count has been developed to train the brain in translating simple to complex words into characters and help to improve our spelling.  Alexa will tell you a word and you will have to count the number of letters it has. It contains around 9000 different words and allows you to vary between three difficulty levels, easy, medium and hard. There are some special features included into this brain trainer, such as occasionally asking you to count the number of vowels in a word when you are playing on difficulty level hard.  To start training, you will need to enable access to Kid Skills in your Alexa app, as this game is for both children and adults. After that, just say "Alexa, start clever count." to start a new training session. Alexa will then set the difficulty level according to your preferences and start asking you for the number of letters in different words, and all you have to do is respond with a number. It is as simple as that! If you are done training, just simply say "stop" and Alexa will not only tell you the number of words, of which you counted the number of letters correctly in this practise session, but also the total number across all sessions.  This is all you need to know to start training your brain. Go ahead and try it out! A few helpful features you should know about: If you need help at any point, just say "help" and Alexa will explain to you the game mechanics. If you didn't properly understand the word Alexa said, just ask her to repeat it.  If you feel like changing the difficulty level, feel free to tell Alexa to change it for you. If you want to delete your statistics and want a fresh start, just say "delete my profile" and Alexa will obey your command.  Be sure to rate Clever Count and tell us if you enjoyed it!
The evil laugh will put shivers down your spine! You can say: "Alexa, open Evil Laugh" "Alexa, start Evil Laugh" "Alexa, start Evil Laugh"

Ask Alexa to Cool Down whenever someone in your house (or school!) needs a few minutes to chill out. A gentle alternative to time outs, Cool Down begins with a bit of encouragement and provides one to five minutes of audio to breathe deep, relax your brain, and calm down before going to back to work or play. Parents can use Cool Down to help members of their family to re-center instead of argue. Teachers can use Cool Down to separate students who need to spend a moment peacefully sitting in one spot before returning to classroom activities. Adults can use Cool Down for a few minutes of meditation or deep breathing before or after stressful situations.  Audio selections include ambient sounds like birds or water and calming classical tunes. Attributions:  https://freesound.org/people/tim.kahn/sounds/197714/ https://freesound.org/people/3bagbrew/sounds/95753/ A few things to get the most out of your Cool Down experience:  Remember to be consistent. Cool Down is not a punishment, but can be an alternative to traditional time outs.  Show affection to your child (and yourself!) both before and after Cool Down launches.  Provide a spot to sit and reflect during the Cool Down process. Children often just need a moment to process their strong emotions. Remember to breathe!  For more ideas about how to use tech with kids in positive ways, see jentuttleparsons.com.

abc BINGO is a skill designed to help children develop and practice alphabet recognition.  Alexa is the bingo caller and will call out random LETTERs of the alphabet.   Physical game requirements: a prepared bingo card and playing pieces to cover the letter squares.  An abc BINGO card can be purchased or prepared at home or in the classroom.  It is  typically composed of sixteen squares, with one letter of the alphabet in each space.  The game offers both regular bingo as well as a blackout version.   Moms and preschool teachers - you can mix it up a bit and EASILY ADJUST this game to your child's or pupil's learning level by preparing a variety of different Bingo cards.   Examples - make it more difficult by preparing bingo cards with twenty-five squares or less difficult by preparing cards with nine to twelve squares.  Other Variations - prepare bingo cards using all capital letters, using all lower case letters, or using a random selection of upper and lower case letters. Let’s make abc BINGO even better! When we reach TEN, 5-Star reviews for this skill in the Alexa app, the developer promises to upgrade the skill by adding MORE variations of ABC Bingo. Possible enhancements include 1) Alexa calling out specific upper or lower case letters, such as Capital A, a little k, a capital M, etc., 2) Alexa calling out words that begin with the letter required.   So, by leaving a 5-star review you tell the developer it’s worth putting in more time and effort into development. It's a win-win, right? It costs you nothing but a little time, and inspires further development.   So that's how you can easily do your part to help improve and motivate the development of this skill...where else can you do that?  Now, go enjoy playing abc BINGO and we'll get to work developing some cool enhancements.  Let's make learning FUN! Just say, "Alexa, open abc BINGO", to start playing.  You can also say: "Alexa, start abc BINGO" "Alexa, launch abc BINGO" Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!

skill_name: Great Christmas Treasure: Story Theater Enabled
skill_description: Become part of this Christmas Adventure... Ernie is Santa's most trusted elf.  But then he overhears a shocking conversation which could endanger Christmas. This young elf has to solve the mystery and help restore things to normal before it's too late.   Immersive reading for young adventurers! Story Theater is an exciting new system that makes you part of the adventure.  You'll read along, read aloud and eagerly anticipate the next turn of the page. You can try the system for free.  Just say "Alexa, play Great Christmas Treasure." When the narrator says, "It's your turn to read," just say "Next".  You'll instantly become part of an exciting serial adventure tale that will make everyone eager to see what happens next. If you enjoy the experience, you can explore the entire system by purchasing the companion illustrated book here on Amazon.  https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07C4TLYPF Parents:  Story Theater is designed for kids.  We make it so that your child develops a lifelong love of reading.  The system moves forward using prompts read by your child which trigger narration, sound effects, music, background sounds...even Alexa herself in an age appropriate exciting adventure.  So hop on this sleigh ride and give it a try!

Challenging word game to train your gray matter and extend your vocabulary.  Rules are simple: you tell the letter, app tells next letter, who ends with a complete word loose the round.  So far it plays only with single words (so it will never guess an Old English Sheepdog or a Whale Shark for instance). You can use only nouns and never names, cities or else.  If you face problems with one letter recognition, try to use NATO phonetic alphabet: : Alfa, Bravo, Charlie, Delta, etc.  Or just try saying any word starting with your letter.

Counting Coach can help you if you need a sparring partner in your workouts, are practicing a choreography, playing hide and seek with your kids, or teaching them how to count. Examples: Alexa, ask Counting Coach to count to twenty (will count in a regular 1 second pace from 1 to 20). Alexa, tell Counting Coach to from one to eight fast (won't pause as much). Alexa, ask Counting Coach to count to 3 very slowly (will make a longer pause between numbers and pronounce slowly and more clearly). You can ask the skill to count between two numbers and to do it slow, very slowly, fast and very fast. Easter Egg: Try saying "Alexa, ask Counting Coach to count to 10 in whale".

(For kids ages 2 to 8)   The most funny and entertaining way to brush teeth!  End stressful battles over getting your child to brush! Dentists recommend children brush teeth twice daily, for 2 minutes.  But this is a painfully long time for kids, and they often become bored or distracted and give up. Using this skill, they will now enjoy the experience, while developing a lifelong healthy habit! Kids are carefully guided to brush their entire mouth (sides, tops and bottoms) so they can brush away ALL the cavities! When the last cavity is gone, a new and unique prize is waiting at the end.  Can your child collect all the surprises? To get started,  click the "Enable button", then say: “Alexa Play Bye Bye Cavities” “Alexa Start Bye Bye Cavities” “Alexa Open Bye Bye Cavities” Please leave a review if you found this useful!  If we can get at least 50 - 5 star reviews, we'll expand this to add flossing, and other fun ways to help kids develop healthy habits!   Happy Brushing!

Math facts fluency refers to the ability to recall the basic facts in all four operations accurately, quickly and effortlessly.  When students achieve automaticity with these facts, they have attained a level of mastery that enables them to retrieve them for long-term memory without conscious effort or attention.  Brain imaging studies have shown how the progression from effortful processes, such as finger counting, to automatized retrieval is associated with actual changes in the regions of the brain involved in mathematical computation. This trainer starts off at grade 3 recommended math fluency level and then adjusts to higher or lower difficulties based on the answers to your last ten questions. This is the initial version, made with the help of my two kids who are in elementary school. Please provide feedback on what you like or don't like and we'll incorporate that in future revisions.

Want to know what is special about today? or, What was special on 10 December 2016? and even, What will be special on 15 June 2018? Then just enable this amazing skill in the Alexa app. Now, never miss any of the important things about today. It is developed specially for children and senior citizens to keep them up to date with their knowledge about every day of the year. How does it works? We have enriched this skill with an extra ordinary , high tech calendar data base that remains up to the minute.  All you need to do is ask "Alexa, What special today? ". And, she will get you the everything related to today, on the go. One of the many astonishing features of this skill , is that you can even know about the specialty  of previous and the upcoming dates. For an instance, if you ask "Alexa, what was special on 22 March 2018?" She will reply you that it was "World Water Day".  Similarly , for 5 June 2018, she will say "World Environment Day". What you will need for this Skill? Following is the prerequisites  for this great skill: •Amazon Alexa App. •Amazon Echo device. •A valid Amazon ID  and Password. •A proficient Wi-Fi network. •Device to operate the Alexa app such as phone, tablet or PC. How to enable the skill? To enable the Skill, go through these steps: •Click on the enable the skill above. •And, follow the onscreen instructions. Or, •Open your Alexa app with your Amazon credentials. • Navigate to "Settings". •Click on "Skills". •Type and search for  "What special today?" •Select the appropriate Skill. •Click on enable, then enable now. And, you're good to go.

Go Bot helps your child get ready for school by taking them through a series of tasks they have to complete. To get started, add a child by saying "Alexa, ask Go Bot to add a child". After a child has been added the child can say 'Alexa ask Go Bot what's next for {name}?' and Alexa will ask them if they have completed the next task in their list of To Do tasks. If they answer "Yes" Alexa will ask them if they have completed the next To Do task. If they answer "No" Alexa will instruct them to complete that task. Reset all Done tasks to To Do by saying "Alexa ask Go Bot to reset tasks". To remove a child say "Alexa, ask Go Bot to remove a child".

The book cricket skill aids in developing basic addition skills for kids aged between 7-10, while engaging them in a competitive game of book cricket. Like cricket, the game is played by 2 kids, with each of them adding runs in their respective innings. A random number between 0-6 is generated indicating the number of runs scored on the particular ball. The kid needs to keep track of the total score by adding the runs scored on each ball.  Next ball is bowled only when the kid prompts the present score. If he prompts the wrong score, a wicket is taken. Each kid is given two wickets per innings. Hence, the kid with the highest score wins, i.e the one who successfully adds up to the highest total. For example, if kid one sets up a total score of 50 , the second kid needs to successfully add the scores to 51 before the 2 wickets are taken.

The brand new game putting your rhyming abilities to the test! Great for younger tykes first learning their words, and grown people looking for a challenge! Elementary Math is a skill that allows children in grades 1 through 4 to practice basic math questions. The skill will ask what kind of math should be practiced in a session. The choices are addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division. Once a choice is made, the skill generates 5 questions on that type of problem. Each response is marked correct or incorrect and instant feedback is given. The results of a session are stored so that the user is reminded what he or she worked on last time. To start the skill, or a new session, say "Open Elementary Math". After that, the skill will guide the user on what kind of math questions to practice. You can set the difficulty level to easy (default), medium, or hard.

Mr. Tongue Twister is an educational skill created to help young learners (8-12 year olds) as well as non-native English speakers improve their listening and speaking skills. The created skill consists of three sections: introduction, the actual game, and the calculation of results. At the beginning, Alexa asks a child for his/her name and then greets a player using the same name to establish a warm and welcoming contact. This feature was achieved by using an Amazon intent of the list of popular GB names. Then, the child listens to the description of the skill.  For example, Alexa: "Welcome to Mr. Tongue Twister. What is your name?" Child: "Hi! I’m John!" Alexa: ""Hi John. Repeat each tongue twister after me. Remember that I can slow down and repeat each phrase if you ask me. Are you ready to start now?" Child: "Yes!" In the following section, Alexa randomly chooses and reads a tongue twister from the list of kid-friendly tongue twisters. A child can ask Alexa to repeat the phrase slower using a variety of words or phrases such as "slower," "slow down," "repeat," "what," etc.  Alexa will kindly pronounce the same tongue twister in a slower pace to make sure the player understood every word. An important feature of this game is that Alexa will carefully listen to the speaker and let him/her know whether all the words are pronounced correctly. To achieve this, Alexa will repeat exactly what the player said and match it to the built in phrases. The next round of tongue twisters will be pronounced again at a faster pace until the child asks specifically to slow down again. If the tongue twister is pronounced correctly, Alexa will iterate through several possible praising responses to make sure a child knows he/she is doing great. However, if the phrase is mispronounced, Alexa will follow the same structure — repeat what a child said and then say it in the correct way, and move on to a new phrase.  For example, Alexa: "she sees cheese" Child: "she sees cheese" Alexa: "She sees cheese is correct! Good job." Next, "Penny paid a penny for a pumpkin" Child: "Slower" Alexa: "P-e-n-n-y p-a-i-d-a-p-e-n-n-y f-o-r-a-p-u-m-p-k-i-n" Child: "Penny paid a penny pumpkin" Alexa: "Penny paid a penny pumpkin is unfortunately incorrect. The phrase was, "Penny paid a penny for a pumpkin." Next "Upper roller, lower roller"  If a child completes all tongue twisters, Alexa calculates the number of correctly pronounced ones, and asks if he/she wants to continue the game. By saying "yes", Alexa starts it again, "no" or "stop" exit the game.  Mr. Tongue Twister is a great skill for children or ESL learners to sharpen their ear, improve speech defects, and learn how to pronounce phrases at a faster speed. It would be a good exercise to practice both in class or at home.

Alien invasion has three alien-themed games that can be played on any alexa enabled device (echo,dot,tap,show). Each of the games is targeted to teach and practice a different skill in an entertaining way to kids.  First game, Teach-The-Word asks kids to teach new words to the alien visitors using word analogies. They get alien-coins in return for teaching them correct words and reinforcing their knowledge. Eg, Aliens know that “Celsius” is connected to “Temperature” by some relation (unit of measurement), kids have to guess what should “Meter” be related to so aliens can learn a new connection. Periodically, kids also reinforce their knowledge by correcting the sets aliens have made themselves based on previous sets. Second game, Spaceships is about attacking alien ships with equations that equate to a number where the ship is located. Kids start with the “weapon” (aka mathematical operator) of addition and as they play more rounds, they unlock new weapons: subtraction, multiplication and division. Once they have more weapons available, they can decide which one they want to use for each attack. An example of an attack is: if Alexa says there is a spaceship at location 25, it can be destroyed by the kid saying “twenty plus five” (since it equates to the correct location).  And Finally, the third game I-Know-What-I-Know, Aliens try to engage kids in a trivia to test whether they “really” know the answers or if they’re just guessing. Kids get more points answering honestly rather than guessing.
