Carousel guide shares content to complement personal and vocational development. The vision of carousel guide is to  assist users growth their  knowledge, thinking strategies, awareness and self confidence. User selects which topic(s) to listen based on the options  Alexa presents at the time.  The skill requires capabilities to enable Alexa  Carousel guide shares briefs on in the following topic  10 categories:  1) Language: it can be on English grammar, linguistics, vocabulary, writing or other language related topic  2)  Food; it can be any subject related to food, for example  a brief recipe, a tip, a  good practice for cooking and/or baking, healthy eating, facts about food.  3) Beauty: it can be any subject with the goal of encouraging  positive thoughts  4) Story: it can be a narrative based on factual history, imagination, and/or creativity  5) Play:  can include  strategies, game rules, and facts to encourage strategic thinking  6) History, can be facts, briefs on history primarily of United States  7) Geography (facts, briefs related to geography  8) Life fact, it can be any topic associated with nature, life and environment; life, health sciences and biology  9) Thought:  content to encourage reflection 10) Numbers:  includes  practical  applications  of numbers in  math, geometry, financial, or arithmetic calculations; it also provides a brief  explanation of the process to arrive to the results.    How the skill works: The user selects the topic(s) he or she wants to listen once Alexa  presents him/her with the  topics available for selection . User can invoke the skills with one of the following Utterances:  Alexa begin carousel guide Alexa open carousel guide Alexa load carousel guide Alexa play carousel guide Alexa launch carousel guide Alexa start  carousel guide Alexa resume carousel guide Based on the tests performed,  the skill invocation also works  without including “Alexa” at the beginning  ( in earlier trials it appears that the skill may not follow the same command from time to time but as today it follows them without including Alexa at the beginning of the prompt from the user.   To select the topic user may  say: Carousel guide  history  Carousel  guide story Carousel  guide language Carousel guide food Carousel  guide beauty Carousel  guide numbers Carousel  guide life fact Carousel  guide play Carousel  guide geography Carousel  guide  thought Based on Alexa's  key commands available (begin, start, tell, play,  start..) User may select the topic once Carousel guide launches.  Respect utterances below  are some of the 24 set at this time.   Note: in the first example below  {Carousel guide selection topics available} refers to one of the 10 topics Carousel guide offers for selection. teach me  {Carousel guide slot}  where {Carousel guide selection topics available} may be either of the 10 topics Carousel guide offers (food, numbers...). For practical purpose in the listed utterance examples below will use S as abbreviation of {Carousel guide selection topics available}   mentor me with S can you give me  S can you give me a S I want to learn about S I  want to learn about a S now I want S now S lets try S give me S The following invocations  work without listing them as utterances: Carousel guide tell me about geography  Carousel guide tell me a story Carousel guide tell me about history Carousel guide tell me about beauty Carousel guide tell me a thought Carousel guide tell me about numbers Carousel guide tell me life fact Carousel guide tell me about language

The Make Believe skill encourages kids to play make-believe games by suggesting games and characters for them to play. The skill simply suggests the games - it doesn't play the games, that's up to the kids themselves! We're going to add THOUSANDS of fun game ideas to the skill, so it never runs out. It was inspired by our own kids, who love making up games - about Kings and Queens, aliens, monsters, adventurers and so much more. We hope you have as much fun using it as we had making it!

Children love acting out stories since it gives them the freedom to take on new roles and experiment with ideas and emotions. Pretend play is not only fun, it is also important for children's cognitive and social development. Once kids get started, they tend to take their make-believe play in all kinds of unexpected, creative, and interesting places. However, sometimes they have a little trouble getting started with new story or character ideas, that is where Pretend Quest can help! Pretend Quest seeds kids’ pretend play by giving them roles and goals. Once Pretend Quest best the story started, the children take it from there. They can ask for one or more characters to play by asking “Who am I?”  and they can ask for a goal by asking “What’s my quest?”. In addition, multiple kids (or adults) can join in to play cooperatively together by each taking a turn and saying, “Who am I?”  Give it a try with the following conversational phrases: “Alexa, start Pretend Quest.” “Who am I?” (first player) “Who am I?” (second player) “What’s my quest?” "Start quest!"

To get started with the Learn Up skill, begin by enabling the skill and simply saying "Alexa, ask Learn Up for a fact."  You may also request a fact from a particular subject (currently, we support English, Math, Science, and History) or from a particular school by saying any of the example phrases displayed below. All facts that you hear are submitted by teachers nationwide through www.learn-up.org. If you are a teacher and would like to participate, please request the secure code from your school's superintendent. If you are a superintendent from a school not present on the website, please send an email request to info@learn-up.org and we will add you to the system as soon as possible. Thank you for using Learn Up!

If the first phrase is not understood, the second phrase will be easier.  If the second phrase is also not understood, the story will simply progress.   For each first phrase understood, two stars will be awarded.  For each second phrase understood, one star will be awarded.   Users will be congratulated on the number of stars they achieved during the story.

Bullying is rampant in many schools and knowing how to handle new and different situations can be daunting for young kids. Help better prepare your child for the real world with a bit of virtual exposure. From peer pressure situations, to standing up for others, to empathy lessons, Bully Woolly takes place across three locations: the park, the lunchroom, and the bus. Each location includes three levels where they have to answer yes or no questions in order to progress. Upon completion of each level the player will be rewarded with a badge in the game that signifies their accomplishments.

A cool skill that helps kids get ready for school on time and parents keep track of their status, without having to check the clock.  Here's how it works: Ready Steady comes with 5 built-in activities: Bathroom, Breakfast, Getting dressed, Backpack and Extra Activity, each with their own time slot, which will be presented upon launching the skill. The activities will run one by one until it's time to leave home. You can consult how much time you have left for the current activity by saying "Alexa, ask Ready steady for the status" or "Alexa, ask Ready Steady how much time is left for Breakfast", for example. Here's how to customize it: You can customize the time allocated for each activity and you can also disable or re-enable them according to your wish. For example, "Bathroom" has a default time slot of 10 minutes. To change it, say "Alexa, ask Ready Steady to set Bathroom to 15 minutes". If you want to remove an activity from the schedule, just say "Alexa, ask Ready Steady to remove Bathroom". If you want to re-enable it, simply say "Alexa, ask Ready Steady to set Bathroom to 10 minutes".
I am your Bedtime Guardian. I will help you scan and protect your room from monsters, ghosts, and bad guys! You can ask me to scan the room, or you can ask me to protect your room.

To provide facts to kids about space, hopefully to inspire them to search the galaxy and learn more about space. It might even come in handy to know some stuff about space on a science test or in a classroom.

This Skill is made for Kids from preschool to second grade to teach them the range of numbers between 1 and 100 to get a better understanding of the decimal system. Group of tens and units have different sounds.  A deep sound represents tens, a high sound represents units. E.g. the number 23 = 2 deep sounds (20) + three high sounds (3)
A game where you battle monsters to reach the enchanted land  by answering math questions. The more you get right, the more monsters you defeat . Beware, incorrect answers can take away your lives.

Awakening soul is designed to lift up your spirits and to reduce the stress and anxiety of your daily lives that is very much present in the present scenario. Teaching children about the art of meditation is the ideal age to begin the process of self awareness and has far reaching benefits than when taught in adulthood. 'Awakening soul' sets up the right environment that is required to do meditation by kids. When asked for ‘meditation’, it offers different types of meditation techniques originating from Buddha's way of meditating that are scientifically proven to improve your mood, calm your mind, relax your body, enhance life force and help you develop healthy self esteem. When asked for ‘teachings’, it teaches you excellent values taught by Buddha through the medium of randomly chosen story from plenty of short and crisp stories that help you retain these morals and include in your behavioral conduct. When asked for 'quotes', it also presents the kid with many and many quotations by Buddha that would give you an insight and nurture your emotional well being. It gives them an expansive and relaxed way of thinking which help you bring clarity and to reach your full potential. When asked for ‘Buddha’s life’, Awakening soul also introduces you with the life of Buddha. You can choose to know any of the phases of Buddha's life by asking it about 'Early life', 'Mid life' and 'late life'. The purpose of telling about the life story is to make a better understanding of the transformation Buddha went through his journey of life that ultimately lead him to realization and enlightenment. The kind of questions Buddha is perplexed by in the childhood is a lot relatable to the never ending curiosity the kids have in their childhood phase too which the parents are not able to clarify out in the right way sometimes or it becomes too difficult for a child to comprehend. If at any given point you are not able figure out what to do, you can ask for ‘help’ so that you can be guided with options to choose from such as meditation, teachings or life of Buddha or quotes. Also, if any point you are not feeling like doing the current activity or want to switch to some other, then you can say ‘skip’ so that you can start afresh from the activity you are willing to do at the moment.

This skill is a fun way to hear the interjections in American, Canadian, British, and Indian english accents. It plays the special words and phrases provided by Alexa Speechcons in each of the languages. You would need  to change the Language setting in the Alexa app to hear words from that specific set.
Be a Mathematics Detective! Solve the problems given the clues. The questions are a mix of addition, subtraction and multiplication.

No prerequisites Alexa tells kids an interactive story, we do not request any personal information.  This skill will ask you for a made-up name in order to address the user. It will also ask for gender in order to tailor the response. The skill does not store any personal information. Users can choose from spooky and normal story.

Sounds Odd is a fun game for children in early years. Listen for the odd sound and repeat it back to Alexa to score that round. Games consist of 10 questions. Sounds Odd is a game focused on the starting sounds for words, eg "cuh" for cat, camp, cup etc. Each question will add a word which doesnt fit with the other 3 words, try and guess which one is the  odd one out. Games consist of 10 rounds so children can score out of 10. Each game consists of random questions, new questions are being added. Please give feedback with your experience as this is greatly appreciated.

Common Categories is an odd-man-out game designed for children 13 years and younger. Every question contains 4 words, and the child must pick out which word does not belong. An example question may be "cat dog apple hippo". In this question, "apple" does not belong because it is a food and the other words are animals. The goal of this game is to teach young children how to think quickly and associate similar words.
Learn a range of superlative facts from around the world (deepest ocean, largest island, etc.). Best way to enrich yours and your children's general knowledge is to hear these facts.

Hi! I'm Emily Ann! I live on a big farm with my family and lots of animals! Tomorrow I'll be six years old! Can you help me find my birthday present? This interactive story allows you to journey with Emily Ann around her farm. You help Emily Ann by choosing where to search; will you look in the big red barn, or the chicken coop? Enjoy the sights and sounds of a farm as you and Emily Ann engage with a myriad of farm yard animals. Will you find her present before the party, or will Emily Ann have to wait until after the cake to open her gifts?  Come on, let's go find out!

Test your rhyming abilities against the world with Rhymer. Just say a word that rhymes with the one Alexa gives you, the catch is you only have one life and you cannot repeat words. See if you can beat the global high score today!

Diorama Infinity lets you create infinite worlds inside your Echo Show - by turning the Show into an augmented reality diorama creation platform. You can either use this skill by itself to view safari diorama screenshots created by other users. Or, you can create your own by downloading the iOS app.    Every time you say "Alexa, open DIORAMA INFINITY", you get a random screen that a user created.  Point your phone or tablet (once you grab the app below) at the screen to "see into this world". Note that as you move your device, you can see so much more than just the plane of the screen - it's an entire infinite space!   If you want to create your own diorama, simply summon a Grid. Say: Alexa, open DIORAMA INFINITY and load a grid. The creator menu shows up. You can now sign your name. The upload button also appears when you are ready to upload. Grab the iOS app @ http://get.diorama.space/ios
You will get a description of a flag, and you need to guess which country it comes from. Or you can just ask what is the flag of some country.
Motivate kids in the morning to learn something new as they get ready for school - and to create discourse, share knowledge.

With this skill, you can get information about  All DC and Marvel Superheroes of all time. It's a Fact skill, tells the facts of the different characters. Useful for some unique facts about Superheroes characters.

Prepare for an "out of this world" exploration of Space! As a newly-recruited explorer of "Space Game Headquarters", several missions are ready to test knowledge and comprehension of the Moon, Mars, and other locations. Using state-of-the-art technology shuttle technology (i.e. your living room, etc.) with assistance from Mission Control, each mission provides insight into the location–through a series of introductory "lessons" and a few rounds of questions. At the moment, there are two missions available: the Moon and Mars. Reminder for parents: while this skill is designed primarily for pre-teens, younger children can also play, but may need guidance on certain topics (i.e. mass/weight and its relation to gravity).

Come sing "Down by the Bay" in an interactive sing-along! When the the song goes "have you ever seen a...", you can suggest an animal name, and hear a song verse with a silly rhyme.  This skill recognizes 70 different animal names. Try suggesting "whale", "cat", "mosquito", "frog", "alpaca", "elk", and more. If you can't think of an animal, say "I don't know" and we'll suggest one for you.

Mathinator allows users to initiate math quiz games. After installing the skill, you can ask for quizzes of varying levels, which then test addition, multiplication, division, and subtraction. The games are set for a pre-determined amount of time, and high scores are recorded over time to allow players to keep track of their highest scores for the day. Points are rewarded based on quickness to respond and accuracy, rewarding fast answers with more points.

Every day, test your knowledge on 6 new facts in Nature, Science, Animals, History and many more! Some of them are true, and some of them are false. But watch out, there are trick facts every day that are looking to trip you up! You'll earn points for every fact you get correct, and when you get enough you'll level up! Whether you get facts right or wrong, you'll still have fun learning tons of facts on all kinds of topic. This skill is aimed at children aged 6-12. If your child is on the younger end, you may want to play with them to help out with the answers. This skill can help improve your child's listening comprehension skills as they'll need to pay close attention to each fact.

Looking for an interesting skill to challenge kids' general knowledge? With questions suitable for kids, this skill is both entertaining and educating. Answer questions naturally, instead of picking one from a list of choices. It motivates kids to ask and compete to try to score higher points.

The Last Coin is a kid-friendly strategy game based on the mathematical game, Nim. Take turns against Alexa to grab coins from the jar. If you grab the last coin, you win! Try and beat Alexa on both easy and hard difficulty! Play now by saying, "Alexa, let's play the coin game".

Animal Guess Game is a simple quiz game to help children associate animal name with their sound. After entering the quiz, users can guess the sound of an animal. There is also an information mode where users can ask the app what sound does a certain animal make. With this app, children can easily familiarize themselves with animal sound!

Save the Princess is a choose your own adventure story designed with young children in mind. Alexa will prompt you with a piece of the story, and then she'll present you with options you can choose that will lead you in different directions. Along the way you'll be presented with basic questions to encourage learning, like simple math, rhyming, or riddles. The end goal is to save the princess.

Math Bot is ready to help you practice your multiplication tables. She's a curious to see if your math skills are as good as a machine. Give Math Bot a number between 1 and 12 and she'll test you to see if you know the answers. If you're a kid in grade school or a "big kid" at heart, Math Bot will give you plenty of time to answer. She will also help you along when you need it. Let Math Bot sharpen your math multiplication skills!
Alexa will present two words. Learn to identify how consonants and vowels sound by comparing the two words

Shiritori is a word chaining game that helps with vocabulary. Alexa will say a word, and your word needs to start with the last letter of that word. This game will go on for twenty rounds, or it will last forever in the unlimited mode. The longer your words are, the more points you will get.

Want an alternative to boring math flash cards? Or simply tired of thinking up math problems for your kids to practice? Try 1 + 1 Math and have your kids practice addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division problems on their own.

Mathketball brings together the fun of math and basketball. Play it to sharpen and improve your math knowledge and skills. Challenge your friends to a game or go for a high score in the three point contest. Afterwards, learn something new by listening to the top five plays of the week. Mathketball focuses on mental math, addition, and multiplication.

Safari Adventure is a skill all about animal sounds. From the time we are toddlers, many of us are taught basic animal sounds to help develop our memory and retention. This skill is the recreation and reimagination of the old-fashioned teaching methods. With Alexa, teaching kids about animals becomes much more interactive and fun. Safari Adventure has five different categories (Birds, Cats and Dogs, Farm Animals, Sea Creatures, and Grab bag for everything else) that are each split into four levels of difficulty (easy, medium, hard, and expert). There are 100+ sounds to discover in total. This makes it so that whether a child or an adult starts playing, the challenge is adequate and the educational factor still remains. If you are a parent, feel free to play along with your child or children! Good luck out there! Credit for Skill icon: Free Vector Graphics by Vecteezy.com. The sounds collected and used by this skill are protected by fair use under section 107 of the Copyright Act since they are used in an educational context.
Gives a random cat fact out of a set of 10 facts.

Times Table Madness offers a fun and exciting new way for kids to practice their times tables.  Instead of just asking you the usual times table questions, Alexa will ask you to multiply silly objects. For example, she may ask you “What is ten times eight pineapples,” or "What is seven times twelve smelly socks." To score a point you would need to answer with “Eighty pineapples,” or "Eighty four smelly socks." Alexa is quite generous in her scoring. So if you get the answer right, but say the wrong silly object, she'll probably let you off!  You can ask Alexa to test you on any number, so it's fun for older kids and adults too. Why not try the 256 times table.  Once you have chosen your times table, by saying e.g. "Test me on seven," Alexa will ask you 6 questions. After answering all the questions, she gives you a final score and tells you how long it took you to answer all the questions.  See if you can beat your friends and family by scoring full marks in the fastest time.  But most importantly... have fun!

Cora will give your kids (and other members of your household) the opportunity to earn "Cora bucks" by doing chores. They can choose a chore, come back and report when completed. An adult with an Amazon account will need to set up chores and users by going to https://hellocora.io. The Cora web app will also help to keep track of completed chores and users balances. An optional SMS setting can be configured to receive notifications everytime a user finishes a chore. Additionally, the Alexa Cora app will add a to-do list item to follow up the completion of each chore. Here are some possible interactions. Alexa, open Cora Bucks: "I finish my chore" or "I'm done." "How much Cora Bucks do I have?" or "What is my balance?" "What is my chore?" or "What is my last chore?"

Alexa will practice your multiplication tables with you! Give Alexa which multiplication table you want to practice, and then Alexa will randomly generate questions for you to answer! The table you want to practice is up to you! The number of questions that you want to be asked is up to you! Practice with Alexa!

Nothing special is needed for this skill! Just say "Alexa, open Inspirational Messages", and you'll be told an original inspirational message! This skill hopes to make kids happier in a changing world.

Trivia game using amazon Alexa and the Alexa app. A country's flag will be shown on the home screen of your Alexa app, and you will have to guess what country it belongs to. Start the skill by saying "Alexa, start the country flag quiz" Be sure to have a smartphone or computer on hand with access to the Amazon Alexa app or alexa.amazon.com, as the country flags will be displayed on a card on the app home screen.

Turn your progeny into a tiny playground scholar with this off beat maths "Quiz". It helps teach basic arithmetic with a bit of Rabelaisian humour thrown in for good measure to prime a well rounded renaissance tot!

Traverse the "lower 48" by driving from state to state in this simple and easy-to-play game. Conserve fuel and don't waste your paycheck as you complete assigned trips from coast to coast that change every hour! Think you know how to get from Maine to Oregon? State the State is free to enable and play forever. Enjoy! State to State can be played by kids of all ages but is particularly directed towards kids under 13.

This skill is was created with the goal in mind of aiding teachers of young students in teaching listening skills through the use of the "turn and talk" method, which is described as follows. The teacher begins by pairing each student up. Each child then turns to their partner, and then the teacher provides each student with a question. Each student then takes a turn answering the question. This method is implemented by providing the students with a random question, a timer so each student knows when their time to talk is done, and also introduces a series of verbal cues that a teacher would introduce to her students prior to use that help to keep children on task. Using the skill is fairly simple. To start the skill, say something to the effect of "Alexa, ask Classchat to give us a question", and Alexa will begin by saying, "Okay everyone, 1, 2, 3, knee to knee!" This is one of the aforementioned verbal cues, and is the "turn" part of "turn and talk". At this point, each child would be asked to face their partner. Alexa will then ask a random question from the question database provided. After Alexa asks the question, an internal timer will begin, and this is where a teacher would direct her students to begin to answer the question to one another. The default time is set to 3 minutes, and Alexa will announce when time is halfway finished so the other partner can begin to speak. Once time is up, Alexa will say "3, 2, 1, talking is done!", which is another verbal cue meant to return the attention to the teacher. It will then ask the kids to give a "thumbs up" if they demonstrated a key communication skill, such as making good eye contact. You can ask Alexa to provide a question that is more focused on a specific topic by saying something like "ask Classchat to give us a question about respect". The different topics you can currently choose from are: reading, our strengths, each other, respect, and school. You can also adjust the time allotted for the question by saying something like "ask Classchat for question for 2 minutes". A number of different phrasings have been included in the intent schema in order to provide for many different teaching scenarios.

Let you kids get their wiggles out with fun interactive voice and music tracks your kids will love. To start, just say "Alexa, start Wiggly Kids" or "Alexa, play WigglyKids". At anytime, you can stop by saying "Alexa, stop"
Endangered animal quiz for kids. Learn about different endangered species and their lifestyles!

A fun quiz on how well you know your opposites. You might learn a few on the way! The game ends when you get three strikes. The words are fit for kids in preschool, kindergarten, and early elementary school. It is great vocabulary practice.
Let's find out who's the fastest by testing everyone's speed at various tasks! A fun game for adults and kids. Logo made with Logomakr.com
This is a simple game where the objective is to find the odd one out. You will be given 10 questions each with three items, you have to decide which one is the odd one out.

Mischievous elves have kidnapped the Tree Queen, and she can only be rescued if you, her best mathematician, unlock the charms that are keeping her hidden. Kids 6-8 use early elementary math facts, solve word problems, and stretch their imaginations and vocabularies in a quirky tree house castle full of surprises and kid-friendly humor. With thousands of possible combinations, kids can play again and again without encountering the same game twice.

World changers offers the stories of individuals who through great effort changed the world. Learn the adversities they overcame and how they achieved there dreams. See if you can guess who they are before they give you have all the clues!

Whose cleaning the dishes this week? Battle it out in Math Wars and find out. Math Wars isn't just your typical math skill, with Bonus Rounds, and a few Surprises, learning has never been so fun! Whether you're challenging yourself or battling others, Math Wars is a great way to learn addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division. Tell your teacher about Math Wars, and play in the classroom! P.S. You'll be one step ahead :P Difficulties ------------------------- For each arithmetic there are five difficulties, very easy, easy, medium, hard and very hard. Addition        Very Easy   1 - 5 Addition        Easy        2 - 10 Addition        Medium      5 - 20 Addition        Hard        11 - 50 Addition        Very Hard   25 - 150 When asked a medium addition question you be asked to add two numbers between 5 and 20. The sum will be between 10 and 40. Subtraction uses the same difficulty pattern as addition but flips the numbers around. If addition is 1 + 2 = 3, then subtraction would be 3 - 2 = 1. Multiplication    Very Easy   1 - 4 Multiplication    Easy        1 - 8 Multiplication    Medium      2 - 12 Multiplication    Hard        3 - 16 Multiplication    Very Hard   4 - 20 Division uses the same difficulty pattern as multiplication but flips the numbers around. Startup Phrases - Use Startup Phrases to start playing even faster. Please note, these ONLY work before the game is started! ------------------------- Alexa, open Math Wars Alexa, ask Math Wars to play with settings from last time Alexa, ask Math Wars for 5 questions Alexa, ask Math Wars for 10 multiplication questions Alexa, ask Math Wars for 10 very easy addition questions Alexa, ask Math Wars for 10 medium multiplication questions for 4 players Alexa, ask Math Wars for 5 hard division questions for me Alexa, ask Math Wars for help

Looking for a game that can be played with your family and friends that is engaging and challenging? Memory Game for Kids is the game for you! The game will present a small list of words(over 100 total different ones!) to you and then ask a question about the list. Make sure to memorize the list in order to answer the question! An example would be “what word was before dog?”  This game can be played alone, or with friends working together to score on all rounds! The game offers two difficulty modes, normal and hard. Normal repeats the word list every round, while hard does not. Hard offers the extra challenge for those wanting to practice their memory as you have to remember the list purely in your mind from start to finish! Enable Memory Game for Kids and start testing your memory today! This skill does not collect any information or require any setup or account information.
Are tomatoes fruit or veggies? If you are confident test yourself with Fruits vs Veggies. Keep playing to get better at distinguishing fruits from vegetables.

We know reciting geography facts is no fun. Instead, "Find Benny" puts the user in a world of travel and adventure. The world is vast, which is why "Find Benny" has information on close to 100 of the most influential and prevalent cities in the world, spanning six continents. Our clues range from celebrities to regional musical snippets to local delicacies and attractions, totaling almost 2000 interesting facts about these global cities! Examples of clues: He sent you a ticket stub from Van Gogh Museum. Benny just sent you a picture of the local money. They use Rupee. He just sent you a selfie with Mark Wahlberg! Whoa! All you need for this skill are your wits, your imagination, and an Echo. No passport required. Intro Music from www.bensound.com

Feelings with Ziggy is an educational game that aims to enhance the emotional literacy of young children by placing emotions to common experiences, ultimately helping children identify and express what they are feeling. To start a game you can open the skill by saying “Alexa, ask Ziggy to play game.” Ziggy, everyone’s favorite Zebra, tells the player a fun short story of an experience he had and how that experience made him feel. The player then has the option of acting or drawing out how Ziggy felt! If they player chooses to act out the experience, they are given 20 seconds. If the player chooses to draw, they are given 1 minute. However, if the player needs more time, they can say “more time.” To get the next question the player prompts Ziggy by saying “Go” or “Go Ziggy”! If you enjoyed the skill, please leave a review and If you have suggestions please email agdasmith@gmail.com.

Think you know our presidents? Think again. Imagine this: your name is Thomas Jefferson, and you've just received word that Aaron Burr is planning to create a new country within your borders. What do you do? Do you sit back and watch as your former Vice-President takes your land? Or do you fight for your country by answering his Presidential Trivia? We hope you chose the latter. Presidential Quest is a game for all ages which will test your knowledge of all 45 Presidents through a fun game setting. All information contained in the game is factually accurate and will be great discussion-starters at the dinner table. So what are you waiting for? Go save the Union!

Welcome to Alphabet Adventure. Let's explore Alphabet Land! Fun and interactive way to learn ABCs. This skill will teach children new words and alphabet by asking 26 questions! A to Z, everything is covered. What are you waiting for? Try it out now!

With AskMe Contest, two teams will participate in a 5 rounds contest. The questions in the contest are designed to encourage kids to learn new things. The skill provides weekly fresh, interesting questions on variety topics (geography, history, math, life science, etc.) that inspire kids’ curiosity and teach problem-solving skills. The Skill plays cheering up and encouraging music for both correct and incorrect answers. In the contest, the skill motivates kids with funny Speechcons. It creates the tension situation in the contest by increasing the questions’ difficulty, and the speed of speech is increasing after each round, and having the lucky star question in which a team can earn extra point. In the contest, teams are allowed to try the question that other team could not answer and get reward point for the correct answer. The Skill motivates team work with game for two teams, suitable for classroom environment or family event. It foster collaboration and communication between team members. The teacher and the parent can discuss with the kids about the topics of the questions or teach them on these topics. You are welcome to create interesting question for kids. The questions will be included in the skill. Please send the questions to nguyenducphuong@cfvg.org using the same format as the following question file (the first answer should be the correct answer) https://s3.amazonaws.com/askmecontest-bucket/askmecontest-question-1.json
Inspire you with quotes that help making friends

This skill takes kids on an adventure to find an astronaut - Major Molly - who's gone missing exploring the solar system. Major Molly will leave them a clue about which random planet she visited, and players will have a chance to look for her in several different locations on those planets (such as on moons, the planet's surface, and other locations that appear randomly - like space ships and asteroids). As well as the choose-your-own-adventure aspects, kids will get told facts about the places they visit on their search, so they can learn about the solar system, as well as get different experiences and choices each time they open the skill.

Words Adventure allows kids to improve their understanding of the English language, through fun quizzes about grammar including nouns, verbs, adjectives as well as homophones. To improve your English, try playing Words Adventure at least once a day. You will learn a lot and also have fun!

The skill's purpose is to create the world's first environment where kids can interact with legendary and mythological characters from all around the world. The kids join these characters in various fun adventures and also learn important life lessons like speaking the truth, eating fruits and so on. The skill is opened by saying, "Alexa open helping gods".  After this, the kid can select which character to have fun with!

A fun and interesting skill that will support your kid in their early year to learn to count. Ask Alexa to start learn to count and choose between three modes: easy, medium or hard.  Each are designed to help your kids progress in learning to count.  Easy mode is a simple repeat of the number. Medium mode requires a response with the next number.  Hard mode is the same as medium but misses out some numbers along the way.

The 'Word Power' skill is used to memorize High Frequency Words with their proper spelling and sentences using a structured drill of recitation and also provides spelling quiz of the day. The user can say- "Alexa, Open Word Power". For feedback and questions, please write to us at alexa@nectarspot.com
Creation Station will prompt you for an animal, color, and sport.  Given your feedback, a wacky story will be generated and read back to you.  Change up your inputs to get a goofier story

There are three games: Gypsy, Fortune Teller, and Pokemon Battle. Gypsy is a game where you can ask several questions and Gypsy will answer your question with a yes, no, or a maybe. Fortune Teller is a game where u can ask Alexa for your fortune, and Alexa will simply give you your fortune. Lastly, Pokemon Battle is a story telling game. All you have to do is make several choices, and the story will change depending on what you choose. Pokemon Battle has many different scenarios, so you may play multiple times. It's also your choice if you want to play another game after each time you play. *If you have trouble at any time, say "help." These are the question you may ask while playing Gypsy: 1. Will I die soon 2. Will I go to college 3. Will I get a good job 4. Will I become a doctor 5. Will I become a hobo 6. Do I love my dog 7. Do I love my cat 8. Do I love my family 9. Does my dog love me 10. Does my cat love me 11. Does my family love me *Alexa will answer with a yes, no, or maybe

Perfect Ear Training is an easier, faster, and more fun way to learn how to hear a note and recognize its note name.  You start the skill by saying, "Alexa start perfect ear training." If you want to start playing immediately, just say, "give me a note" and Alexa will give you a C or a B note.. When you're ready for harder notes, say, "Set skill level to 3" or 4 or 5. Currently, you'll have to do this every time you play the game, but in the very near future, Alexa will remember your choice. If you want to make it easier, say "Set skill level to 1" You can also change instruments: For Sine Waves say, "Change instrument to sine waves" For Piano say, "Change instrument to piano"

Bookworm is a skill that teaches your child to read by providing a story for your child to read and then providing feedback to your child based on your child's performance. To start, Bookworm listens to your child read to determine a reading level; once the child's skill level is calculated, Bookworm presents stories for the child to practice reading. These stories are custom written and tailored to your child's reading level. Bookworm rewards progress with encouraging words and trophies to keep your child engaged. Bookworm is built for the Echo Show, but supports any Alexa enabled devices. An Echo Show or similar device is not required. If your Alexa enabled device has no screen, head to www.bookwormapp.net on your computer or tablet, press login, then enter the room code Alexa provides when you launch the skill. Check out www.bookwormapp.net for more information.

Ever wonder how to get your child to finish his or her homework on time and learn time management, instead of wasting time on watching Youtube or playing games? Meet Miss Arcade, your child’s best friend that will teach them about self discipline and motivate them to do assigned tasks. Miss Arcade is an Alexa skill that targets children in elementary school (ages 6 - 10) with the goal of improving habits and introducing them to money management by earning stars and spending them on prizes. Both parents and their children interact with the skill. Our skill is based on an engaging task system that rewards good habits and promotes self-discipline. It is like an arcade game, but for completing real tasks and earning real-life rewards. Parents are able to set a number of tasks for their children, and specify how many “stars” they will receive on completion. Stars can be redeemed for prizes (like candy or TV time), which the parent also specifies with the Miss Arcade skill. When the child is done, they can report to their parent and the adult can mark the task as completed. Cheating will not be possible, as parents can check which tasks were completed recently and have the ability to reverse it. Both child and parent can ask Miss Arcade what the current star count is and what tasks there are left. This way, tasks can be self driven and done throughout the day, while homework can be done without a parent pestering the kid! By using this skill, children are able to learn more about time management and the rewards of completing work in a timely manner. Additionally, they'll have to save their stars for more valuable prize, introducing financial skills.  Unlike other Alexa skills or mobile apps, Miss Arcade is made specifically for kids and provides the type of fun experience that will help kids continue to engage with Alexa and establish strong foundations for time-management skills.  Process:  - Add prizes (movies, video game time, etc.) to Miss Arcade (parents) and describe how many stars it will take to redeem. Ex. Alexa, ask Miss Arcade to add reward. Quantities are not stored for prizes, though they can be removed at any time.  - Add tasks (homework, housework) to Miss Arcade (parents) and describe what the task is and how many stars the child will earn after completing it. Ex. Alexa, ask Miss Arcade to add task. Tasks can be duplicated and removed.  - List tasks and rewards in Miss Arcade (child) and choose one task to work on. Ex. Alexa, ask Miss Arcade to list tasks. Alexa, ask Miss Arcade to list prizes. - The child completes the task and gets stars for rewards.  Ex. Alexa, tell Miss Arcade that homework is now finished. - The child can redeem prizes with his or her stars. Ex. Alexa, tell Miss Arcade to redeem prize. The parents will give the reward to the child. Other features: - Check how many stars the child has. Ex. Alexa, ask Miss Arcade how many stars I have. - Remove task in the task list. Ex. Alexa, tell Miss Arcade to cancel homework. - Remove prize in the task list. Ex. Alexa, tell Miss Arcade to remove prize. - Check what the child has finished in the last 24 hours. Ex. Alexa, ask  Miss Arcade what has been done today.  - Uncomplete any task (parents) in case the child lied. Ex. Alexa, ask Miss Arcade to mark homework uncomplete. Coming features: - Deadlines for tasks and give bonus stars if finished in time. - Streaks for finishing multiple tasks in a row or meet a certain expectation. - Weekly reports on the child’s progress.
In this skill, Alexa is a fellow player in the classic party game where monotone "hahas"' turn into a laughing riot! Ask Alexa to have a laughing party and she'll join in on the fun.
This skill allows a user to play a quiz game about creatures.
Nee-Naw play the sound of a siren on a vehicle used by emergency services

Homework Heroes is a skill that makes homework entertaining by allowing kids play short quizzes on the Alexa. You can either play any game or find a list of available games https://HomeworkHeroes.co.uk and shout out the four digit code to play them. Parents and teachers can login to https://HomeworkHeroes.co.uk with their Facebook account and create their own games (ideally based around the stuff their kids are doing that week in school).  Kids can then use the Echo to play the games set by their parents or friends or teachers. Of course, not everyone has the time to make their own games so the idea is the community creates a ton of games to play.

This is quiz to help learners to master maths times tables in a simple and fun way. It aims to build Mathematical fluency which is required by all for their day to day needs. The quiz questions are based on maths times tables. Every attempt will have 10 questions. The tables used are 2 to 12 (times 1 to 12). Questions are randomly picked from these tables. After answer for each question, it will indicate the correctness, the correct answer (if wrong) and also the score. Each correct answer gets a score of 1. If the question is not clear ask to "repeat" or "say again" If you dont know answer say "don't know" To stop the quiz say "end quiz" To restart in between the quiz say "start new quiz" ROADMAP for future release 1. Skill levels (eg tables 2,5,10 at level 1; include tables 3,6,9,4,7,8 at skill level 2; include tables 11,12 at skill level 3; include tables 13-20 at skill level 5 and so on 2. Maintain quiz state across multiple session 3. Multi-user quiz .

Diabetes is one of the biggest common diseases in the world. Unfortunately, many do not take the disease seriously. Children are mostly affected by type 1 diabetes. However, the number of children who develop type 2 diabetes due to obesity as a result of malnutrition and physical inactivity is also on the rise. Early education and prevention in school and kindergarten should help to prevent this.  Have fun with this quiz.

You can ask the Alexa 'Math Challenge' skill for a math challenge. It challenges users with problems of varying degree of difficulties, which range from addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, highest common factor (H.C.F.) and least common multiple (L.C.M.). The math challenge adapts to users' level; it makes the challenge harder if they are doing well and easier otherwise. You can invoke the skill by saying: Alexa start math challenge.

World Capitals Quiz is both meant for Education as well as Entertainment Purpose. The quiz will question you about world Capitals. For Example : -  What is the Capital of United States?. User, have to answer the question, and then Alexa will grant you a score if it will be a correct answer, or a zero in case of a wrong one. Also, If you are not familiar with any Capital or Country. skill_name: The Living Calculator - Educational Math Game
skill_description: Get ready for some educational fun! The Living Calculator is a child and family-friendly math mind game where you solve an equation that is told to you at the start of each round.  This game can help you have some fun while learning simple arithmetic or it can be used to sharpen and challenge your math skills, memory skills, and even mental reflexes! It is great for your child because the answers are always non-negative,the equations are fairly simple and the game has multiple levels of difficulties and it has multiple levels of difficulties, but it can also be fun for the whole family.  It is a fun game to take turns and play with your family, friends or even just alone with the company of your pal, Alexa. Just make sure to keep track of your score after your turn is up, to see if you can improve. Here's how it works: - When you begin a new game, you select a difficulty (easy, medium, or hard) - You are then told an equation and asked to give a solution. - If you answer an equation incorrectly, the game ends, but you always have the choice to play again.  - HOWEVER, if you are a smarty-pants and you answer an equation correctly, you have the choice to continue, BUT BE WEARY- the next equation will always have one extra number added to it.  Here is a breakdown of the difficulties: - Easy difficulty is addition only with numbers between 0 and 10.  - Medium difficulty is addition AND subtraction with numbers between 0 and 10.  - Hard difficulty is addition and subtraction also, but with numbers between 0 and 20. Now that you know what it does... Do you think you have what it takes to become a LIVING CALCULATOR?!?

This skill tells good and inspirational quotes said by various superheroes. Kids usually admire superheroes and often imitate them. This skill is one way to instill good qualities in children through the superhero medium.

Alphabet Chu Chu Train is fun and engaging skill for kids that will take chu chu train to different stations and teach alphabet letters along with alphabet song. Bag of Giggles is designed for groups of kids.  It's a kids party game reinvented for Alexa.  Alexa will act as the party host leading groups of kids through silly and goofy fun: - Treacherous Tongue Twisters - Devious Would You Rather Questions - Priceless Pretend to be. . . - Absurd Act like a . . . All topped off with groan worthy jokes! Bag of Giggles works great on any Alexa device but those with an Echo Show get a special treat.  Along with all the zaniness, you get goofy pictures to make the smiles even bigger. Note: the skill works great on the Echo Spot but the graphics are optimized (right now) for the bigger Echo Show. We are motivated by 5 star reviews.  The more 5 star reviews we get, the more we will work on enhancing Bag of Giggles.  We would love to get feedback and suggestions - please e-mail: skills@boplabs.com with your ideas! Note to parents: The team who created Bag of Giggles are all parents (our kids had lots of input!).  We want our kids having fun, playing, and getting their faces out of screens.  Technology like Alexa and games like Bag of Giggles are ways for old school style games to be augmented (but not replaced) with technology.  Technology is a helper, but the fun is generated by the kids themselves!

With this Skill, you can practice telling time and doing calculations with time. This Skill has currently three modes: learn mode, identify mode, and math mode. Test and improve your knowledge of country names, learn interesting facts about various countries and improve memory retention in this fun, engaging, competitive and FREE game! Begin by saying "Alexa, play Country Game". This is how the game works. You say a country name. Example: 'Sweden'. Then, Alexa says a country name starting with the last letter of the previously spoken country name. Example: 'Netherlands' (starts with 'N' since 'n' is the last letter in 'Sweden'). This goes on and on until you or Alexa cannot think of an answer. You can also say 'Pass' if you get stuck in which case 100 points are deducted from your score and the game continues. If Alexa loses, your score increments by 1000 points. You also earn points if 6 countries are spoken back to back in a single game. The game also randomly educates you about countries by telling a fun fact about them during the course of the game. For ex :  if you say 'Netherlands', it may tell you a fun fact about it like "Did you know that around 20% of Netherlands is located below sea level?". This skill keeps a score of your performance based on the number of countries you say in a game. You can also query your worldwide rank by saying 'Whats my rank?'. While this game is targeted for children under 13, it can very well be enjoyed by adults. Primary school teachers in schools may also consider making this game part of their classes to teach students about various countries.

Voice Tic Tac Toe allows you to play Tic Tac Toe with your voice. You can select a location by saying things like "top", "middle", "up left", or "left up".  It has multiple levels easy, medium, and impossible. You can select the level by saying "change level to impossible".

Outer Space Alice is a fun Alexa skill for kids. The story follows Alice, a teenage astronaut on the International Space Station. Kids can ask her where she is and Alice will give them the real ISS position orbiting the earth and a fun fact about the location. Alice's companion is a robot named Pierre - he has some fascinating facts about oceans, continents and countries. With Outer Space Alice, kids learn about the International Space Station, geography, languages and other fun facts about the world.

Geography Genius is a fun educational game to help kids learn the countries and cities of the world.  The game can be played in one player or multi-player mode.  The game involves players alternating saying countries and cities that start with the last letter of the previously said place.  The goal is to get the highest possible score. Ex. First player says “United States”.  Next player can say “Seattle” How to Play To start the game say: “Alexa, start Geography Genius” At the welcome prompt say a game mode.  Ex. “One player” or “Multiplayer” At the next prompt say a country or a city. Ex. “United States” Then the next player has to say a country or a city that starts with the last letter of the previous place Continue until you or your team can’t think of anymore valid countries or cities. Now you know how to play! Get ready to start becoming a geography genius!  Game Modes One player: In one player mode you compete with yourself to earn the highest possible score, while playing alongside the “Geography Genius”.  To start the game, the player says a country or a city, then the “Geography Genius” will say a place.  On each turn a player has three guesses.  If the three guesses are used up, any remaining skips will be used.  If no skips remain the player gets the final game score. Multi-player: In multi-player mode you work as a team, alternating players each turn, to earn the highest possible score.  To start the game, a player says a country or a city, then the next player says a place that starts with the last letter of the previous place.  This continues until the game ends.  On each turn a team only has three guesses.  If the three guesses are used up, any remaining skips will be used.  If no skips remain the team gets the final game score. Useful In-Game Utterances Say “rules” at welcome prompt to get the game rules Say “Alexa, help” at any point to get help Say “Alexa, stop” or “Alexa, cancel” at any point and you will be prompted to exit the game Say “Alexa, exit” at any point to exit Geography Genius.   Say “score” or “stats” at an in-game prompt to get the game stats. Say “more info” at an in-game prompt to get details of the most recently said place. Say “skip” at a prompt to skip the current turn, and receive a new random letter.  This uses up a skip.
Want to learn new words and synonyms ? Here is Word Master. It helps you to expand your vocabulary which in turn makes you feel smart.
Fairy tale fact skill. No prerequisites are required.

Forever Lasting is a voice interacting survival game where the player takes on the role of a castaway and must survive until help arrives. The player starts the game by saying "start Forever Lasting". The player has an option to listen to a tutorial after the intro to game. The player can scavenge to collect materials to craft and fish to catch fish to eat and crafting to make items which improves your survivability. The three stats are food, water, and energy and the max limit of these stats is 7. If two stats fall down to zero, the player dies. The stats are regained by eating, drinking, or resting. The player must survive for 5 days, doing 4 actions per day (scavenging, fishing, sleeping) and must have 3 beacon items to achieve a good ending. The beacon item is gained by crafting. The minimum hardware requirement for this game is an echo dot. It should work on all other echo devices. This skill's purpose is to provide entertainment while improving memory skills and long term planning.

Learn key stage 3 science with over 100 fact-bites. Just ask KS3 science for biology, chemistry or physics and you'll be on top of your science in no time. Key stage three is part of the UK National Curriculum, however this app is suitable for supplementing Junior High Science knowledge in the U.S.

The classic game of repeat after me, but you get to pick the words. Alexa will start with one random word for you to repeat and then add to the list of words. See how many words you can repeat correctly! Choose a list of words to have some very funny phrases!

The latest app, Guess My Fruit V1.0 developed by UofT Engineering Science students! Hardware required: Any voice-enabled Alexa device, with the ability to download skills from the Alexa skills store.  Guess My Fruit is a skill which enables Alexa to guess the fruit you're thinking about. Just think of a fruit, and let Alexa know you're ready. She will ask you a few questions and then guess which fruit you had in mind! There are no accounts, no sign-ups, and no collection of any private information. It is a simple skill which enables kids to engage with a fun game while learning about the wonderful world of fruits! All content including fruit facts, and any images associated with this skill, are original creations :)

The skill aims to improve mental mathematical calculation capability of young children. It acts as a teacher that asks relevant age and capability related maths questions. Topics currently covered are Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication, Division and Times tables. Note: We DON'T collect any personal information from the child. The skill is linked to a user's (parent's) Nurturey account that has the relevant information provided ONLY by the parents/adult users - providing a secure, safe and seamless experience for the kids and parents.

Multiplication teacher is a skill that allows you to practice your multiplication tables. You can begin by saying "Alexa, multiplication teacher". The skill will then ask which multiplication table you want to practice. For example "Practice multiplication by two" will ask you 10 questions around the table of 2. At the end you'll get a score to know how many good answers you got.
Whether you want to improve vocabulary or even your SAT Score, Words will allow you to learn a new word everyday! Simply ask Words for the "word of the day".

Autism Help is designed for parents and caregivers who are busy and overwhelmed, to use the convenience of Amazon's Echo device to teach functional, social and verbal skills. You will be offered skills to work on,  with each step of that skill provided. You can work on multiple areas at a time, and Alexa will track your progress.   There's applause to reward children as they complete each step, and music to ease the stress of completing a step. Why Autism Skills? I want to see children with autism grow and express their creativity and realize their dreams. I don't want the lack of verbal, functional or social skills to hold them back! A little every day makes a huge difference. Try Autism Skills...one skill at a time!
Repeat the Trail Life USA Trailman Oath and Motto.  Ask Alexa to help your Trailman learn the Trailman Oath and Motto.

This game skill pays homage to one of the earliest computer games, "Lemonade stand". This version is completely redone from the ground up, attempting to enhance but maintain the spirit of the original game in a voice-only experience. This game skill simulates owning a lemonade stand. Alexa states the weather forecast for the (simulated) day and then the player buys cups of lemonade to sell, buys signs for advertising, and sets a price for a cup of lemonade. The skill provides clear instructions what's expected of the player. The game goes on forever. You will earn "experience badges" as you accumulate playing time and earn money selling lemonade. This is a great game for children, parents to play with their children or educators in a classroom. The game focuses on the following player skills: careful listening, math, money, business, understanding odds and chance statements, and managing expectations. At any time you can ask "what's the weather" or say "tell me the weather" to have Alexa repeat the weather forecast. You can find out how much money you've earned by asking "how much do I have" or "how much money do I have". To have the simulated game day number repeated, you can ask "what day is it" or "what's the day". To see what badges you've earned, say "Alexa, badges". You can ask for contextual help by saying “Alexa, help”, immediately go to the next simulated day by saying “Alexa, next day”, or stop the game by saying “Alexa, stop” or "Alexa, cancel" to end your game. Your current scores and badges are saved unless you reset your game or disable the skill. You will start with five dollars. If you go under two dollars, you will automatically be bumped back up to five. If you want to reset your game to the beginning (without disabling the skill and enabling it again), you can say "Alexa, clean slate" and then repeat the magic words Alexa tells you to say. Tip: When you say a price for a cup of lemonade, include the words "dollars" and "cents" where appropriate. Good examples are, "a dollar", "a dollar twenty-five", "two dollars and twenty-five cents", "seventy-five cents". Want to suggest features or report issues with Lemonade Stand? Please contact us by pressing the "Send Message" button at: https://www.facebook.com/LemonadeStandSkill
A game that tests your memory and problem solving skills by selecting different toppings and adhering to the feedback to create the perfect pizza for Alexa.

Space Brain Alexa skill for kids and adults alike. Learn about our Solar System! --- Educational app for teaching kids (and adults alike) about the planets, stars, and other objects that reside within our Galaxy. Study for your exam in your free time using this free Alexa skill. Target Audience: Grades 5-9. keywords: space,brain,challenge,alexa,app,fact,skill,learning,education,planets,kids ### HOW TO USE: YOU: Alexa, ask Space Brain for a quiz. ALEXA: Ok. I will ask you 10 questions about our Solar System. Question 1. True or False. Neptune has 14 moons. YOU: True ALEXA: Correct! Here is your next question... ... ALEXA: You scored 7 out of 10, you passed! Well done. Ask for another quiz to keep learning!
I can also tell you separate facts about the planets that might help you with the quiz: YOU: Alexa, ask Space Brain for a fact on Jupiter ALEXA: I know about Jupiter, here is a quick fact: The Great Red Spot is a huge storm on Jupiter. YOU: Alexa, ask Space Brain for a fact ALEXA: ...

Animal Yoga provides kids a fun yoga experience and helps them develop emotional self-regulation skill through imaginative play, breathing, stretching, and healthy movement. It encourages their creativity and imagination, builds their strength and flexibility, increases their body awareness, balance, and coordination, and provides them with emotional regulation tools. NOW WITH OVER 30 FUN ANIMAL YOGA POSES!!! Angelfish, Armadillo, Bat, Bee, Butterfly, Cat, Chameleon, Clam, Crocodile, Dragon, Eagle, Elephant, Flamingo, Frog, Giraffe, Jellyfish, Kangaroo, Lion, Lizard, Octopus, Owl, Pufferfish, Roly Poly, Seahorse, Sea Star, Shark, Snail, Snake, Spider, Turtle, Wolf…and more to come! HOW TO USE: - Quick ways to get started - Say "Alexa, play Animal Yoga" and Alexa will greet you and ask you what animal you would like to play. To have Alexa pick a random animal for you, say "Play Random". To get a list of animals, say "List Animals". Say "Alexa, ask Animal Yoga to play Bee" or another animal of choice. Say "Alexa, ask Animal Yoga to play random" Say "Alexa, ask Animal Yoga for a list". Alexa will speak a list of animals you can play. - Navigate through different animals when an animal is playing - Say "Alexa Next" or Alexa Previous" to play the next or previous animal.  Say "Alexa, Random" to have Alexa pick an animal for you. Say "Alexa, Seahorse" or another animal of choice. Clear the space, practice barefoot, and unleash your child’s body and mind! Hilariously entertaining and simple enough for a toddler to use, Goofy Goober is an Alexa skill that generates playful wisecracks for children. It's full of zingers entirely appropriate for kids of all ages. All they have to do is have Alexa ask Goofy Goober to make them laugh and she'll get the ball rolling with some silly one-liners. You can also direct wisecracks at a specific person by saying, "Alexa, ask Goofy Goober to tell me a joke about Dad", or "Alexa, ask Goofy Goober to hit Sarah with your best shot".

Duckets is a fun, voice interactive, educational skill that allows students to answer questions, and earn reward points called duckets.  You use these duckets as a reward currency in your home and allow your child to redeem prizes or accolades.

Background: On weekends my kids and I would practice simple math by adding and subtracting groups of coffee beans.  For some reason they associated the coffee beans with their father so they called them "Daddy Beans".   This skill will allow you to take simple math quizzes and keep track of your score as you go along. The Skill: This skill will take you through a quiz of 5 questions.  The skill keeps track of the users level and progressively makes the questions harder.  Currently simple addition and subtraction is supported. This skill is Alexa Show and Spot enabled. Please leave a positive review if you find this skill helpful. Options: Alexa, open bean counter  (will ask you to take a quiz) Alexa ask bean counter to quiz me (to directly take a quiz) Alexa pause (pauses the current quiz) Alexa resume (resumes the current skill) Alexa stop (stops the bean counter skill)

A game for kids who can count to 10 and want to improve their understanding of numbers. In 10 rounds, Alexa asks which of two numbers is bigger. Test if your child is interested by the questions: ‚Which number is bigger, five or seven?’ If your child asks for more questions, leave it to Alexa.   Attention: Alexa only understands a clear pronunciation of the numbers. Stay with your child for the first few attempts during the game to avoid any disappointment if Alexa doesn’t understand what they are saying.

Have you always been a crime fighter at heart? Do you feel the need to protect the common good? Then the police academy is the place for you! Practice giving the miranda rights by repeating after Alexa, and you will be making the streets cleaner in no time!

1. Enable the skill. 2. Begin the skill by saying, Alexa, start numbers guru. 3. Choose the difficulty level (Easy, Medium or Hard) 4. Alexa will begin the questions, reply answers with numbers 5. Alexa will keep track of your score as you go. And also highest score.  6. While skill in in progress, You can say following,  i. 'I don't know' to skip a question,  ii. 'Repeat' to hear the question again,  iii.'start over' or 'restart'  to restart the session. (This will reset your score too) iv.'Stop' to end the session, vi.'What is my score' to know your ongoing sessions score 'vii.change my level to <easy> or <medium> or <hard> ' this will change difficulty level of the session on the go. viii.' Help'.  to understand the skill better.  Alexa will respond accordingly for above key words.  7. Ultimate math skill for Alexa. Unlimited math questions. 8. Provide feed back to improve this skill. Will add them as required. few hacks -- ***Always say Repeat to hear the question again or to gain more time  to answer. *** *** Repeat or saying don't know are not counted for scores*** *** In each level, questions starts easier, the skill smartly changes the difficulty level within each level.*** Reply your answers to the questions with numbers for all kind of questions including word problems.  Example  3 Pens + 4 Pens = 7. Keeps track of highest score.
Animal 101 is a fun, yet educating skill designed for kids. It will keep them entertained for hours.
It's Taffy Time! Corny jokes to make you and laugh and laugh and laugh and laugh and laugh and laugh and laugh. Just say... It's Taffy Time!

Welcome to quick turn, a two player competition! First, each player will register as either player one or two. Both of you will then start by facing away from each other. I will then start to count down from three to one. After each number, you will both take one step away from each other, and on one you will both turn around, point at each other, and yell bingo. Afterwards, I will determine who had the quickest turn!
Answer questions to find a game to play?

When you want to wake the family, play with the kids or trick your friends, a police siren comes in handy.  Just say "Alexa, open Police Car" or "Alexa, play Police Car". Say "Alexa, stop" or "Alexa, cancel" to finish.  Note that you MUST prefix that with 'Alexa' due to the way Alexa handles audio.

Make somebody's day with this police siren.  Wake the wife, play with the kids, or trick your friends.    Just say "Alexa, open Police Siren".  You can stop it with "Alexa, stop Police Siren" - remember to prefix that with 'Alexa' !  "Go ahead, make my day."

Alexa will be your imaginary friend and hide from you somewhere in the room. You have to find her! *** This game is for young kids/toddlers *** The game starts by asking Alexa to hide and choosing how many tries you want to get to find her. You then walk around the room or point anywhere and ask if Alexa is there until you find her, or you run out of tries. For example, if you are in the living room you can lift one of the pillows and ask "Are you here?". If you like this game please rate it so other people can find it too! ************* How To Parental Pemissions *************** If you ***already enabled the skill*** and Alexa says "To use hide and seek skill, a parent needs to give permissions. To do that I sent some information....": 1. Open the Alexa app. 2. Click 'home'. 3. Refresh (drag down from the center of the screen).  4. Click 'Give Permission'. This will open the skill page.  5. Disable the skill, then enable again and follow the instructions below. If you ***haven't enabled the skill yet***: 1. Enable the skill on the app (find the skill by searching, click 'Enable To Use'). 2. If a sign in page opens, log in to amazon with your regular password (this might not happen if you are recently logged in). 3. The next screen should say "Your permission will apply to the following profiles: ..." and your profile should appear just above the 'Continue' button. 4. If you want to add permissions for kids click 'Add Child' and add a child accounts. 5. If **your** profile doesn't appear, it's possible Amazon thinks you are the child on the family account (age is irrelevant, you can stay young forever!).     You can try adding yourself, or calling Amazon customer service. 6. Click 'Continue'. 7. Verify you're an adult. Amazon may ask you to add a credit card to verify you are an adult. You'll need to add a credit card and billing address.     If you already added a credit card you might just need to input the cvv number again. 8. Read the 'Parental Consent' text, click 'I agree'. 9. You should see 'Thank You. Your parental consent has been saved. Your skill has been enabled. ... You can close this window by pressing "x" at the top.' 10. After you close the window you should see 'Enabling skill...' that eventually turns into 'Disable Skill' once the skill is enabled. 11. That's it, you should be able to use the game now. **** If anything goes wrong, or you are not sure about these instructions, please give Amazon customer service a call. I hope you enjoy this game.

Welcome to the Alexa 'Spell on the Phone' Skill. Would it not be great: if you spoke clearly on the phone? This Skill helps you to do exactly that, by avoiding confusion, when spelling on the phone. It is based on the official international spelling alphabet, used by I.C.A.O, I.T.U and ANSI.

Tale Spinner skill contains a collection of stories told in an engaging manner. The skill tells the story in parts and asks a question in between the parts. In the end, the skill tells the user the number of questions answered correctly as well as the user's overall standing on the leaderboard. While listening to the story, you can use the following instructions to make the experience smoother: 1. To replay the part of the story, just say 'replay story' or 'play again'  2. To listen to the question again, you can say 'repeat the question' 3. If you don't know the answer, you can pass the question by saying: 'I want to pass this question' or 'I don't know' 4. To restart the game, just say "start again" or "restart" It uses mp3 audiobooks available on kidsaudiobooks.co.uk as source material.

As a high school student, one has to juggle many conflicting priorities such as school, part-time work and activities for fun. Every week the player have fixed number of free hours for school, work and fun activities and the player has to choose how to allocate those free times. By the end of each week a summary report will be provided to show how well/poor they did.

Memory challenge tests your memory skills by giving you five random words which you have to memorise and then asks you some questions whose answers lie among the words that were given by Alexa in the beginning of the game. During the course of the game, you can use the following phrases while playing: 1. To repeat the words given in the beginning, just say 'Can you repeat the words?'  2. To listen to the question again, you can say 'repeat the question' 3. If you don't know the answer, you can pass the question by saying: 'I want to pass this question' or 'I don't know' 4. To start over the game, just say "start again" or "restart"

Science Bowl is based on the National Science Bowl buzzer competition for middle- and high-school students. It gives you ten questions per round to play. You can choose from any of the five subjects separately or all combined, as well as between two difficulty levels (middle or high school). It scores you based on the number of questions you get correct per round. The app also keeps track of the questions you have done to limit repetition.

You’ve been marooned on planet Faraway. You’ll need to answer modulus questions to fuel your trip Home. When we divide two numbers, we get a quotient and a remainder. For example, 8 divided by 2 has a quotient of 4, and a remainder of 0. On the other hand, 13 divided by 4 has a quotient of 3 and a reminder of 1. The modulus is the remainder of dividing two integer numbers. You can use mod as a verb like divide or multiply. 8 modulus 2 is 0, and 13 modulus 4 is 1.

A game to catch all the creatures. Have BoJo catch you a creature including a Gobolo, Weltim, Eggshem, Hooteray, Lipersnap, and a Mitlew that is just a few you and BoJo can catch. Check on your Alexa app, Echo Show, or Echo dot to see the creature caught. New creatures are coming soon. Have BoJo read how many creatures you have and to release the duplicate creatures.

Play hide and seek with Alexa! Alexa will provide instructions to players, call out a countdown, and act as safe spot to return to. She might also have something fun to say for people who sneak back to her safely...

Ready Set Know is a trivia game that tests your ability to recognize a pattern, rather than knowing a fact. Items of a set will be read to you one at a time, all you need to do is figure out what comes next. Ready Set Know offers multiple difficulties, as well as a variety of genres for the sequences.  Ready? Listen to some things from the Set. And tell Alexa when you Know the what comes next!

My Math Tutor is intended to quiz elementary aged students on their common core math skills. The common core topics and levels are defined by the State Standards Initiative in the US (more details here: corestandards.org). Not all common core topics are covered, but many are. The topics included in this app include addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, next number, number comparison, odds and evens, adding to ten, and place values. The grade levels covered in this app include kindergarten to fifth grade. More topics and grade levels will be incorporated in the future. There are currently three themes included in this skill: basic, cute, and superhero. The basic theme will have regular math problems, whereas the cute and superhero themes will be a word problem on the same topics. The cute theme is about puppies and kittens, and the superhero theme is about saving citizens. More themes will be included in the future. Note: currently, the answers need to be given in a phrase like "it is 9" or "maybe 2".
A trivia quiz related to space facts, planets, stars and astronauts.
This game helps kids use reason and deduction to find a puppies family. They can examine a small puppy they found and put up flyers around town to try and help find the puppies family.

Kids center brings a fun musical and learning game for kids to guess the sound of animals, birds, characters etc. Through sound kids learn quickly and become familiar with animal, birds, characters etc.

I created this skill as an entry for the Alexa Kids Skill Challenge . There is essentially only one interaction with this skill. The user may also ask for the previous sentence to be repeated.There 3 to 4 different sentences associated with each letter. I hope to add more content soon.

You are in a virtual room with Alexa, and your goal is to find her without the use of vision. You can shout "Marco" and Alexa will respond back with "Polo". Alexa's voice will be louder if she is closer to you in the virtual room, and softer if she is further away. You can move around the virtual room by saying go "north","east","south", or "west", and say marco to check if you're closer or further to Alexa. When you run into Alexa, you win!
The skill will play a rhythm, and you should repeat the rhythm using sol-fa names, i.e. 'Do, Re, Mi, Fa, So, La, Ti'. The rhythm gets longer when you answer correctly.
