Your puppy wants to play hide and seek! He's hiding in the house and needs you to find him. To begin the game, just say, "Alexa, start Find the Puppy." You will start in the entryway and will need to move from room to room until you find the puppy. Listen closely for the colors and directions of the doors in each room. To move to the next room, you can either say the door color or the direction. For example: • open the blue door • go to the left HINTS • Some doors will be open. Those are rooms where you've already been. • Listen for the puppy. The barking will be louder when you're getting closer.

The Skill is designed to be very simple and co-operative. We will keep on adding more mini-games within the skill. prefered for Kid. To be more interactive with Alexa device and learn from these mini-games and improve their general abilities.

How to play: 1. Everyone stands up at the beginning of the game. 2. Everyone pretends to be an alien, ninja, or a bear. -To be an alien, point your fingers up with your hands at the top of your head -To be a ninja, give your best karate pose -To be a bear, show your claws 3. Say 'Next' for Alexa to make the next choice 4. The last one left wins!

WHO DID IT is an Alexa skill for children ages 2 to 5.  You or your child says, "Alexa Who did it?" and Alexa responds with "Ella did it." Where Ella is a name pulled randomly from a list of names that you set up ahead of time. At any time, after invoking WHO DID IT, say ADD ABC where ABC is the name you wish to add to your list of names. Alexa will confirm the name has been added and listen for the next ADD command. Continue to say the word ADD followed by a name until you have completed your list. When the list is complete say "Alexa Who did it?" to hear a name from the list. Once the name is spoken, Alexa will listen for 6 seconds to hear a reaction. If you say "No" or "I don't think so" or "No way" Alexa will choose another name from the list. This can continue until the list of names is exhausted. This is helpful if you want Alexa to say a specific person's name. If you say "Yes' or "I thought so" Alexa will confirm the name and stop listening. You can add more names at any time, up to 20 in total.   You can also delete names from the list by saying DELETE ABC where ABC is the name to be removed. To hear a complete list of names at any time say READ NAMES. After each command Alexa continues to listen until you say Good bye or there is a time out (6 seconds). Help is also available at any time by saying HELP. An ideal situation for using "Who Did It?" Is when something happens and no child will own up to it. Children enjoy hearing their name or the name of their brother or sister.

Kid Quest is an episodic interactive storyline for children under the age of 13. The application is invoked with the phrase Alexa, start kid quest. Each scene includes one or more questions that affect the storyline. At least one of those questions tests the child’s vocabulary, spelling, or memory skills. Throughout the quest, the child’s progress is saved and may be returned to continue or restart the episode.

Kids Coin Quiz is an educational skill that was created by the developer of the Professor Piggy Bank app. This skill was built to help kids learn about coin values. It has several questions about the four main coins used in the United States. Questions are mainly about how much each coin is worth, how many coins it takes to make a specific amount, and the amounts that happen when you combine different coins.  To begin just ask Alexa to open or start "Kids Coin Quiz" Each multiple choice question has four available answers. Each answer is spoken by Alexa as 1:, 2:, 3:, & 4:. after the question. Simply respond with the number of the corresponding answer you choose. Easy to understand and easy to use. Each quiz contains five questions from a list of several questions within the skill. Some question examples: Which coin is worth twenty five cents? 1: dime 2: quarter 3: nickel 4: penny How many nickels does it take to make ten cents? 1: five 2: one 3: ten 4: two This skill is great for kids learning about coins, coin values, and counting coins. You can also increase and further enhance their knowledge by using the Professor Piggy Bank app, which is available on Amazon App Store. Enjoy!
Ever wonder what a computer program is made of? Code Help can explain the parts. Ask Alexa for a specific definition or a random fact.

State Explorer is an engaging skill for kids to learn about the 50 states of the United States that has two components or modes:  1.Information Mode in which it gives them information about each of the states, and  2.Challenge Mode in which it tests their knowledge by asking them a series of 5 questions on state capitals or nicknames.   Information Mode The child can ask for information about a specific state, such as Virginia by saying, “Alexa, ask State Explorer to tell me about Virginia.” Or they can ask to hear about a random state by saying, “Alexa, ask State Explorer to tell me about a state.”  Alexa will answer with the state’s capital, nickname, motto, bird, and flower. Challenge Mode To take either the State Capital or State Nickname Challenge, the child must first register their first name as a player. So, Bob would say, “Alexa, register Bob.”  Alexa will use the name they give to track the points they earn during their challenges.  A great feature is that State Explorer can keep track of multiple children as long as they use different names. Once registered they can take a challenge by saying, “Alexa ask State Explorer to challenge me on either State Capitals or State Nicknames.”  Alexa will then ask for their Player Name and the Difficulty Level for the questions.  There are 5 multiple choice questions for each round.  The Number of Possible Answers Given and the Points for a Correct Answer each depend on the Difficulty Level.  This explains how that works: Easy – 2 possible answers will be provided, and the correct answer is worth 1 point, Medium – 3 possible answers will be provided and the correct one is worth 3 points, Hard – 4 possible answers and each one correct is worth 5 points. Because Alexa will save the scores from their challenges, the child can find out his or her point totals by saying, “Alexa, tell me my scores,” and giving their Player Name when Alexa asks.  Since State Explorer allows multiple players, kids can compare their scores as they increase their knowledge of the states. State Explorer is a fun way for children to learn some basic information about the states that will help them in school and probably even stump their parents!
Name that Animal. A range of animal sounds for you to guess what the animal is through Alexa.
It tells you the meaning of the word.

Help celebrities from past to solve challenges and misteries. To start, just say "Alexa, launch Time Traveller" or "Alexa, open Time Traveller"". At anytime, you can stop the quest by saying "Alexa, stop"

With Build a Snowman, you can build hundreds of cute and unique snowmen and save them for later. They'll always be happy to see you, and they'll never melt. You don't need snow, you don't need winter–all you need to build a snowman is Alexa. Make sure to open up your Alexa app or look at your Echo Show to see your creations. Please leave a rating, too!

With multiple interactive stories to choose from, Animal Rescue offers fun, engaging adventures for ages five and older. Children and families first select an animal to rescue, and then the journey begins! INTERACTIVE STORIES --Panda Rescue-- (10 levels) You’ve just been accepted as a volunteer for the Panda Wilderness School, which is a Conservation and Research Center for the Giant Panda in Wolong, China. They’ve just rescued an orphaned baby panda from the forest, and you are the assigned caretaker! Your job is to keep your baby panda healthy as it develops from a baby to an adult, and to teach it important life skills so it can be released back into the wild when it’s grown up. --Tiger Rescue-- (13 levels) You've been chosen to travel to Chitwan National Park in Nepal to learn how to help Bengal tigers. While you're there, you'll stay at the home of a young park ranger named Dhanvi. Your job will be to watch and protect one of the tigers in the park. You'll follow your tiger as it grows from a tiny baby into a strong, proud adult. You'll learn about all the things your tiger needs to survive, and help them as they face the challenges of growing up in a jungle. --Turtle Rescue-- (14 levels) You've been invited to join the Archie Carr Center for Sea Turtle Research in Florida, as they try to learn more about the life of sea turtles. On this adventure across the Atlantic Ocean, you’ll explore oceans and beaches, learn how to scuba dive, meet some of the world’s strangest animals, and make friends along the way. Your baby turtle is named Finn -- unlock this story to discover whether baby Finn is a boy or girl, and start your adventures in the sea! --Penguin Rescue-- Coming soon! TIPS FOR PARENTS Each story has between 10 and 14 levels. We recommend playing one or two levels at a time, which provides an engaging 10-minute interaction. If you don’t hear the prompt, just say “repeat.” All of our adventures involve the concept of conservation, to help build awareness of the importance of protecting our planet and vulnerable species. Content is suitable for ages five and older. FEEDBACK We hope you find Animal Rescue to be a delightful experience. If you have feedback or suggestions on how to make the adventures more enjoyable, please contact us at info@matchbox.io.

Power brain is to increase the math thinking and to enable ability to do faster calculations. Kids can do Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication and Division at 4 different levels 1 to 4. Each level will have 10 random questions and kids needs to answer at least 8 with correct answers to move to next level. You can also play the choice of your level.

You can now exercise your basic math skills such as addition, multiplication and subtraction in a fast paced manner. Simply say "launch vulcan academy" and begin your practice! Choose between 10 difficulty levels, up to 4 operands per question.
This is a skill that tells silly jokes.

Become a Times Tables Guru yourself with this comprehensive educational skill.  Master the tables over time, record your results and become a real Tables expert. This skill has been created specifically to help children develop their table skills, but it can be used by people of all ages including mum and dad. Times Tables Guru helps you steadily build your Times Tables Skills. Learn the Tables just by saying the Table you want to learn such as “Ten Times Table”. Then once you think you know a Table try answering Alexa’s Table Questions in order, just as you learnt them and then try the same table in random order. If you are new to tables you may like to attempt them in the following order: 1 times table, 10 times table, 2 times table, 5 times table, 11 times table, 4 times table, 3 times table, 6 times table, 9 times table, 8 times table, 7 times table and finally the 12 times table. But that is up to you and you can learn them in any order you wish. If you want Alexa to track your progress then use one of the 4 available nicknames; mum and dad can track their progress too! You can check on your progress at any time by asking Alexa to tell you your progress for the different skills such as:  learn, in order, random, or count up or down. Once you feel you have mastered all the tables you can ask Alexa to ask you questions on 2 tables, 3 tables or 5 tables at once. Once you feel really confident you can take the Mega Test which will ask you all 144 questions across all 12 tables. Getting that right can give you the feeling that you may well be on the way to becoming a Times Tables guru.  Once you approach Guru standard maintain your Table knowledge by using the “Challenge” mode which will test you with 60 questions on 5 random tables. You can also try out the “Count up” or “Count down” options where you just count up or down in steps of 1 to 12 as selected by you. Times Table Guru is there to help you and as such it is forgiving, you can skip some answers if you are not sure and Alexa will say what the answer was, then at the end Alexa will allow you to try the questions you skipped and if you get them right Alexa will count that as a Table completed correctly (as long as you didn’t get any wrong!). If you are not sure what was asked, just say “repeat” and Alexa will repeat the question without penalty. Even Alexa isn’t quite perfect and she occasionally confuses 90 with nineteen and 80 with eighteen. And it can be frustrating if you are doing the mega test or a multi-table test and Alexa confuses those terms and decides you were wrong when you weren’t! So, in Times Tables Guru, Alexa has been programmed to avoid such confusion for some critical numbers which reduces the likelihood of frustration.  To learn the two times table say "two times table". Alexa will then teach you the 2 times table.  To answer the 12 questions on the two times table sequentially say  “in order two". Alexa will then start at 2 x 1 = ? and ask you the 12 questions on the 2 times table or any other you have selected.  To answer the 12 questions on the five times table in a random order  say "random five". Alexa will ask you twelve 5 times tables questions in a random order. At the end Alexa will tell you how many you got right and the correct answers to any you got wrong. If all answers are correct and you are using a nickname, Alexa will record your result.  To count up in fives up to 5 times 12 say “count five”. Alexa will give you a start number, 5 in this case, and you will count up in 5s starting with that number: 5, 10, 15, 20 etc. Alexa will confirm you are correct each time.  To count down in fives starting at 5 times 12 say “count down five”. As before Alexa provides the start number, which is the first number you say. For more instructions just say "help" when using the skill.

Take an adventure through a barn, zoo or field as we count the number of animals that we come across. Looking to test your addition skills or just getting started with learning how to add? Look no further, enable this skill to start enhancing your addition skills.   If you get stuck feel free to ask for a hint, is it too hard? Ask to make it easier, looking for more of a challenge? This skill can help teach kids multiplication tables. In practice mode, select the specific fact table you are working on or select random for all of them. In teach mode, ask for the answer to specific problems or select random and it will tell you a random multiplication fact. Activation phrase is "Let's Multiply"

We all know the health benefits of fruits and vegetables. This is a game where you can name and learn many fruits and vegetables, their healthy values and fun facts about them. We have prepared interesting descriptions of each one to help you level up. If you get stuck you can use the hints or skip the word and come back to it later. Let's get started and have fun! Disclaimer: The information in this skill is provided for informational and educational purposes only.

Kids age 5-9 and parents alike will be challenged to a game of name-that-song.   The music has no lyrics but is adjusted or performed to play only the most familiar part.  You will still be challenged since the music is comprised of countless nursery rhymes, ageless movie and play themes, and holiday-appropriate music (until the holidays are over) along with a couple twists.   Building this has inspired me to teach some of the oldie nursery rhymes to my 7-year-old grandchild!  This skill is designed to tolerate the natural inclination to sing-along and the post guess discussion (and singing).
Do you like learning about the world around you? Obsessed with geography? GeoFacts can give you a wide assortment of facts.

Where do monsters live?  Some live under rocks.  Some behind waterfalls.  Some even live in the sea, hidden behind shipwrecks.  But everyone knows that most monsters live in children bedrooms!!   So we can get a good nights sleep, Alexa can help you check if there are any monsters in your room at bedtime.  Or anytime!!  Just say 'Alexa ask monster chaser to check for monsters' to check for the first ones.  She'll let you know if she finds any then let you decide if you want it to stay or if she should chase it away.  We don't need to chase them all away cause sometimes monsters are more scared of you than you are of them. Night night, sleep tight!
This skill takes 2 random two digit numbers less than 20 and takes the user in steps to multiply them easily. Every time the skill takes a new example and takes the user through the whole journey.

1/6/2018 - Made the answer responses a little more natural. You can just say the answer alone now. NEW UPDATE: Reduced level two's range of numbers to 0-15 to add additional practice with subtraction on smaller numbers. Level three is now addition and subtraction between 0-100. And level four is now the basic multiplication practice. If you have any suggestions please feel free to leave a review with your ideas. This Alexa skill asks math questions and checks your given answer. There are multiple levels to choose from to help practice and improve kids math skills. Level one includes addition of numbers between zero and fifteen. Level Two has addition and subtraction of numbers between  zero and fifteen.  Level Two has addition and subtraction of numbers between  zero and one hundred. Level four tests basic multiplication of numbers between zero and twelve. This skill doesn't have any special requirements just an Alexa device. If you have an Alexa show the given equation will pop up on the screen.  User Guide: Select the level when prompted by saying : "level one", "level two", "level three", or "level four". To answer a questions use the phrase: Simply say the answer or use the phrases "The answer is..." Or "It is...." If a question is too hard simply say "I can't solve this" or "This is too hard " and Alexa will get you a new question. You can also say "help" at any time to get instructions on how to use the skill at any time. To cancel or stop the skill you can say "quit".

The Awesome Korea Trivia Game provides fun and information to people who love Korea by providing an Korea based trivia game for all ages. The Korea trivia will ask you 5 questions with 4 answers to choose from and you will have to tell the Answer number.

Welcome to Happy Birthday song Welcome to Happy Birthday song. By simply asking, "Alexa, open Happy Birthday song"  Please use the following example phrases when using Happy Birthday song Alexa,open Happy Birthday song Alexa,ask Happy Birthday song  Alexa,play Happy Birthday song Alexa will  play Happy Birthday song .  Be on the lookout for our next monthly update. We'd love to hear from you! If you have questions, comments, or feedback, please e-mail us at getmrlove@gmail.com.
Don't wanna go to an event with a friend and need an excuse? Ask Alexa!

skill_name: Mighty Trivia - a guessing game for kids
skill_description: Are you ready to quiz your way to a top score on the Mighty Trivia leaderboard? Using up to five hints, guess what Alexa is pretending to be to earn big points and take that number one spot! Points are based how fast you can correctly answer, the amount of hints you needed and the level of difficulty. Answer your way through randomly chosen questions across a variety of interesting topics. You get three attempts to guess per question. Say "another hint" if you need it. Alexa will reveal the answer to an incorrectly answered 'easy' or 'junior' level question. Note for Amazon FreeTime Unlimited Subscribers If you are an Amazon FreeTime Unlimited subscriber, you get Tournament mode (play four rounds, with five categories to choose from) and Multiplayer mode (with Echo Button support) included with your subscription. FreeTime Unlimited is an all-in-one subscription that gives kids access to hundreds of hours of fun and educational content on compatible Echo devices, including ad-free radio stations and playlists, hundreds of Audible books, and a growing list of premium kid’s skills. Plus, kids can enjoy thousands of kid-friendly books, movies, TV shows, educational apps, and games on compatible Fire, Android, iOS and Kindle devices at no additional cost.

From the wikipedia page: Ghost is a written or spoken word game in which players take turns adding letters to a growing word fragment, trying not to be the one to complete a valid word. Each fragment must be the beginning of a scrabble approved word, where only words longer than three letters count. The player who completes a word loses the round. Start a round by saying "start". Alexa will add letters to the word fragment, and you will have three seconds to respond. If you would like to hear the word fragment again, say "repeat". If you would like to add a letter, say "my letter is" then your letter.

This skill will provide you with random multiplication and division problems that are easy, medium and hard difficulty.  After you have completed the problem, you can ask the skill for the answer to check your work.
This is a 10 question quiz game about testing your knowledge to see if you know some league of legends champions ultimate ability names.
Better watch out for this skill. It will do you a chomp, then a real big frighten.

Brewing Coach is an Alexa skill for the Amazon Echo that talks you through how to brew potions in Minecraft. Simply ask Alexa which potion you wish to brew and she will tell you what you need and how to brew it, the skill has recently been updated for the new potions in 1.13. Brewing recipes include: - Potion of healing - Potion of fire resistance - Potion of regeneration - Potion of strength - Potion of swiftness - Potion of night vision - Potion of water breathing - Potion of leaping - Potion of poison - Potion of weakness - Potion of invisibility - Potion of slow falling - Potion of the turtle master Brewing Coach is not official and is not affiliated with either Mojang or Microsoft.

Parents can play Santa to leave messages for kids.  Kids can listen to messages left by Santa(parents).  If your kids are too smart, they might figure out the way to play Santa.  You can be creative to use this to say things you don't want to say directly to someone.  I want to use this to have some experience of custom skill development and to have real user feedback.

Orange Cloud Learning can help teachers and parents teach children/toddlers via Alexa. As a parent some of us find it hard to teach reputation learning as we also require stimulation (seeing immediate results). The Orange Cloud Learning app can now replace us getting bored/being too busy/not very good ourselves to allow our children to learn at their own pace. Ask Alexa to teach you 2, 5 or 10 times tables, teach you the days of the week. We appreciate all feedback and would love for some ideas on additional leaning requirements.

Funny Alphabet is an adventurous  game that explores interesting themes like space, the ocean and pirates among others.  As each stage is completed a medal is awarded. It is packed with audio effects to keep things both educational and fun. The game remembers where a player is up to, to ensure the content is always fresh and interesting. To start say Alexa Play Funny Alphabet.

This skill provides updates on where Santa is. Keep asking before Christmas Eve and Santa will be in the North Pole doing various jobs. On Christmas Eve, ask Santa Tracker and Alexa will update you where Santa and his sleigh are in the world at that point in time.

Physics Formulae is designed to give you any formulae relating to physics that you may need.  Upon asking for a formula, Alexa will give you a detailed description to help you learn or to jog your memory.  This skill is perfect for secondary school aged students who are just starting to learn the fundamentals of physics. This skill features a constantly expanding database of known formulae and we are constantly looking to expand further. Feel free to suggest formulae that should be added in later updates!
This skill gives kids the opportunity to explore and educate them selves about the fishes of the oceans

Would you like to learn some new animals, or just be tested on how many you already know? Well, this is the educational game for you. Open up your Alexa app or take a look at your Echo Show, because you'll need to see the wonderful animal pictures Alexa will send you. Once you see an animal you know, and Alexa asks what it is, just respond "It's a fox!" for example. If you don't know, just say "I don't know," "not sure," or something similar. The more specific you are, the more points you'll receive! For example, "red fox" earns more points than "fox" for the red fox picture. Prepare yourself for a bonus round! You'll have to guess an animal based on only the sound it makes! Have fun, and learn a lot! New animals will be added continually, so if you think you have all the current animals mastered, come back later!
Reads out one random selection of children's rhyme out of a selection of four rhymes. The four rhymes are Humpty Dumpty, Ba Ba black sheep, Twinkle twinkle little star and Little Jack Horner.

Old MacDonald's farm -  Awesome fun experience and learning for kids. The skill takes the kids through different farm animals from old macdonald's farm like cow, sheep, pig hen etc., It provide useful information and interesting facts about animals with amazing sound effects.. You also play different interesting games like pickaboo, counting game and letter game. The skill provides points in terms of rewards to kids to make it more interesting. Instructions: ---------------- alexa open old macdonald farm visit farm play games

Meet the moopeez: These lovely creatures are on a mission to help us recycle more.  In the US, we recycle only 30% of the waste while in France, only 15% get recycled.  This Alexa skill is a simple game based on our larger plan for Moopeez (you can find out more at www.moopeez.com) Help us improve the game:  We know that not every country has the same colors when it comes to their recycling bins so drop us a line so we can make it a better, more interactive experience for everyone.

Take your child on a trip to the Memory Zoo! You will be presented with a sequence of animals and asked to recall that sequence and repeat it back to Alexa. With each correct response, the task will become more challenging. This skill provides both audio-only and display-enhanced experiences.  Whatever device you have, it's Zoo Time!
Have fun counting animals in your group Add cats, dogs and other animals to your group.

An interactive way to learn while having fun. The game will ask different types of maths questions helping the kids to develop the mental ability to do quick arithmetics, simple day to day ratios and more. Choose to be a Fictional character, and earn diamonds, rubies, magic wands, and much more as you answer. - Learn while you play - Unlocks the power of mind compute - Score and be the topper among your friends - Advance your level to make the questions more complex and to explore new types of questions - All the answers across any level will only be a whole number What you can ask: - 'Start number games': Start the game - 'Level 2 as Captain in number games': Start the game directly in Level 2 as Captain - 'Open number games and play as Sofia': Starts the game as Sofia - 'Open number games and level three': Starts the game in Level 3 - 'Play level five as King in number games': Starts the game as King and in Level 5 - 'How do I Rank in number games': Tells your score and your position among other kids - 'Continue in number games': To continue your previous game - 'Help in number games': Detailed info about this skill In the Companion App: - Question card - Detailed help card about every question - Scorecard and your position among the toppers - Much more... for every interaction you do during the game... Question Types in each Level: - Level 1: Addition, Subtraction, Place value - Level 2: Multiplication, Odd/Even, Largest/Smallest (+ Level 1 questions) - Level 3: Fractions (Identify NR or DR), Find next in Sequence (+ Level 2 questions) - Level 4: Word problems on basic operations - Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication and Division (+ Level 3 questions) - Level 5: Square root, Average of numbers (+ Level 4 questions) - Level 6: Duration, Clock corrections (+ Level 5 questions) - Level 7: Percentage (+ Level 6 questions) - Level 8: Weights (+ Level 7 questions) - Level 9: Factors (+ Level 8 questions) - Level 10: All the above but the answers are more complex Scoring: - Earn your precious items based on the level's difficulty and question type - Sometimes too many wrong answers could cost you your precious items Tricks: - While playing, if you say 'ask questions from level ten only': You will get questions from level 10 only but without actually changing your level(difficulty). You can use this to explore different questions without increasing the difficulty - Play and find more... Enjoy while learning!!

This is a conversational Game skill, in which the players must track the art thief. The game starts by reading out a mission statement, in which an expensive museum artifact goes missing. The thief then travels from city to city, trying to sell the art work. The player must follow the thief, based on the clues given by the local police. If the player goes to the wrong city several times, the thief will sell the artifact in the black market and then it becomes untraceable (i.e. Game lost). So, to win the game, the player has to arrive at the right city, at the right time. A good knowledge on cities, countries and continents is needed to win the game. The player (i.e. Interpol agent) can go through a training phase to learn these location before taking up a mission. There are six ranks in the game, as the player solves more and more missions, the rank goes up. The player can play either by difficulty – Easy, Medium or Hard. Or by World Zones – East, Central and West. Context sensitive help is available at all stages of the game. Credits:  Sound effects from https://www.zapsplat.com Music from Bensound.com
Stay up to date with the latest Santa gossip and news! The Santa News skill will keep you up to date on the goings on of your favorite jolly old elf.

Listen to the letter song to improve your phonics.  Test your phonics skills with our quiz.  Great for kids to have fun and learn. Try saying "Alexa ask letter head to play the letter song"... Try saying "Alexa ask letter head to start a quiz game"... Your kids will love it.

This skill enables anyone to learn multiplication facts in a fun and engaging way. It is fairly simple all you need to tell Alexa is up to which number you wish to practice the multiplication facts. For example, if you tell Alexa you want to practice up to 4, she will give you problems of multiplying 1s, 2s, 3s, and 4s, with the numbers 1 through 12. Works great with the Echo Show.

Alphabet Practice lets your child practice the alphabet from A to Z. On easy mode the skill prompts your child to repeat the letter of the alphabet. In medium mode it expects the child to indicate what the next letter of the alphabet is. In hard mode, it randomly asks for the letter that comes before or after the specified letter. In extreme mode, it asks the child what letter is at the indicated position of the alphabet. When not in a game, you can also ask Alphabet Practice to recite the alphabet in a number of different speeds. To hear the alphabet quickly say 'Alexa, ask Alphabet Practice to say the alphabet quickly'.  To hear the alphabet at normal speed, say 'Alexa, ask Alphabet Practice to say the alphabet'. If you want your child to repeat the letters of the alphabet, you can say 'Alexa, ask Alphabet Practice to say the alphabet slowly'. To have Alexa say the alphabet even more slowly say 'Alexa, ask Alphabet Practice to say the alphabet very slowly'.
A wonderful skill which teaches you amazing unknown facts about THE AMAZING NATURE

Are you up for the Capital Challenge?  Test your knowledge of the 50 US states and their capitals while learning fun facts at the same time.  Alexa can quiz you by providing the name of the capital city and you have to name the state or she can give you the name of the state and you tell her the name of its capital.  Feeling really confident?  Change it up by alternating between the two.  Make sure to check out the Alexa companion app for cards containing interesting facts for each state as you progress.  Let the games begin! Icon Designed by iconicbestiary / Freepik

If you are feeling a little down, looking for something  to cheer you up, say "ask/open flatter-me", to your Alexa Echo. Or maybe you're in need of a little laugh, ask Alexa by saying "Alexa open Flatter me", you will cracked up by the slightly over-the-top flattery. Whatever the case, if you're in the mood for some smooth flattery, the flatter-me skill should do the trick.

"This Christmas you won't need to send a letter to get your messages to Santa, our new Amazon Echo skill lets your talk directly with his head elf any time, day or night.  For example, say, ""Alexa, tell Head Elf that Charlie has been naughty"" and you'll receive a message back from Santa HQ.  If you say, ""Alexa, tell Head Elf that Sam has been good."", congratulations may be in store. "

Test your knowledge of the human body by taking our fun human body quiz. The human body is an amazing structure which contains a wide range of complex parts and processes. Learn more about the anatomy of the human body as well as parts such as the heart, bones, eyes, skin, muscles, skeleton, ears and nose. Answer all questions and repeat the game. skill_description: The skill provides fun and engaging stories and tales around the world for children of all ages with interesting facts about the place. Instructions: Alexa open amazing world tales what about a story from india tell me a fact

Now you can get great Christmas craft ideas that are fun for the whole family! Just ask Alexa to open Crafty Christmas and she will give you a quick and easy craft idea that is perfect for the holidays. New crafts are added frequently so check back often to get inspired.

Hey kids! Christmas Cheer is a fun skill that gives you a Christmas joke, or "cheer", of the day. This skill is perfect for getting you ready for the holidays. Want a good laugh? Simply say, "tell me a cheer", to start.  Christmas Cheer is most suitable for children ages 13 and younger. Ho Ho Ho. Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays, everyone!
Camels aren't the only mammals with humps. See if you know all these bits of trivia about your favorite megaptera novaeangliae!
It's like you are in Santa's Grotto!  Ask for a present and hopefully get the answer you are hoping for.
See if Alexa can guess your secret number by giving hints of 'Too High' or 'Too Low'!  Alexa can also think of her own secret number for you to guess!

This is a short game you can play against Alexa. There is a table with a random number of chips. Your objective is to not pick up the last chip. However, there's a catch! You and Alexa alternate turns, only being able to pick up 1, 2, or 3 chips per turn. The game is over when the loser picks up the final chip on the table. Now with 3 difficulty modes! Challenge Alexa on easy, medium, or hard. Easy and medium can be consistently beaten, but the AI on hard mode is much more clever. Will you be the first person to beat Alexa on hard difficulty? Note: To skip the welcome instructions in the skill, just interrupt by saying "Alexa", followed by the difficulty you would like to play.

Learn the alphabet letter by letter including examples with corresponding audio samples. Or start counting with Alexa. Alexa will ask you a bunch of questions and you have to give her the right answer.  Be the number one in the world ranking! In order to start learning the alphabet say: "abc" To start the counting game say: "counting" If you have any questions regarding the skill say: "help" And please do not hesitate to contact us in case you have any problems: tobi@oredein.com Enjoy! Hint: Logo from freepik (www.flaticon.com)
Want to know what Santa is doing right now? Of course you do! Alexa can speak to Santa's Elves for you. Just ask Santa'a Elves for an update and they'll tell you what he is doing.

This first story, called 'Jemima and the Magic Spell Book', has two chapters. To listen to the story as written just say; 'Alexa, Open Jemima The Magic Cat'. and then, when you are asked what you want to do, say something like... 'Play Chapter One', or 'Read Chapter two'. Alternatively, you can start by saying something like 'Alexa, ask Jemima The Magic Cat to read chapter two. If, however, you wish to change the name of the witch; or the name of Jemima's best friend; or the geographical region used in the story the the easiest way to do this is to open the skill by saying... 'Alexa, open Jemima the Magic Cat'  Then, when you are asked what you want to do, say something like ...      Set the name of the witch to Susan orSet the name of the best friend to Harry or  Set the region to New Hampshire Then when you play a chapter your chosen names and region will appear in the story. When you want to stop just say Stop or Finish. By the way,:Several more 'Jemima The Magic Cat' stories are in the pipeline so this story book will grow with time. The number of characters, and other items, that  can be changed is also destined to grow.

Santa Finder will update you with what activity Santa Claus is doing every day in December until Christmas Eve. On Christmas Eve, Santa Finder will tell you where Santa Claus is in the world delivering presents. Find out where he is at and if he is close by. Simply ask Santa Finder where is Santa?

Railroad Math is a math challenge which tests your elementary math skills, including addition, subtraction and multiplication. This will help kids sharpen their math skills in a more challenging and engaging way. Difficulty will increase automatically as you answer correctly. The harder the question, the more points you get for answering it correctly. Scores are tracked by session. Here are the things you can say, once you initialize the skill: * Repeat/Say Again - To hear the question again * Help - To get detailed instructions * Score - To get the current score

Guess the Animal Noise is a fun and educational game that your family will have fun playing.  Each question provides an audio clip of the animal making their typical sound.  You listen for the noise and guess the animal that makes that noise.  Animal noises are played, guess the most correct to win.  More animals will be added over time.

Hello. Learn capitals and countries with this skill set. A wide range of countries are discussed here and it can be very informative. The interaction is pretty straight-forward. Just start by saying 'Alexa ask guess the country a question'. Answer the question with phrases like, 'Is it ___?'. The game can be played iteratively at ease. Let your adventurous journey begin!
Want to know what the name of your Elf On The Shelf is? Simply ask Elf On The Shelf Name and we will tell you.

Calculate 24 is a math puzzle game. For each question, I will give you 4 numbers and your goal is to calculate these numbers and come out a final result of 24. -You have to use each number one time; -You can use operation like plus, minus, times and divide; The game has 2 modes. You can improve your skill in Practice game. Say tell me the answer and I will tell you the answer. In challenge game, you need to give right answers to 3 questions. Say skip if you don't want to be stuck at a question. You can skip up to 3 question in a challenge game. You compete with others for who can finish 3 questions with the shortest time.
Alexa has a direct line to the North Pole and knows when Santa will be paying a visit. Find out how long until he arrives!

Do you want to know where Santa is right now?  Then this skill is for you!  He might be fixing his sleigh, feeding the reindeer, or updating his list of who is naughty or nice! If you say "Alexa, Ask Santa Tracker for Santa", the skill will respond with a bit of information on what Santa is doing right now.   How does the skill work?  A highly talented team of informant elves lives with Santa at the North Pole and provides us the information.  Ever since Santa went missing a few years ago, the elves have planted satellite GPS sensors in his Santa's clothes, on his sleigh, and in the reindeer collars to make sure that he doesn't get lost again.   At the North Pole, pretty much everyone but Santa knows that Santa is being tracked (even Mrs. Claus) but nobody tells him because they think it will make him nervous. If you need more help, you can just say "Alexa, Start Santa Tracker" and the skill will guide you thru how to use the skill. Many kids grow up with a fascination for dinosaurs (in other words, dinos) referring to the many great and massive creatures that roamed our planet 65 million years ago. Feed your child's imagination and knowledge with this amazing skill, where Alexa will provide a fact or idea about dinosaurs that you probably may not have known before. Dive in, and have fun with this interesting and educational skill from Alexa!

A fun and educational game for all ages! Alexa will ask you for 4-10 words and then use them to generate a fun story. Think fast and speak clearly! If you take too long or stutter Alexa might mishear you and include her own goofy word. Unlike Mad Libs and other traditional pen & paper games, Storymaker can remember your choices and use them multiple times in the same story. Plus, you can spend more time thinking about funny ideas and less fretting over articles and plurals - Storymaker will automatically make your word fit the story! With new and original stories published all the time, Storymaker can provide hours of family fun while also teaching kids or English language learners parts of speech and helping their vocabulary grow. Update: Thanks for your feedback! We've added a bunch of new stories to play through and the skill now has over 30 fun stories! We'll be writing new ones every month too.

Learn colors creates a differentiator by supporting the beginners and advanced kids in learning colors. Kids may benefit from playing the game again by increase in speed and confidence with colors. Earth Kids is a fun filled game which aims to achieve 2 great things at the same time. When kids are learning to write letters, they quickly start asking how to spell words, so they can write them down.  It takes kids at this stage a lot of time and concentration to write each letter, so a standard spelling skill speaks the letters too fast for them.   Kid Spell can spell words one letter at a time, allowing the child to ask for the next letter (and repeat it), so that they can write them down at their own pace.  The skill also displays a fun picture of each letter to Echo Show devices and to  the Alexa companion app.  This helps the child remember how to write each letter. Kid Spell leverages the WebPurify Profanity Filter API to filter all word requests for profanity in order to avoid spelling inappropriate words for kids. Kid Spell is simple to use.  To get started say, "Alexa, ask Kid Spell to spell dog."  The skill will speak the first letter - D.  To hear the next letter, say "Alexa, ask Kid Spell for the next letter."  Continue asking for the next letter until the end of the word.  To repeat a letter, say, "Alexa, ask Kid Spell to repeat."

I dedicate this to my four year old son, who finds anything poop related to be the most funny thing in the world.  He has just gotten old enough to converse with Alexa, but I found most skills to be overly complex for a 3-4 year old.  If your kid loves poop, get ready for hours... well, let's hope for at least minutes, of entertainment.

Counting to 20 is a popular game played between two people.  The goal of the game is to be the first one to say "20". Each player can say one, two, or three numbers in the counting order per turn. Each player must start with the number after the last one that the other player said. For example, the first person can say "1", or "1, 2", or "1, 2, 3." If the first person says "1, 2", then the second person could say "3" or "3, 4", or "3, 4, 5". Whoever says "20" is the winner.

We as humans are delightful creatures until we're not. Ideally kids using this skill will learn the techniques so well that eventually they can calm themselves down without the help of Alexa.  Ideally adults using this skill will also find it helpful, while appreciating its playful nature. We value feedback and suggestions which can be sent to lesley@forjackandjill.com. Disclaimer: this skill is a prank skill for entertainment purposes only and does not actually tell you whether anything is true or false. Is It True? lets you ask any True/False question and get an answer! You control the answer in the way you phrase your question. If you ask a question in the form "Is it true that...?", the skill will respond saying that it is true. If, however, you ask a question in the form "Is it really true that...?", the skill will respond saying it is false. Other natural phrasings can work, but the presence of the word "really" will always be what makes the answer no instead of yes. For your friends (or your children) who don't know the trick, this will seem like independent confirmation of your opinion.
