For example, John Smith would be "Joodlehn Smoodleth." It's hilarious to hear what she comes up with! Entertain for hours! Good fun for all ages. If you don't want to come up with a name yourself, simply ask Alexa to oodle a random superhero. After you say 'Alexa, open oodle,' you will be asked 'who should I oodle?' You can respond with phrases such as these: Ralph John George Smith the animal bear the state of Washington a random superhero Have fun!

Answer as many multiplication questions from the 1 - 12 times table. For every question you get right, you get a point. You can always stop the game or start a new one at any time. Good luck. This is a great way to learn your multiplication and have fun doing so.

The "Subtraction Spot Quiz" helps adults and seniors to test subtraction skills by asking five basic questions, such as :  What is "9 minus 5” , thus providing good cognitive workout.  For example, a user can say "Alexa, Open Subtraction Quiz" to start the quiz. In case, if user unable to find the question they can say "repeat"  to repeat the same question. Spot Quizzes helps your brain by giving a good cognitive workout on a regular basis which may help reduce the risk for developing types of dementia, including Alzheimer's in seniors. As per research, mental stimulation helps to reduce forgetfulness, memory loss, and slowed reasoning or thinking skills in the elderly demographics.   You may also want to enable similar 'Spot Quiz' skills, viz. 1) Addition Spot Quiz 2) Multiplication Spot Quiz 3) Division Spot Quiz     For suggestions and feedback, please reach us at alexa@nectarspot.com

Get the kids involved and see how well they do in their multiplication times tables. Mental Maths will test how well they know their multiplications up to the 12 times tables by default. This is great if you just want them to brush up on mental arithmetic or just to get the brain stimulated! Just  ask Alexa to open 'Mental Maths" and it will test you on your times tables. The skill will give you the result of your test after 12 randomly selected questions. If you don't know the answer on a question, you  can just say "pass" or "don't know" Remember to speak clearly when answering the questions. MULTIPLE UPDATES: ----------------------------------------------------- Has the ability to set difficulty, E.g. say: ----->   'Alexa, ask Mental Maths to set difficulty to Hard'. The difficulty levels are  - Easy - up to 8  - Medium - up to 12  - Hard - up to 16  - Very Hard - up to 20 By default Medium (up to 12 is selected) ----------------------------------------------------- Has the ability to set question type, E.g. say: ----->   'Alexa, tell Mental Maths to ask me division questions'. The question types are Multiplication, Division, Addition, Subtraction and Random By default Multiplication is selected  ----------------------------------------------------- Has the ability to set the number of questions to be asked, E.g. say: ----->    'Alexa, tell Mental Maths to set number of questions to 10'. By default number of questions asked is 12 ----------------------------------------------------- Has Teach Mode to learn a specific number (Multiplactions) E.g. say: ----->   'Alexa, tell Mental Maths to teach me the 9 times tables ----------------------------------------------------- Has Test or Practice Mode to practice a specific number E.g. say: ----->   'Alexa, tell Mental Maths to test me  on the 9 times tables ----------------------------------------------------- Has the ability to track progress E.g. say: ----->   'Alexa, tell Mental Maths to send my report'. Read the stats of your scores by viewing the Alexa app, and be sure to check out the unique link showing your scores Watch your child improve their maths by seeing the stats in the provided link in the Alexa App.

The "Multiplication Spot Quiz" may help adults and seniors to test multiplication skills by asking five basic questions, such as :  what is " 9 * 5” thus providing good cognitive workout.  In case, if user unable to find the question they can say "repeat"  to repeat the same question. Spot Quizzes helps your brain by giving a good cognitive workout on a regular basis which may help reduce the risk for developing types of dementia, including Alzheimer's in seniors. As per research, mental stimulation helps to reduce forgetfulness, memory loss, and slowed reasoning or thinking skills in the elderly demographics.   You may also want to enable similar 'Spot Quiz' skills, viz. 1) Addition Spot Quiz 2) Subtraction Spot Quiz 3) Division Spot Quiz     For suggestions and feedback, please reach us at alexa@nectarspot.com

Solving word problems allow children to apply math concepts to solve real world problems. With this skill, Alexa can help your child practice solving word problems and in the process learn and improve math problem solving skills. Word problems are an important tool for children to relate math to real world problems, and often bring together various math concepts into one problem. It helps your child learn to comprehend the problem when spoken, think visually and use creativity to solve the word problems. Once you ask Alexa - Word Problems skill to ask a word problem, she can keep asking different problems till you choose to stop. You can ask her to repeat the question anytime, ask for the correct answer or ask for a different question. You can also ask Alexa the score, when she will tell you how many questions were correctly answered out of all she has asked in the current interaction.

This skill has over fifty classic nursery rhymes from Old Mother Goose published way back in 1869. Hear the full versions of familiar rhymes like Little Bo Peep as well as lesser known rhymes like The Little Black Dog. Alexa can either recite a specific rhyme or a random one. Currently available: patty cake peas pudding willie boy jack and jill cross patch little jack horner to market rock a bye bonny lass mary had a pretty bird a donkey walks on four legs one a penny pussy cat dance little baby simple simon little girl little girl goosey goosey gander there was an old woman hickety pickety little boy blue humpty dumpty three little kittens little bo peep jack be nimble rub a dub dub the little black dog boys and girls daffy down dilly a duck and a drake matthew mark luke and john see saw mary mary hop away this little piggy once i saw a little bird tom, tom the pipers son thirty days hath september there were two blackbirds the queen of hearts molly and i when little fred went to bed peter peter pumpkin eater hey diddle diddle hickory dickory dock bah bah black sheep cock a doodle doo little miss muffet one two buckle my shoe little betty blue there was a crooked man three blind mice sing a song of sixpence robin the bobbin as i was going along

This skill allows the user to ask for a Maths question. Once a question has been asked the use will then respond with the answer. If the answer is correct or incorrect the user will be told. If incorrect the user can answer again with the correct number. To get another question, the used will ask for another question. The type of question and the numbers involved are random. To get started say "Alexa ask Maths Game to ask me a question". Alexa will then ask you a Maths question. Say the answer as a number only. For example "five". For another question, say "Ask me a question". Alternatively, say "Alexa ask Maths Game to ask me an easy question". Alexa will then ask you an easy Maths question. Say the answer as a number only. For example "five".

This is a kids skill app. This is for all above 6+. Math is used everywhere from shopping to school. Our normal skill include few basic Mathematical skill kids would learn in their schools. Our app also include a fun new skill call Star Math Facts. Few questions may be hard to solve. That's why we introduced star Math Facts that tells a easier more efficient way to solve a hard problem. At the end you will hear Alexa saying to go to web. You will be seeing a visual representation of what Alexa told you in action. Star Math facts will be updated every week.

The Bedtime Game helps children know if it's time for bed by asking simple yes or no questions. The responses will ultimately lead to the decision of whether it's bedtime or not. Hint: It's usually bedtime. ;)

Have Alexa tell you what noises various animals make. Great for parents to use with their kids, you can ask Alexa what noise an animal makes as part of a game or if you're just bored of making the animal noises yourself! Fun for anyone who wants to hear Alexa make animal noises :-D Cows say 'moo' Sheep say 'baa'

Have you ever wanted to go back in time and study dinosaurs? What were the differences between them?  Some were carnivores and some were herbivores. Some were big and some were huge. Answer a few simple questions, and this skill will pick which dinosaur most suits you! To learn more about these dinosaurs, just say "Can you tell me more" after the sorting process is complete, and a brief description will be read about the specific species.
In-depth information and interesting quick facts about Space. This skill covers a range of space facts suitable for educating children and adults alike to the wonders of space and our solar system.

Word Buddy helps kids learn the plural form of words and the group name for animals. Simply start Word Buddy and ask it: what do you call more than one tooth? Or what is the plural of fox? If you want to know the name of animal group, ask Word Buddy: what do you call a group of ducks (or other animal)?

My ABC is a fun, simple, and easy-to-use skill that will jump-start learning the English alphabet and beginner words. To make it interesting and engaging, there are animal sounds and rhymes/songs to sing along and learn. Things you can do with the skill: The “ALPHABET” feature, as the name suggests, teaches A to Z with a pace that is easy to follow. The 'Alexa, repeat' option can be used at any point to replay.   The “WORD” feature lists multiple sets of common words, animal and bird names along with the sounds they make. The “SONG" feature will play the rhymes. To know the list of songs/rhymes, say “Alexa, list songs”. The “SPELLING" feature will spell the word. Just say “Alexa, spell world”. The skill is simple and responsive. You can switch between Alphabet, Songs and Word anytime by just saying “Alexa, alphabet”, “Alexa, song" or “Alexa, word” to initiate the respective feature.  The friendly helper invoked by saying “Alexa, help” will provide details about the skill and its capabilities.  Happy listening and happy learning!
Let Alexa help you learn and memorize the Girl Scout Law & Promise at your convenience. You'll have them both memorized in no time!
Teach [young] folks what animals say. Just ask Alexa, "What does a cow say?" and she will answer "Moo!". Try other animals, too.

Have Alexa make animal sounds with this funny app. Simply start by saying, "Alexa, ask Animal Sounds what sound does the dog make?" Choose from these variety of these animals: chicken cow horse pig goat sheep cat dog

This is a simple educational math game: two player take turns to count from 1 to 30, at each turn,  a player can only count one or two numbers consecutively. Whoever reaches 30 wins. Game instruction is included in the skill
Simple Kindergarden Math practice. At this point I have included single digit addition. I will add as my kid grows up ;)
You will be asked five questions on Indian geography. Please answer by giving the number of the correct answer. Your score will be announced after each answer. Have fun!!

This skill is for all ages. It is sure to keep even the brightest young minds entertained and challenged. Family Trivia is a voice interactive game in which questions are asked and two possible answers are given. Please respond with the number of the correct answer and this skill will let you know if you are correct and your running score. New and improved user interface for Echo Show and Echo Spot. Check it out! Bring your friends and family along with you and see see who can get the higher score!
Quadratic Formula solver takes the three coefficients given by the user in alphabetical order, and uses the numbers to calculate the two solutions for the quadratic formula.

With Multiplication Test, you can improve your multiplication and try to get faster each time! You can either choose to be tested on a specific multiplication table, or to have a random test of 20 mixed multiplication questions. At the end of your test, you will be told how many questions you answered correctly, how many you answered incorrectly, as well as how long you took to complete the test!
We always need foods rich in calcium, but never have the time to look them up! Now, just ask Alexa. From the people who brought you the iron rich foods app, introducing: calcium rich foods!
Gives general facts about Ms Dhoni a famous Indian cricketer. This helps people to get to know more about Ms Dhoni.
Have you ever wondered where Winnie the Pooh was based or what Christopher Robin really thinks of him? Winnie the Pooh Facts reveals all!

Play the classic kid's game of Mother May I with Alexa!  Start up a game by simply saying "Alexa, play Mother May I".  Once the game is set up, each player takes turns asking 'Mother' if they can take a number of steps.  Be careful though, the larger the number of steps, the less likely Mother will approve!

This skill is a trivia skill to test how well you know Disney's Moana. Just say "Start Moana Trivia" to start a multi-question quiz.  Please Note: Moana Trivia is in no way affiliated with The Walt Disney Company, Disney World, Disneyland, or any of its subsidiaries.
It's almost Christmas, so get elf names for you and your whole family. Just ask for an elf name, and get ready for something silly..

Simple Math Facts will ask you 5 simple addition questions.  The numbers are random between 0 and 12.  The skill will tell you if you answered correctly or not.  At the end of the 5 questions it will give you the number of questions you answered correctly.

When you ask Alexa to call Santa it plays a nice message recording that seems to be making a call to Santa. You will get his voicemail, you can then pretend to leave a message. The kids will love it.  Special Notes: If you pretend to leave a voicemail it is not recording, and is never saved by us. It's just for fun.
Ask Alexa for a phone fact and it will give you one randomly.

This skill encourages childs to brush their teeth.  Music makes everything easier - even brushing your teeth. The skill should make brushing teeth fun.  The skill interacts and asks whether the toothbrush is already held in the hand. Afterwards a song is played. On devices with display you can choose it directly. During playback, the child should brush its teeth. Which commands are available? - "Help"  - "Overview" - Select a song by name or number: "little circles" or "song one" (currently there is only one song available)  - Answers like "yes" or "no".  Please leave a comment at the Alexa Skill Store! Thank you!

Alexa is designated Simon.  Alexa enable "Simon Says Game" enables the skill. Alexa start "Simon says game" starts the game. Game instructions: Simon tells players what they must do. However, the players must only obey commands that begin with the words "Simon Says." If Simon says, "Simon says touch your head," then players must touch their head. But, if Simon simply says, "jump," without first saying "Simon says," players must not jump. Those that do jump are out. Objective Follow directions from Simon and stay in the game for as long as possible! The last player standing wins.

Want to know how long it is until Christmas? Cant contain your excitement? Then worry no more, just tell Alexa to ask Santa Claus how many days until Christmas and then you can begin counting down until the big day!

skill_name: Mindful States - facts about US states
skill_description: Created by a father and daughter team, this skill is a great way to learn and practice a variety of facts about US states. We started with the states and capitals to help her study for her 4th grade states & capitals quiz, and it was so much fun that we kept adding more facts!! She did all of the research, and she even wrote most of the code. We hope you have as much fun using it as we did creating it! Here are the types of facts you can ask about: State Capital State Flower State Motto State Bird State Grass State Rose State Rock State Nickname State Abbreviation Coordinates Timezone Latitude Longitude Region Population Governor Lt. Governor What do you call someone from the state Date the state joined the union Order in which the state was admitted Territory the state originally belonged to What is next to the state --You can even say "I'd like a random state fact" and see what Alexa offers up! Provided by Mindful Gaming, Inc. (c) 2017

Alexa will ask you 5 random multiplication questions from the 0 to 12 times tables.  After each answer, Alexa will tell you if you answered correctly.  After the final question, Alexa will tell you your score out of 5.  If you tell Alexa to stop you won't get a score out of 5.

Skip Count is a simple and interactive Alexa skill aimed at making learning to skip count fun. Skill helps reinforce the concept of counting from 1 to 100 and also count in increments. Safe and Suitable for children and adults of any age. No personal information collected by the skill.
Easy math, is a fun way to test elementary addition skills. More skills will be added soon

This Skill will recite the poem "Jabberwocky" written by Lewis Carroll around 1855. It was published in his classic novel "Through the Looking-Glass, and What Alice Found There". The poem is an example of nonsense verse.
This skill tests how well you know the alphabet. You can play a short game to give the location of a letter in the alphabet. Example: What is the location of D? You would reply " D is fourth"
A few chemistry facts that you can use to impress your friends!

Tell Alexa "Open Activity Book" and Alexa will tell give you something to do. This skill selects from thousands of activities appropriate for all ages. If the first result doesn't sound good to you, just ask again.

MenuBuddy reads the lunch menus for West Hartford CT public schools and then can speak them when commanded to. Menu information is available on a daily basis as well as a weekly basis. We will update the skill every month with the next month’s menu.

Micki My teaches you a little ditty made famous by the Three Stooges, with help from Professor Moe and others along the way.  Make a request using only a consonant from the alphabet (vs a vowel) lest you be scolded. Open Micki My by saying things like "Open Micki My" or "Load Micki My".  Make a request by saying things like "Do Micki My for the letter D" or "Do Micki My D".  You can both open the app and make a request in one-shot by saying things like "Open Micki My for the letter D".

It's the classic Hot Potato game--gather the kids, grab a potato-esque object, and start playing! The kids pass the "potato" from person to person while the music plays, and whoever is holding the potato when the music stops is out. Then play another round by asking Alexa again ("Alexa, play Hot Potato") and keep going until there's only one person left! This can also be used for Pass the Parcel, Musical Chairs, or any other game where someone is caught by a sudden stop of the music.

Wallace's Kids makes animal sounds.  You can ask Wallace's Kids  to speak an animal sound and they will answer you back.  Sometimes, Wallace Kids had helpers and they added different animal sounds so try a second time and you may get a different sound or one from a different person. For example, say "Alexa ask Wallace's Kids what does a cat say? You can also ask Wallace's Kids to list all the animals they know the sounds of.  Just say, "Alexa ask Wallace's Kids what animal sounds can you say?"
Haven't you always been intrigued by the majestic creature known as the seahorse? Now you can learn all about seahorses from your Amazon Echo with this Alexa Skill.

It is an interactive algebra training game. It randomly generates addition,subtraction, multiplication or division questions and ask users to give the answer. The maximum factor number involved in addition and subtraction is 99. And the maximum factor number involved in multiplication and division is 20. It is aimed for primary school algebra training.

This skill asks the player a series of basic arithmetic math card questions; addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. It picks random numbers between 0 and 9 for the questions.  Just say the answer.  For example:  Alexa says, "What is 9 + 9?" You answer, "18" Alexa says, “Correct, what is…” While practicing, you can also say things like: “I don’t know” “I want to do [addition, subtraction multiplication, division, or random]” “Repeat” “Stop”
Mathematical Trivia. Solve divisions, multiplications, sums and subtractions in your mind, and improve your mental calculation skills.
Play rock paper scissors with Alexa!

"Times Tables", ask you multiplication questions. You can set the amount of questions you'd like to be asked. Alexa ask Times Tables to give me ten questions You can also choose the difficulties of the questions. Alexa ask Times Tables for hard questions Very Easy up to 4 * 4 Easy up to 8 * 8  Medium up to 12 * 12, this is the default Hard up to 16 * 16 Very Hard up to 20 * 20
This skill gives you random nursery rhymes. You can also ask for a rhyme by title. Included are children's classics such as Jack and Jill, Humpty Dumpty, and This Little Piggy.

Let Alexa solve your family's movie night woes. Tell Alexa your families favorite movies and have her pick at random one of those awesome movies you always want to watch again.  In my house, we had a candy jar filled with paper scraps with names of  movies we love for us and the kids. On a movie night, one of my three kids would pick a movie title from the jar to watch. Of course, they would never agree, because Ryan chose or because Meg chose. Good news is we can let Alexa pick! Just start the skill and ask "What movie should I  watch?". Problem solved since Alexa chose !  The skill is fun and can be funny but most of all it stops your kids from bickering and allows you to enjoy a fun loving family movie night !  Psst, you can really use this skill for any movies you may want to watch just tell Alexa what to add and "Family Movie Roulette" will pick.

A simple trivia game to test your knowledge about Hello Kitty. Start the game by saying "Alexa Start Kitty Trivia". The trivia will give you multiple choice answers. Reply with the number of the correct answer. E.g. Alexa: "What is the color of Hello Kitty's hair bow? 1 : Red, 2: Pink,  3: Blue, 4: Yellow" User: "1" Alexa: "Correct. Your score is 2" Note: This skill is not sponsored or endorsed by Hello Kitty. It is an unofficial (fan) version.

Musical chairs is a game where a number of chairs, one fewer than the number of players, are arranged facing outward with the players standing in a circle just outside the chairs. Ask Alexa to play Musical Chairs and start in walking around the chairs. When the music stops each player attempts to sit down in one of the chairs. The player who is left without a chair is eliminated from the game. One chair is then removed/eliminated to ensure that there will always be one fewer chair than there are players.

Kids often nag for screen time and parents always ask the same sorts of questions to make sure other necessary tasks have been accomplished first.  Now Alexa can take care of that same rote, frequently negative interaction.  Just say, "Alexa, ask Nanny State if I can have screen time."
Challenge yourself with some simple addition.

I made this program as a way to practice enunciating individual letters and also have fun spelling out words.  One letter at a time, tell Alexa what letters you want.  For example, "Give me an S." or simply, "an S."  She will remember them in the order you say them.  When you are done asking for letters, Alexa will say the word you spelled out when you ask, "What does that spell?"  I hope you find this skill useful and have fun with it.

Math Dog is your personal math tutor, giving you math problems to solve with increasing difficulty as you master each level.  Questions start with basic addition, and progress up to include subtraction, multiplication and division.

To use Times Table, try saying... Alexa, Open Times Table Alexa says times table math problem and you need to say the correct answer. For example, Alexa says "six times three". The correct response is "eighteen". You get three chances to give the correct answer for each math problem. The game continues until you stop the game. You can ask for help by saying “help”, get a new math problem by saying “new”, or stop the game by saying “stop” or "cancel" to end your game. If you fail to respond in time, that's ok. Just re-open Times Table and it picks up where you left off.

The Tickle Monster game is designed to reach through the Alexa and into your home for loads of laughs and fun family nights! Just set up a list of participants via the Alexa app (e.g. "Mom", "Dad", "Little Suzie") then ask Tickle Monster who gets tickled next.
Challenge yourself with some simple subtraction.
This app contains a quiz for 25 animal sounds. This will be perfect for children trying to recognize animals voices and interact with Alexa to show their knowledge.

Ask SillyThings to give you something to do and it will give you something funny to act out.  For example, "Act like a fish out of water",   "Act like you just ate a really sour lemon", "Do your most silly dance", "Act like you are standing on hot lava", and many more.  You can take turns asking SillyThings for something to do or, like our family prefers, randomly ask for something in order to bring some smiles to the room. This Skill was developed by a husband, wife and their 7 and 9 year old sons who all like to find a reason to act silly every once in a while.  This was a family project to get the kids exposed to programming and we have a goal to make a skill worthy of at least twenty 5 star ratings.

Welcome to Old MacDonald's farm.  I'm sure you've heard of him and all his noisy animals.  Give this skill the name of an animal and Alexa will tell you what sound it makes by reciting a verse of this classic nursery rhyme. If you give it the name of an animal it hasn't heard of before, it asks you to tell it what sound that animal makes and then continues on with the rhyme. Surprising and entertaining, you never really know what to expect. Here is just a small sampling of the ever-growing list of "farm animals" this skill recognizes: - chick - cow - pig - duck - horse - lamb - rooster - kitten - frog - elephant - banjo Another noisy skill from www.thomptronics.com

This Amazon Skill Set  mission is to educate people of internet who lust for information. To provide easily accessible information we sorted various articles into categories like technology, science, astronomy, interesting facts.

The questions are related to the events, characters and their preferences in the most popular kids TV series "SpongeBob Squarepants". We play this trivia all the time at home and my kids thought it would be a fun idea to play with Alexa!

Alexa will give you a list of numbers.  All you need to do is repeat them, but in reverse order!  Most people can reverse four or five digits.  Some can do six or seven.  See how many you can do?  No fair writing them down!

Alexa will tell an interesting Physics fact for your kids with this skill enabled. You can use it to inspire your kids to learn more about science or encourage them to seek for information about what Alexa has just said but they don't quite understand yet. More relevant facts will be added to the pool of about 70 facts at the moment. Credit: Physics facts were curated and edited from http://www.sciencekids.co.nz/.
A flash card skill for kids to use to practice memorizing subtraction.
Here you can ask about capital city of any country.

Math Tutor can read out the multiplication tables between 1 and 10. For example, you could say "Alexa, ask Math Tutor for 6 times table." Alexa will then read the answer, which is also available to view on the Home page of the Echo App.

Ask Alexa to make the sounds of your favorite animals. She learns new animal sounds all the time and is doing her best to imitate them. Don't be afraid when you hear her roar like a lion. She probably won't eat you. HOW DOES IT WORK? Just ask your Alexa to open the animal sounds skill.  Each time you open the skill we will play a random animal sound and then give you the option to hear another animal sound or to play an animal sound guessing game. You can say… - Alexa, open Animal Sounds - Alexa, tell Animal Sounds to play a guessing game - Alexa, ask Animal Sounds to imitate any animal - Alexa, tell Animal Sounds imitate a Lion - Alexa, ask Animal Sounds what animals sounds can you make Here are a few you should try: baboon, bear, bobcat, cat, cow, coyote, hippopotamus, lemur, lion, spider, monkey, spider monkey, rooster, and many more. This skill is made for kids and never collects any personal data.  If you haven't enabled kid skills on your Amazon account, a parent or guardian will be prompted provided permission to use kid skills when enabling this skill.     WHO BUILT THIS SKILL? This skill was developed by RAIN's voice innovation team.  RAIN helps brands innovate with voice at the intersection of marketing and technology.

Kids love playing The Name Game with Alexa. For example, just say “Alexa, open The Name Game and use Jenny” and Alexa will say “Jenny jenny bo-benny, banana-fana fo-fenny, fee fi mo-menny, Jenny.” Try using your name!
A simple joke telling app, intended to delight younger children.  Ask "Silly Winnie" - a playful mastiff puppy - for a joke, and she will deliver.

Let's Multiply is a skill that quizzes you on your multiplication table.  You can specify how high you want the questions to go, up to twelve times twelve.  Once you set how high you want to be quizzed on, Let's Multiply will ask you if you want the questions to be in order, or random. As you are learning your multiplication table you may want to start in order, then as you get better and need to be challenged, you can try random problems.  You can say "repeat" to hear a problem again if you didn't hear it the first time.   You can start over any time by saying "Start Over", or just say the new table high value you want to go to, such as "five times five".  At any time you can say "stop" or "cancel" and you will be told the number of correct answers you gave, and the number of incorrect answers you gave, out of the total possible math problems.  So have fun, and learn your multiplication table. Send suggestions, comments, pictures of Alexa teaching you multiplication, etc., to  support@wobblemouth.com.   I'm looking for new ideas to make learning fun with Alexa. Version 1.1.0 - Improved voice recognition handling and processing - Fixed a defect that occasionally caused the skill to stop responding

Let's Add is a skill that quizzes you on addition problems.  You can specify how high you want the questions to go, up to twenty plus twenty.  Once you set how high you want to be quizzed on, Let's Add will ask you if you want the questions to be in order, or random. As you are learning addition you may want to start in order, then as you get better and need to be challenged, you can try random problems.  You can say "repeat" to hear a problem again if you didn't hear it the first time.   You can start over any time by saying "Start Over", or just say the new addition problem maximum values you want to go to, such as "five plus five".  At any time you can say "stop" or "cancel" and you will be told the number of correct answers you gave, and the number of incorrect answers you gave, out of the total possible addition problems.  So have fun, and learn to add. Send suggestions, comments, pictures of Alexa teaching you addition, etc., to  support@wobblemouth.com.   I'm looking for new ideas to make learning fun with Alexa. Version 1.0.0
Performs a version of the alphabet song.

“Cock-a-doodle-doo” - which animal makes that sound? Listen alone or with friends to real animal sounds and guess the animal. With each correct guess, you advance to the next, more difficult level, and earn a title! Will you be the first to master all ten levels? To launch this quiz, say “Start zoo walk”. During the game, you can say "Repeat", "Stop" or "What's the high score". For further assistance, say "Help".
Simple skill that allows parents to tell Alexa to tell their kids to do things.

When you choose your subject, addition, subtraction,  multiplication or division, you'll be given 40 seconds to solve as many problems as you can.  If you can solve 6 questions correctly, you can move on to the next level with more difficult problems. On the menu mode, you can ask 'What's my score?' to track your score. Problems at the higher level will give you more points.
This skill can read news headlines of multiple kinds of news in Northwestern, such as University, Health, Science and Tech, Arts and humanities, nation and world, people and perspectives.

The 'Math Table' skill is used to memorize 12 by 12 standard multiplication tables using a structured drill of recitation. This method of recitation is structured which means that the users understand the structure of the particular multiplication table spoken in front of him/her. For example, users can say "Alexa, open math table" or "Alexa, ask Math Table to open table of 4". For feedback and questions, please write to us at alexa@nectarspot.com
An archaeology themed choose-your-own-adventure skill for small children.

Safety Moment app speaks a unique random safety moment when asked. This can be used as an icebreaker for your safety meetings. Can be used to teach kids about safety - one safety moment at a time. Can also be used by the HSE department for safety awareness.

Guess Me is a fun guessing game where Alexa describes something and you have to guess who or what she is describing. Great for kids, but fun for anyone. In this game, your car keys have been thrown into the middle of a lake full of hungry alligators. Your goal is to rescue your keys from the lake and swim out without getting caught by an alligator.  When you open the skill, you will be presented with a main menu. You can choose to play the game, view your item collection, view the high scores, or learn how to play.  During the main game, you have a choice of three actions. You can either swim forward, dive down into the lake, or act like a wooden log.  Each time you swim, it will take you one step closer to your car keys. When you dive under the water, you may find an item to add to your collection or you might find an underwater current to push you further to your keys.  Every time you swim or dive you there will be a chance that an alligator will show up near you. Until the alligator leaves, you are in danger. With each move you make, the alligator may come up and get you! The only way to protect yourself is to pretend to be a floating log. This will fool the alligator.  You win the game when you get back to shore with your keys. Each round you will be awarded points based on how many items you collected, how many gators you fooled, and and how many moves it took you to win the game. Good luck out there. You're going to need it.

June is an artificial intelligence designed to assist in enhancing your vocabulary, general knowledge and current affairs. A well focused learning is just a 'Hello' away. Interested in knowing some current affairs or some general awareness things, that you should be knowing about ? Well, June is here just for that. You can ask June to start a Vocabulary and get to know new words for the day. You can also ask her to schedule this for you so that June will ask you new words everyday. In addition to that, will also remind you the words that you have learnt earlier. Isn't that something you always wanted but never knew you wanted. Getting bored at home with a bunch of friends? Well you can ask June to set up a Quiz for you and your friend. June will then setup a Multi Player quiz for you and your folks. Should you have any suggestion / feedback / feature request / bug report, please don't hesitate to reach us directly at june@juneai.org For more information, please visit https://juneai.org

Rebus Puzzles is a game where players are given three rebus* word puzzles to solve each day. Players can ask for a hint or for more time as they work to solve the puzzle.  Points are awarded for each correct answer. Badges are earned as players hit certain milestones. The skill is best played on a device with a display (Amazon Echo, Amazon Spot, Fire TV, etc). Players will need to see the puzzles in order to solve them. Puzzles will be sent to the Amazon App if a user is not using a device with a display. *Rebus puzzles are word picture puzzles that are solved by looking at the organization and arrangement of words, letters, and numbers. The puzzles typically represent a saying, word place, person, or thing.

A game designed for kids to manage flowers. Please see the description to know how the game works.   Start your game by saying "open my garden", system will create a new game for you if you don't have previous game record or load your previous game.  After entering the game, say "report" to get the flowers' initial information. You will start your game with one flower in seed stage and you will have maximum of 3 flowers to manage later.  After your caring, the flower will grow to "germination", "growth", "spreading" stages. Try to keep the water amount  and the fertilizer amount as much as you can by saying something like "water flower number one for five times" and "fertilize flower number one for three times", but no more than 100%, which makes the flower drowned and poisoned. flower will be dried out if the water amount drop to 0%. Each action makes 10% difference in the original amount. Yes! the water amount and fertilizer amount is designed to decrease in real time! Check your flowers the second day you play and get a sense of the decreasing speed. The reproduction will happen in spreading stage and the fertilizer amount will influence the reproduction rate of the flower. The more you keep it to the maximum the more possible it will generate the seeds (check back frequently to see if seeds are generated in this stage!) It takes about 11 days to reach spreading stage. If too much water and fertilizer are applied to flowers, try saying "pour out/dig our water/fertilizer on flower number one".  say "give me a hint" for more secrete game information! say "stop" to save and quit. Only deliberately quitting your game will make game saved! say "check my score" to see your score. If you can't play the game for a period of time, you can say "pause" to prevent water and fertilizer dropping till the next time you open the game During some period of the game stage, your flowers may attract birds to drop seeds in the garden!

Animal A B C's is a fun game for children who are learning the alphabet and the sounds that letters make.  The game follows a pattern of Alexa stating a letter and  a corresponding animal name which begins with that letter. Alexa spells the word, repeats the first phrase, and then invites the child to say the phrase.  Here's an example: "A is for alligator." "Alligator is spelled a, l, l, i, g, a, t, o, r." "A is for alligator." "Now it is your turn.  Say "A is for alligator."   Alexa listens for the response before moving to the next letter.  The game is loaded with three different animals (where available) for each letter.  These are presented randomly, so that there is an enormous number of unique variations for this game.   Your child won't be bored by playing the same game over and over again!  When Alexa reaches Z, she gives the child an option to play again.  The child can choose to begin at the beginning, or anywhere from A to Z, just by choosing a letter.  We hope you will love Animal ABC's and let us know by leaving us a 5-star review.  Your feedback gives us reason to keep developing more great skills for Alexa.  To begin, just say "Alexa, open Animal ABC's."  You can also say, "Alexa, play Animal ABC's" or "Alexa, start Animal ABC's.  Happy learning!

Adventures of Moose and Goose is a serialized science fiction podcast for kids that focuses on two sisters with super smarts. Together they were recruited by the Department of Advanced Technology and tasked with exploring history while chasing down the fiendish Frederick Bottomquack.   Join them as they travel through time and learn all about history and science from the people who made it… and that’s just the first two episodes!

Many summers ago life was young. And innocent. Longed to ride with Lakdi Ki Kathi, which is the most played Kids Skill. It will take you to the innocence of kids. It brings the memory to some of the timeless characters from Indian history. “Lakdi ki Kathi, Kathi ka Ghoda”, a song so simple and innocent is very catchy to the tongue among children. It is the impression that is indelible in one's heart and mind. Usage: Session 1: User: Alexa, open lakdi ki kathi Alexa: Starting Lakdi Ki Kathi - You can say, start to play the audio player. User: start Alexa: Lakdi Ki Kathi <Alexa completes the poem or user interruption> User: Alexa, next User: Alexa, stop User: Alexa, shuffle User: Alexa, next / previous User: Alexa, resume User: Alexa, start over User: Yes/No Session 2: User: Alexa, open lakdi ki kathi Alexa: You were listening to Lakdi Ki Kathi, Would you like to resume? User: No (to play Lakdi Ki Kathi from start) / Yes (to play Lakdi Ki Kathi from the last position) Alexa: <Alexa starts over to the first time stamp and you can ask Alexa to step forward by saying Alexa, next> You are listening to the Lakdi Ki Kathi. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Session 3: User: Help Alexa: You are listening to the Lakdi Ki Kathi. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. As indeed are songs of another era; a time when a mother was supposed to be a lullaby specialist and peers co-singers. The time when boys and girls, unspoiled by video games and play stations, would run the streets on warm winter afternoons or sprinkle water on the terrace on summer evenings even as they sang, “Chal Mere Ghode Tik Tik Tik” or “Nani Teri Morni ko Mor Le Gaye”. Parents would merely give an indulgent smile, knowing, like everything, this phase of innocence shall pass too. Now, this Special task of the lullaby is carried by Alexa.  Unobtrusively, they have been part of our growing up years, and in their own ways introduced us to the melody.  Once invoked, Alexa will automatically start the conversation and play the poem. The skills by saying "Alexa, open Lakdi ki Kathi". After invoking Alexa automatically starts the rhyming poem. Once it is finished you can invoke again by saying "Alexa, open Lakdi ki Kathi". The Alexa skill is specially designed for kids of age group 4-13 years old. English version (English): "Alexa, open lakdi ki kathi" Hindi version (Hindi-India):    “Alexa, लकड़ी की काठी शुरू करो” We are continuously adding more and more handpicked rhymes for kids which could bring more value education among them and entertain them.  We want to hear from you! Please write a review if you liked this. For all users in India and the rest parts of the world, the skill responses in Hindi audio.  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Disclaimer ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This “Lakdi ki Kathi Indian rhyme ” Alexa skill is intended for fun and entertainment purposes only. It contains audio in Indian local language ‘Hindi’. Users of this skill are fully aware of the local language and accepted to play the poem with their own knowledge and experience. We have also released various Alexa skills for stories and poems in regional languages in Tamil, Kannada, Telegu, and Bangla.

This bundle features four action-packed, interactive stories, including Cosmic Conquest, The League of Laughs, The Portal of Doom, and The Ultimate Weapon. With simple voice commands, you help Batman, Superman, Wonder Woman, and more save the citizens of Earth from cosmic threats and foil a sinister schemes. With multiple endings, this You Choose bundle is a truly dynamic experience. The first story, Cosmic Conquest is available to all users with the additional stories available with purchase or FreeTime Unlimited subscription.

YOU CHOOSE: EPIC HISTORY is a You Choose bundle from Capstone, powered by Earplay. This bundle features five action-packed, interactive stories, including Ancient China, Ancient Egypt, Colonial America, The Aztec Empire, and The Middle Ages. With simple voice commands, you’ll delve into fascinating time periods, explore different places in history, and learn from different perspectives. With multiple endings, this You Choose bundle is a truly dynamic experience. The first story, Ancient China is available to all users with the additional stories available with purchase or FreeTime Unlimited subscription.

YOU CHOOSE: BUILDING AMERICA is a You Choose bundle from Capstone, powered by Earplay. This bundle features four action-packed, interactive stories, including Ellis Island, The California Gold Rush, Building the Golden Gate Bridge, and Building the Transcontinental Railroad. Jump into an amazing time in the past, where great American structures and institutions are being built! With simple voice commands, you’ll decide who to be, where to go, and what to do. With multiple endings, this You Choose bundle is a truly dynamic experience. The first story, Ellis Island is available to all users with the additional stories available with purchase or FreeTime Unlimited subscription.

Job Explorer provides an interactive exploration environment for children learning about the different professions in the world.  It has launched with four professions, they are:    - astronaut   - doctor   - musician   - Australian tour guide Each profession is championed by a fictional character with a distinctly synthesized voice to help immerse you into the world of that job.  You can learn about the personal story of the character, get facts about the job, learn about related jobs and complete badges.  There are four badges per job focusing on core elements of the job. To earn a badge, the user needs to answer five questions correctly.  The questions keep rotating through the non-answered ones until they are all complete. Badge progress is saved so the you can complete the badges over whatever period of time you like. Please direct feedback and questions to steven.bowden@protonmail.com otherwise you can leave feedback in the Alexa Skill Store which is always appreciated. Privacy Information This skill stores the user progress throughout job badges and job facts to enable continuation of game-play across multiple sessions. No personal information is collected. Data collected by the skill is not shared with any third party and only used for improving the skill performance.

The Legend Sunny needs to be played with an echo show or echo spot. It is an Alexa-powered interactive adventure game with stories adapted from an old legend of the Formosa island. In this skill, you can tell your travel partner, Sunny Mei, what choices to make as you explore the Formosa island with various places, including the Fantasy Lake, Snake Temple, and Crescent Bay.  You will explore the Formosa island by choosing the adventure paths in the following order: 1. Accept Sunny Mei’s invitation to help her find her family in the Formosa island. 2. Select a native animal to ride on the Formosa island. 3. Travel up the Mountains and arrive in the aboriginal tribe. 4. Talk to the aboriginal girl Ah-Wei in the mountain area to find clues about Sunny Mei’s family. 5. Travel to the Fantasy Lake to find Sunny Mei’s family. 6. Explore the Snake Temple to find Sunny Mei’s family. 7. Search for Sunny Mei’s parents in the Crescent Bay.

Discover the Elements is a mind-expanding exploration of the periodic table of the elements, aimed at young people studying science in school, and anyone with a general interest in science. As you explore, you will collect sets of elements, building your own periodic table. This skill is based on the internationally best-selling book and award winning app The Elements, by Theodore Gray, Popular Science Magazine’s Gray Matter columnist. The elements are what we, and everything around us, are made of.  You will discover fascinating facts, figures, and stories of the elements – there’s a lot more to the periodic table than a bunch of numbers and letters!  The quiz sections of this skill are intentionally challenging. So we recomend taking notes while you listen and interact.   FEATURES: - Detailed and current information from Wolfram|Alpha - Fun stories and fascinating facts - Engaging introduction and on-boarding for new users  HELPFUL HINTS: - If you need help at any point in the skill just say "help!" - Wondering how you're doing? say "status update" or "how am I doing?" Keep an eye out for updates as we add new sets to collect!

From the team that helped a three year old go from phonics to reading at a second grade level comes "Letter M. "   Letter M. assesses and reviews the concept of phonics.  The letter M. lesson allows early English readers to practice identifying words that start with "M." to improve phonic fluency.

skill_name: The Case of the Missing Canine
skill_description: "The Case of the Missing Canine" is the first story in The Doggie Investigation Gang, DIG™ series of children's books. The intended audience is second to fourth grade students. While learning third-grade level vocabulary, speaker dialogue and being introduced to chapter books, the reader follows three main dog characters, one of which is blind, as they solve mysteries in an effort to assist others. The three dogs are different breeds and have diverse skill sets. The series incorporates many hidden lessons, including the value of individual strengths and differences; the importance of teamwork; and the reward of caring for each other and assisting others in a time of need. All profits from sales of the first book will be donated to PAWS New England to assist in rescuing the dogs residing at Tipton County Animal Shelter, a high-kill shelter located in Tipton, TN. For more information on the DIG Series, visit the DIG website at digthebooks.com Credits: Shara Puglisi Katsos (Author), John Bulens (Illustrator), Karen Talbot (Illustrator), Chris Plankey (Developer)

It’s an inherent desire of every parent to see their child prosper in the future, emerging as a super-intelligent and conscious human being. So, here is a simple, yet powerful way to achieve it. Now, this trick is being scientifically proven in the most prestigious Institute of Medical Science of India, AIIMS. The research work was carried out for the last 20 years. Before going deep into what Gayatri Mantra means and unravel its magical benefits. It’s important to know the meaning of Mantra first. Mantra is a sacred utterance, a numinous sound, a syllable, word or phonemes, or group of words in Sanskrit believed by practitioners to have psychological and /or spiritual powers. The earliest mantras were composed in Vedic Sanskrit in India, and are at least 3000 years old. Mantras now exist in Hinduism, Buddhism, Jainism, and Sikhism. In the Japanese Shingon tradition, the word Shingon means mantra. Similar hymns, antiphons, chants, composition, and concepts are found in Zoroastrianism, Taoism, Christianity and elsewhere. This mantra should be chanted with closed eyes and with full devotion. Usually 12, 24 or 108 times one can chant. The preferred time for chanting is before noon that is in the morning or in Sandhya Kaal (one hour after sunset). AIIMS has recently confirmed it through the research of the brain activation by MRI, that on chanting Gayatri Mantra over a period of time it expands the Prefrontal cortex of the brain. It was conducted on men of 25 -30 years for a period of 9 months and after that, data was studied for 5 years. It was observed that there are remarkable changes in the brain especially in the prefrontal cortex of the brain. The work of this part is to make a plan, solve problems and to be aware. Those who were reciting the mantras were releasing a chemical called GABA, lack of this chemical causes sleep deprivation and depression-like diseases. Usage User: Alexa, open Gayatri mantra Alexa: Starting Gayatri mantra for kids, please say start or begin User: Start Alexa: Plays the Audio You can always play, resume, pause, stop next or previous and move according to the audio streams. The skill plays audio in Hindi.

Do you want to set your kids up for success? If you do then continue reading. Positive affirmations are phrases/beliefs used to challenge negative or unhelpful thoughts. As children learn behaviours and wire their brain, affirmations are very useful for developing a child's self belief. Every one of us has a strong belief system about the world and ourselves. This was learned from the environment around us. Positive words can help shape this belief system. For example, if your affirmation is "when I fail, I say I can't do it YET, and try again", and you fail at something, the affirmation will trigger in your brain and remind you that you can do it, you just need to keep trying. Without this positive affirmation, you might think that if you fail at something then you can never do it and will just give up without trying again. Simply ask Alexa to get todays positive words for your child. To hear the next word say 'next'

Eat & Sing with Sophie Sprout by Sprout Foods When mealtime's a blast, little ones take more bites. Moms and dads, choose from 3 features led by a tiny talking sprout, Sophie: 1) Songs. Get your little one munching along to fun songs about healthy foods like an Italian folk song about chickpeas or a funk song about oatmeal. 2) Mealtime adventures. Turn your spoon into an adventure machine by taking it on trips like the classic "Here comes the airplane." 3) Eat a pouch with Sophie. She counts and celebrates sips one by one. The next time it’s mealtime, just say, "Alexa, open Sophie Sprout." About Sprout Foods Sprout Foods is on a mission to foster an early love for healthy, whole organic foods. Starting with the first ever complete line of plant powered purees and snacks for babies and toddlers, and now, introducing a new Amazon Alexa skill designed to give parents a hands-free, screen-free way to make healthy eating easy and fun. Hungry for more details? Songs Choose from nine songs: Blueberry, Butternut Squash, Chickpea, Cinnamon, Oatmeal, Spinach, Sweet Potato, Colors, or the Sprout Song played in kid-friendly styles like reggae, rock, polka, country, blues and funk. Just say, "Alexa, ask Sophie Sprout to play a song!" Mealtime Adventures Choose from three adventures: an airplane fight soaring through the air, a choo-choo train riding through the mountains or a delicious bite of food being chased by a stampede of hungry animals. Just say, "Alexa, ask Sophie Sprout for a mealtime adventure!" Eat a Pouch with Sophie Sophie guides little ones through three sips. Each one comes with silly sounds and a big, hearty hip-hip-hooray from Sophie. Just say, "Alexa, ask Sophie Sprout to eat a pouch!" Help make Eat & Sing with Sophie Sprout even better by sending your feedback to: sophiesprout@sproutorganicfoods New ideas for food songs, general feedback, videos of dancing babies, it's all good.
